text: Keywords : mutation operators ; geographic information systems ; mutation testing
label: nsubj punct compound root punct amod compound conj punct compound conj

text: 1. Introduction
label: dep root

text: Mutation - based testing [ 1 ] is a test technique that involves artificially introducing errors into a System Under Test ( SUT ) .
label: compound punct amod nsubj punct appos punct cop det compound root nsubj acl advmod xcomp obj case det obl case nmod punct appos punct punct

text: A mutant is a copy of the system in which a change has been done that , in most cases , will lead to a behaviour different than expected .
label: det nsubj cop det root case det nmod case obl det nsubj aux aux acl nsubj punct case amod obl punct aux acl case det obl amod mark advcl punct

text: The different mutants are generated automatically by the application of mutation operators .
label: det amod nsubj aux root advmod case det obl case compound nmod punct

text: In the state of the art , we have found mutation operators , both general purpose and specific to different technologies , languages and paradigms [ 2 – 9 ] .
label: case det obl case det nmod punct nsubj aux root compound obj punct cc amod compound cc conj case amod obl punct conj cc conj punct dep case nmod punct punct

text: However , these operators are not adequate when trying to test software features associated with specific domains .
label: advmod punct det nsubj cop advmod root advmod advcl mark xcomp compound obj acl case amod obl punct

text: In this article , we propose mutation operators specific to the domain of Geographic Information Systems ( GIS ) applications .
label: case det obl punct nsubj root compound obj amod case det obl case amod compound compound punct appos punct nmod punct

text: These operators reproduce programming errors that are litely to occur during the development of this type of applications .
label: det nsubj root compound obj nsubj cop acl mark xcomp case det obl case det nmod case nmod punct

text: In addition , we present the implementation of these operators and as proof of concept we apply these operators to two real - world GIS applications and we generate the mutants .
label: case obl punct nsubj root det obj case det nmod cc case obl case nmod nsubj conj det obj case nummod amod punct compound compound obl cc nsubj conj det obj punct

text: 2. Mutation Operators for GIS
label: dep compound root case nmod

text: As a previous step to designing the mutation operators , we analyzed the main technologies used specifically in the development of GIS , and we identified typical errors a programmer can introduce during the development .
label: case det amod obl mark acl det compound obj punct nsubj root det amod obj acl advmod case det obl case nmod punct cc nsubj conj amod obj det nsubj aux acl case det obl punct

text: These errors were formalized into mutation operators .
label: det nsubj aux root case compound obl punct

text: In order to apply these operators to a SUT , we rely on Java reflection and aspect - oriented programming .
label: mark fixed mark advcl det obj case det obl punct nsubj root case compound obl cc compound punct amod conj punct

text: Reflection allows us to obtain the list of classes and methods of the SUT , so the user can decide the methods to wish the operators will be applied .
label: nsubj root iobj mark xcomp det obj case nmod cc conj case det nmod punct mark det nsubj aux advcl det obj case obl det nsubj aux aux acl punct

text: Later , we capture information about the methods of the SUT to be mutated , together with the information of the mutation operators that were already defined .
label: advmod punct nsubj root obj case det nmod case det nmod mark aux acl punct advmod case det nmod case det compound nmod nsubj aux advmod acl punct

text: From these data , we generate the mutation operator , in the form of on aspect , which will then be possible to interweave with the SUT which generates a mutant of the SUT .
label: case det obl punct nsubj root det compound obj punct case det obl case det nmod punct nsubj aux advmod cop acl mark xcomp case det obl nsubj advcl det obj case det nmod punct

text: Next , we describe the definition of two operators and two cases of application on real - world GIS applications .
label: advmod punct nsubj root det obj case nummod nmod cc nummod conj case nmod case amod punct compound compound nmod punct

text: ChangeCoordSys Operator ( Listing 1 ) :
label: compound root punct dep dep punct punct

text: It exchanges the coordinate system of a geometry , so it does not match the coordinate system that is being used in the user interface .
label: nsubj root det compound obj case det nmod punct mark nsubj aux advmod advcl det compound obj nsubj aux aux acl case det compound obl punct

text: It simulates the error of not checking that the coordinate system is correct .
label: nsubj root det obj mark advmod acl mark det compound nsubj cop ccomp punct

text: The error is introduced by directly modifying the coordinate system of geometry when recovering the wrapping of the figure .
label: det nsubj aux root mark advmod advcl det compound obj case nmod advmod advcl det obj case det nmod punct

text: Listing 1 : A simplified definition of the ChangeCoordSys Operator .
label: root dep punct det amod appos case det compound nmod punct

text: This operator was applied to a mobile technology GIS application .
label: det nsubj aux root case det amod compound compound obl punct

text: This application allows registering places of interest for the user .
label: det nsubj root xcomp obj case nmod case det obl punct

text: These areas of interest are called Geofences .
label: det nsubj case nmod aux root xcomp punct

text: A Geofence is determined by a geographical location expressed in terms of latitude , longitude , and a radius around that location .
label: det nsubj aux root case det amod obl acl case obl case nmod punct conj punct cc det conj case det nmod punct

text: By creating a Geofence with an erroneous location from its central location , the device will receive incorrect location notifications .
label: mark advcl det obj case det amod nmod case nmod amod obl punct det nsubj aux root amod compound obj punct

text: As a result , the user will see in the application ’s map viewer the Geofences drawn in erroneous zones ( Figure 1 ) .
label: case det obl punct det nsubj aux root case det nmod case compound obl det obj acl case amod obl punct dep dep punct punct

text: Figure 1 . Original and mutant application .
label: root dep punct appos cc amod conj punct

text: BooleanPolygonConstraint Operator ( Listing 2 ) :
label: compound root punct appos dep punct punct

text: It introduces errors in the processing of geometries , manipulating the result of the operations that carry out the verification of different topological restrictions between geometries , such as intersects , covers or overlap .
label: nsubj root obj case det obl case nmod punct advcl det obj case det nmod nsubj acl compound det obj case amod amod nmod case nmod punct case fixed nmod punct conj cc conj punct

text: Listing 2 : A simplified definition of the BooleanPolygonConstraint Operator .
label: root dep punct det amod appos case det compound nmod punct

text: To test this operator it was applied to a land reparcelling system .
label: mark advcl det obj nsubj aux root case det compound amod obl punct

text: The objective of the land reparcelling is to reunify the lands of an owner to facilitate their exploitation .
label: det nsubj case det compound nmod cop mark root det obj case det nmod mark advcl nmod obj punct

text: In this application , the result of the operation between two polygons has been affected .
label: case det obl punct det nsubj case det nmod case nummod nmod aux aux root punct

text: This error causes the incorrect display of the resulting geometry that should be drawn in the user interface after the operation applied to the two initial geometries ( Figure 2 ) .
label: det nsubj root det amod obj case det amod nmod nsubj aux aux acl case det compound obl case det obl acl case det nummod amod obl punct dep dep punct punct

text: Figure 2 . Original and mutant application .
label: root dep punct appos cc amod conj punct

text: 3. Conclusions
label: dep root

text: In existing proposals , we can find both generic and specific mutation operators .
label: case amod obl punct nsubj aux root cc amod cc conj compound obj punct

text: However , these are not adequate to cover errors in particular domains .
label: advmod punct nsubj cop advmod root mark advcl obj case amod obl punct

text: We have defined new operators specific to the GIS domain and a way to apply them to a SUT .
label: nsubj aux root amod obj amod case det compound obl cc det conj mark acl obj case det obl punct

text: In addition , we have tested the operators defined in two GIS applications .
label: case obl punct nsubj aux root det obj acl case nummod compound obl punct

text: As future work , we intend to extend this approach to other domains , as well as to use the developed operators for the automatic improvement of sets of test cases .
label: case amod obl punct nsubj root mark xcomp det obj case amod obl punct cc fixed fixed mark conj det amod obj case det amod obl case nmod case compound nmod punct

text: Replication in Second Language Research :
label: root case amod compound nmod punct

text: Narrative and Systematic Reviews and Recommendations for the Field
label: amod cc conj root cc conj case det nmod

text: Replication studies are considered by many to play a fundamental role in any scientific endeavor .
label: compound nsubj aux root case obl mark xcomp det amod obj case det amod obl punct

text: When using the same materials and procedures as a previous study , replication studies serve to test the reliability of the previous study ’s findings .
label: advmod advcl det amod obj cc conj case det amod nmod punct compound nsubj root mark xcomp det obj case det amod nmod case nmod punct

text: When altering specific methodological or participant characteristics of a previous study , they serve to test generalizability of the earlier findings under different conditions .
label: advmod advcl amod amod cc conj obj case det amod obl punct nsubj root mark xcomp obj case det amod nmod case amod nmod punct

text: One indication of the importance of replication is found in the 50 or more calls for replication research in the field of second language ( L2 ) research alone ( see references for 50 calls and commentaries in Appendix S1 in the Supporting Information online ) : from Santos ( 1989 ) through Polio and Gass 1997 to very recent proposals for specific replication studies , such as Vandergrift and Cross 2017 and even a book - length treatment ( Porte , 2012 ) .
label: nummod nsubj case det nmod case nmod aux root case det nummod cc conj obl case compound nmod case det nmod case amod compound punct appos punct nmod advmod punct dep obj case nummod nmod cc conj case compound obl case det amod nmod advmod punct punct case nmod punct nmod punct case nmod cc conj nmod case advmod amod nmod case amod compound nmod punct case fixed nmod cc conj nmod cc advmod det compound punct compound conj punct dep punct nmod punct punct

text: Beyond these calls , efforts to actively promote and facilitate replication studies have also emerged .
label: case det obl punct nsubj mark advmod acl cc conj compound obj aux advmod root punct

text: For example , the Instruments for Research into Second Languages ( IRIS ) repository ( http://www.irisdatabase.org ) was established in 2011 and holds , at the time of writing , over 3,800 materials that can be used for replication , among other purposes , in L2 research ( Marsden & Mackey , 2014 ; Marsden , Mackey , & Plonsky , 2016 ) .
label: case obl punct det compound case nmod case amod nmod punct appos punct nsubj punct appos punct aux root case obl cc conj punct case det obl mark acl punct advmod nummod obj nsubj aux aux acl case obl punct case amod obl punct case compound obl punct dep cc conj punct nmod punct conj punct conj punct cc conj punct nmod punct punct

text: The Open Science Framework ( https://osf.io ) , also established in 2011 , provides a web infrastructure to facilitate collaboration and has been used for large replication efforts in psychology ( e.g. , Open Science Collaboration , 2015 ) , which continue to make waves in academia ( Laws , 2016 ; Lindsay , 2015 ; Martin & Clarke , 2017 ) and the general media ( Baker , 2015 ; Devlin , 2016 ) .
label: det amod compound nsubj punct appos punct punct advmod acl case obl punct root det compound obj mark advcl obj cc aux aux conj case amod compound obl case nmod punct advmod punct amod compound dep punct nmod punct punct nsubj acl mark xcomp obj case obl punct dep punct nmod punct conj punct nmod punct conj cc conj punct nmod punct cc det amod conj punct dep punct nmod punct conj punct nmod punct punct

text: In some fields , a flourishing metascience , that is , the scientific study of science ( see Munafò et al. , 2017 ) , has included syntheses assessing the quantity and nature of replication efforts , for example , in education ( Makel & Plucker , 2014 and in psychology ( Makel et al. , 2012 ) .
label: case det obl punct det amod nsubj punct advmod fixed punct det amod appos case nmod punct parataxis obj cc conj punct nmod punct punct aux root obj acl det obj cc conj case compound nmod punct case nmod punct case obl punct dep cc conj punct nmod cc case conj punct dep cc conj punct nmod punct punct

text: The driving force behind this battery of calls , commentaries , infrastructure , and metascience is a perceived crisis in the state of replication research .
label: det amod nsubj case det nmod case nmod punct conj punct conj punct cc conj cop det amod root case det nmod case compound nmod punct

text: The severe concerns underpinning the alleged crisis have several dimensions relating to : (a) the ( small ) amount of published replication research ; (b) the ( poor ) quality of replication research ; and (c) the ( lack of ) reproducibility , which refers to the extent to which findings can ( not ) be reproduced in replication attempts that have been undertaken .
label: det amod nsubj acl det amod obj root amod obj acl case punct dep det punct amod punct obl case amod compound nmod punct dep det punct amod punct conj case compound nmod punct cc dep det punct conj case punct nmod punct nsubj acl case det obl case obl nsubj aux punct advmod punct aux acl case compound obl nsubj aux aux acl punct

text: These concerns speak to the very core of science , raising fundamental questions about the validity and reliability of our work .
label: det nsubj root case det amod obl case nmod punct advcl amod obj case det nmod cc conj case nmod nmod punct

text: Indeed , some commentators have called replication the “ gold standard ” of research evidence ( Jasny , Chin , Chong , & Vignieri , 2011 , p. 1225 ) and a “ linchpin of the scientific process ” ( Let ’s replicate , 2006 , p. 330 ) .
label: advmod punct det nsubj aux root obj det punct compound xcomp punct case compound nmod punct dep punct conj punct conj punct cc conj punct nmod punct dep dep punct cc det punct conj case det amod nmod punct punct dep obj xcomp punct obl punct dep dep punct punct

text: In the field of L2 research , given the importance of replication and the 50 calls for replication in L2 research that we identified , one might expect a substantial number of published replication studies by now .
label: case det obl case compound nmod punct advcl det obj case nmod cc det nummod conj case nmod case compound nmod obj nsubj acl punct nsubj aux root det amod obj case amod compound nmod case obl punct

text: However , a perceived lack of prestige , excitement , and originality of replication plagues L2 research ( Porte , 2012 ) , as it does other disciplines ( Berez - Kroeker et al. , 2017 ; Branco , Cohen , Vossen , Ide , & Calzolari , 2017 ; Chambers , 2017 ; Schmidt , 2009 ) , and these perceptions are thought to have caused , at least in part ( directly or indirectly ) , alleged low rates and a poor quality of published replication studies .
label: advmod punct det amod nsubj case nmod punct conj punct cc conj case nmod root compound obj punct dep punct nmod punct punct mark nsubj advcl amod obj punct dep punct flat cc conj punct nmod punct conj punct conj punct conj punct conj punct cc conj punct nmod punct conj punct nmod punct conj punct nmod punct punct cc det nsubj aux conj mark aux xcomp punct case nmod case obl punct advmod cc conj punct punct amod amod obj cc det amod conj case amod compound nmod punct

text: However , a systematic metascience on replication research has not yet been established in the field of L2 research , leaving a poor understanding of the actual number and nature of replication studies that have been published .
label: advmod punct det amod nsubj case compound nmod aux advmod advmod aux root case det obl case compound nmod punct advcl det amod obj case det amod nmod cc conj case compound nmod nsubj aux aux acl punct

text: The current study begins to address this gap through narrative and systematic reviews .
label: det amod nsubj root mark xcomp det obj case amod cc conj obl punct

text: The narrative review considers challenges in replication research and is largely informed by commentaries and metascience from psychology , given that the cognitive and social subdomains of psychology are highly influential in L2 research , and also from education , another key sister discipline .
label: det amod nsubj root obj case compound nmod cc aux advmod conj case obl cc conj case nmod punct advcl mark det amod cc conj nsubj case nmod cop advmod ccomp case compound obl punct cc advmod case conj punct det amod compound appos punct

text: The narrative review is organized around four broad themes : (a) the quantity of replication research , (b) the nature of replication research , (c) the relationship between initial and replication studies , and (d) the interpretation and extent of reproducibility of the findings of initial studies .
label: det amod nsubj aux root case nummod amod obl punct dep det appos case compound nmod punct dep det conj case compound nmod punct dep det conj case amod cc conj nmod punct cc dep det conj cc conj case nmod case det nmod case amod nmod punct

text: To gain insight into these issues in the context of L2 research , the systematic review provides a synthesis of L2 studies in journal articles that self - labeled as replications .
label: mark advcl obj case det nmod case det obl case compound nmod punct det amod nsubj root det obj case compound nmod case compound nmod nsubj compound punct acl case obl punct

text: The research questions and methods of the systematic review were largely determined by the narrative review but also emerged through the design and piloting of the coding instrument .
label: det compound nsubj cc conj case det amod nmod aux advmod root case det amod obl cc advmod conj case det obl cc conj case det amod nmod punct

text: Finally , we offer further discussion and 16 recommendations for future replication work that draw on our narrative and systematic reviews and on our experience of carrying out multisite ( Morgan - Short et al. , 2018 ) 1 and single site ( Faretta - Stutenberg & Morgan - Short , 2011 ; Marsden , Williams , & Liu , 2013 ; McManus & Marsden , 2017 ; Morgan - Short , Heil , Botero - Moriaty , & Ebert , 2012 ) replications .
label: advmod punct nsubj root amod obj cc nummod conj case amod compound nmod nsubj acl case nmod amod cc conj obl cc case nmod conj mark acl compound amod punct dep punct flat cc conj punct nmod punct dep cc amod conj punct dep punct flat cc conj punct flat punct nmod punct conj punct conj punct cc conj punct nmod punct conj cc conj punct nmod punct conj punct flat punct conj punct conj punct flat punct cc conj punct nmod punct obj punct

text: We start from the widely agreed premise that testing the reproducibility of findings should have an essential role in the testing and refinement of theory , at least for hypothesis - testing epistemologies that seek to ascertain generalizability and for other epistemologies in which constructs are deemed to be definable and observable .
label: nsubj root case det advmod amod obl mark csubj det obj case nmod aux acl det amod obj case det nmod cc conj case nmod punct advmod fixed case compound punct compound nmod nsubj acl mark xcomp obj cc case amod conj case obl nsubj aux acl mark cop xcomp cc conj punct

text: Thus , our overall aim is to provide conceptual clarification and an empirical base for future discussion and production of replication studies , with a view to improving the amount and quality of L2 replication research .
label: advmod punct nmod amod nsubj cop mark root amod obj cc det amod conj case amod obl cc conj case compound nmod punct case det obl mark acl det obj cc conj case compound compound nmod punct

text: 1. Introduction
label: dep root

text: Salinity is one of the most important marine parameters , which controls many processes such as physical circulations , biogeochemistry dynamics from regional to global ocean [ 1 , 2 ] .
label: nsubj cop root case det advmod amod amod nmod punct nsubj acl amod obj case fixed amod nmod punct compound conj case amod case obl obl punct dep punct conj punct punct

text: Although drifters and buoys , together with cruises , have accumulated large amount in - situ water salinity data in different regions , it is still difficult to monitor global ocean salinity with high temporal - spatial resolution by the in situ measurements .
label: mark nsubj cc conj punct advmod case obl punct aux advcl amod obj amod punct flat compound compound nmod case amod obl punct expl cop advmod root mark csubj amod compound obj case amod compound punct amod obl case det amod flat obl punct

text: In the past decade , with the successful launch of the soil moisture and ocean salinity ( SMOS ) satellite by the European Space Agency ( ESA ) [ 3 ] , the Aquarius / SAC-D satellite [ 4 ] , and the soil moisture active passive ( SMAP ) satellite [ 5 , 6 ] by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration ( NASA ) , global sea surface salinity ( SSS ) observations from space have become possible and a significant improvement has been made to understand the ocean dynamics and climate change .
label: case det amod obl punct case det amod obl case det compound compound cc compound conj punct appos punct nmod case det amod compound nmod punct appos punct punct dep punct punct det compound cc conj conj punct dep punct punct cc det compound compound amod amod punct parataxis punct conj punct dep punct conj punct case det amod compound cc conj nmod punct appos punct punct amod compound compound compound punct appos punct nsubj case nmod aux root xcomp cc det amod nsubj aux aux conj mark advcl det compound obj cc compound conj punct

text: The early concept of remote sensing of SSS has been demonstrated in the late 1970s with observations by Skylab [ 7 ] and two airborne L - band radiometry experiments [ 8 , 9 ] .
label: det amod nsubj case amod nmod case nmod aux aux root case det amod obl case obl case nmod punct dep punct cc nummod amod compound punct compound compound conj punct dep punct conj punct punct

text: At the end of 1990 , two airborne microwave interferometers , the electronically scanned thinned array radiometer ( ESTAR ) and the scanning low - frequency microwave radiometer ( SLFMR ) , successfully produced SSS maps in coastal areas in agreement with in - situ measurements with an accuracy of about 1 psu .
label: case det obl case nmod punct nummod amod compound nsubj punct det advmod amod amod compound appos punct appos punct cc det amod amod punct compound compound conj punct appos punct punct advmod root compound obj case amod nmod case obl case amod punct flat nmod case det obl case advmod nummod nmod punct

text: Based on many experiments , the L - band is evidenced as the optimal frequency for remote sensing of SSS , which has been adopted by SMOS , Aquarius / SAC-D and SMAP .
label: advcl case amod obl punct det compound punct nsubj aux root case det amod obl case amod nmod case nmod punct nsubj aux aux acl case obl punct conj cc conj cc conj punct

text: However , the sensitivity of satellite measured brightness temperature to SSS is quite low .
label: advmod punct det nsubj case compound amod compound nmod case nmod cop advmod root punct

text: For example , the sensitivity of vertically polarized brightness temperature to SSS variation is 0.4 to 0.8 K/psu for different observing angles and sea surface temperatures ( SST ) , and it is only 0.2 to 0.6 K/psu for the horizontal polarization brightness temperature [ 10 ] .
label: case nmod punct det nsubj case advmod amod compound nmod case compound nmod cop nummod case nmod root case amod compound obl cc compound compound conj punct appos punct punct cc nsubj cop advmod nummod case nmod conj case det amod compound compound obl punct dep punct punct

text: Thus , remote sensing of SSS requires a highly accurate retrieval model .
label: advmod punct amod nsubj case nmod root det advmod amod compound obj punct

text: It is widely accepted that the corrections of the sea surface and atmospheric effects are essential for remote sensing of SSS , since these effects could alter the value of sensor - measured brightness temperature and introduce errors into the SSS retrieval process .
label: expl aux advmod root mark det nsubj case det compound compound cc conj nmod cop csubj case amod obl case nmod punct mark det nsubj aux advcl det obj case compound punct amod compound nmod cc conj obj case det compound compound obl punct

text: Besides the atmospheric effects , the increasing of sea surface emissivity due to the sea surface roughness and foam effects is the main source of error , which could significantly hamper the accuracy of SSS retrieval [ 11 ] .
label: case det amod obl punct det nsubj case compound compound nmod case fixed det compound compound nmod cc compound conj cop det amod root case nmod punct nsubj aux advmod acl det obj case compound nmod punct dep punct punct

text: Over the past decades , the correction for sea surface roughness effects were studied based on the in - situ and airborne measurements ; for example , the experiments made from a tower [ 12 ] , wind and salinity experiments ( WISE ) [ 13 , 14 ] , airborne Passive - Active L - band Sensor ( PALS ) campaign [ 15 ] and Combined Airborne Radio instruments for Ocean and Land Studies ( CAROLS ) campaigns [ 16 , 17 ] .
label: case det amod obl punct det nsubj case compound compound compound nmod aux root advcl case det amod punct flat cc conj obl punct case obl punct det parataxis acl case det obl punct dep punct punct compound cc conj conj punct parataxis punct punct dep punct conj punct punct amod amod punct amod compound punct compound compound punct appos punct conj punct dep punct cc amod amod compound compound case compound cc conj nmod punct appos punct conj punct dep punct conj punct punct

text: Many rough surface emission models have also been developed based on the theoretical and empirical methods .
label: amod amod compound compound nsubj aux advmod aux root advcl case det amod cc conj obl punct

text: Among these models , the small - slope approximation / small perturbation model ( SSA / SPM ) [ 18 , 19 , 20 , 21 ] , two scale model ( TSM ) [ 22 , 23 , 24 ] and empirical / semi-empirical models [ 25 , 26 ] have been widely used by the research community and implemented in different satellite data processing systems .
label: case det obl punct det amod punct compound compound cc amod conj nsubj punct appos cc conj punct punct dep punct conj punct conj punct conj punct punct nummod compound conj punct appos punct punct dep punct conj punct conj punct cc amod cc conj conj punct dep punct conj punct aux aux advmod root case det compound obl cc conj case amod compound compound compound obl punct

text: As the foam effect is significant at high wind speed conditions ( above a threshold of 12 m / s ) due to strong wave breaking , it has been corrected by numerous models ; for example , the semi-empirical models [ 27 , 28 ] and radiative transfer equation ( RTE ) based models [ 29 , 30 ] , which were developed to estimate the foam covered sea surface emissivity .
label: mark det compound nsubj cop advcl case amod compound compound obl punct case det parataxis case nummod nmod case nmod punct case fixed amod compound obl punct nsubj aux aux root case amod obl punct case obl punct det amod parataxis punct dep punct conj punct cc amod compound compound punct appos punct amod conj punct dep punct conj punct punct nsubj aux acl mark advcl det compound amod compound compound obj punct

text: Although many theoretical and empirical models have been developed , some problems are still unsolved .
label: mark amod amod cc conj nsubj aux aux advcl punct det nsubj cop advmod root punct

text: For example , the TSM originally proposed to estimate brightness temperature at higher frequencies , uses the sea surface wave spectrum by multiplying a factor of 2 .
label: case obl punct det nsubj advmod acl mark advcl compound obj case amod obl punct root det compound compound compound obj mark advcl det obj case nmod punct

text: However , whether this modification can be applied to L - band is still unclear , and the choice of cutoff wavenumber is arbitrary and needs to be clarified in the L - band .
label: advmod punct mark det nsubj aux aux csubj case compound punct obl cop advmod root punct cc det nsubj case compound nmod cop conj cc conj mark aux xcomp case det compound punct obl punct

text: Moreover , the sea surface reflection of downwelling atmospheric emission is another contribution to satellite - observed brightness temperature [ 31 ] , thus the determination of the cutoff wavenumber is required not only for sea surface emission but also for reflection .
label: advmod punct det compound compound nsubj case amod amod nmod cop det root case compound punct amod compound nmod punct dep punct punct advmod det nsubj case det compound nmod aux parataxis advmod advmod case compound compound obl cc advmod case conj punct

text: In addition , the widely used empirical models decouple the wind effect from SSS and SST effects , which means that the surface emission is due to a perfectly flat sea surface and the wind - roughened sea surface .
label: case obl punct det advmod amod amod nsubj root det compound obj case compound cc conj obl punct nsubj advcl mark det compound nsubj cop case fixed det advmod amod compound ccomp cc det compound punct amod compound conj punct

text: The wind - roughened sea surface is associated with the increased brightness temperature ( due to sea surface roughness effect ) , which induces regional biases when applied to different areas [ 32 ] .
label: det compound punct amod compound nsubj aux root case det amod compound obl punct case fixed compound compound compound nmod punct punct nsubj acl amod obj advmod advcl case amod obl punct dep punct punct

text: Furthermore , the satellite measurements of SSS are hampered by the effect of radio frequency interference ( RFI ) in offshore areas of China ( i.e. , Bohai sea , Yellow sea and East China sea ) , which causes a large amount of data to be discarded [ 33 ] .
label: advmod punct det compound nsubj case nmod aux root case det obl case compound compound nmod punct appos punct case amod nmod case nmod punct advmod punct compound appos punct amod conj cc compound compound conj punct punct nsubj acl det amod iobj case nmod mark aux xcomp punct dep punct punct

text: Thus , the compatibility of these models in coastal area of China needs to be assessed and tested in order to achieve higher accuracies of SSS from the space - borne observations .
label: advmod punct det nsubj case det nmod case amod nmod case nmod root mark aux xcomp cc conj mark fixed mark advcl amod obj case nmod case det compound punct amod obl punct

text: Discussion
label: root

text: We have shown that the addition of an artificial tail during ontogeny can produce postural and locomotory changes in chickens , consistent with the posture and kinematics inferred for non-avian dinosaurs [ 5 ] , [ 6 ] , [ 11 ] .
label: nsubj aux root mark det nsubj case det amod nmod case nmod aux ccomp amod cc conj obj case nmod punct amod case det obl cc conj acl case amod obl punct dep punct punct punct dep punct punct punct dep punct punct

text: The posterior displacement of the CoM produced a more vertically oriented femur during standing ( femur in experimental animals was 40 % more vertical than control subjects ) , and increased femoral retraction and decreased knee flexion during walking .
label: det amod nsubj case det nmod root det advmod advmod amod obj case obl punct nsubj case amod nmod cop nummod obl advmod parataxis case compound obl punct punct cc conj amod obj cc conj compound obj case obl punct

text: These results indicate a shift from the standard bird , knee - driven bipedal locomotion to a more hip - driven locomotion , typical of crocodilians ( the only other extant archosaur group ) , mammals , and hypothetically , bipedal non-avian dinosaurs .
label: det nsubj root det obj case det amod compound punct compound punct amod amod nmod case det advmod obl punct amod nmod punct amod case obl punct det advmod amod amod compound appos punct punct conj punct cc advmod punct amod amod conj punct

text: These postural and kinematics changes can not be attributed to an increased weight as subjects of the control - weight group did not show the same changes as the experimental group .
label: det amod cc conj nsubj aux advmod aux root case det amod obl mark nsubj case det compound punct compound nmod aux advmod advcl det amod obj case det amod nmod punct

text: In fact , the control - weight subjects showed a more horizontally oriented femur during walking with respect to the control group , similar to that observed in Carrano and Biewener 's experimental subjects [ 7 ] .
label: case obl punct det compound punct compound nsubj root det advmod advmod amod obj case obl case obl case det compound nmod punct amod case obl acl case nmod cc conj case amod obl punct dep punct punct

text: Therefore , we conclude that the location of the CoM can be a key factor in defining limb posture and kinematics .
label: advmod punct nsubj root mark det nsubj case det nmod aux cop det amod ccomp mark acl compound obj cc conj punct

text: It has been proposed that the relative mass of the CFL can be used as a proxy to estimate the relative importance of femoral retraction during locomotion in extinct bipedal dinosaurs [ 8 ] .
label: expl aux aux root mark det amod nsubj case det nmod aux aux csubj case det obl mark advcl det amod obj case amod nmod case nmod case amod amod nmod punct dep punct punct

text: Our data show that for a given CFL mass , femoral retraction can be greatly affected by the location of the CoM and limb postures .
label: nmod nsubj root mark case det amod compound obl punct amod nsubj aux aux advmod ccomp case det obl case det nmod cc compound conj punct

text: Furthermore , limb retraction can be markedly modulated with speed [ 5 ] , suggesting caution when using simple morphological parameters to estimate functional relationships .
label: advmod punct compound nsubj aux aux advmod root case obl punct dep punct punct advcl obj advmod acl amod amod obj mark advcl amod obj punct

text: Differences in limb orientation can produce substantial differences in loading regimes on limb bones .
label: nsubj case compound nmod aux root amod obj case compound nmod case compound nmod punct

text: The orientation of each limb element to the ground reaction force ( GRF ) indicates the relative contribution of axial and bending forces to external bone loading : a bone perpendicular to the GRF is expected experience greater bending forces than one parallel to the GRF .
label: det nsubj case det compound nmod case det compound compound nmod punct appos punct root det amod obj case amod cc conj nmod case amod compound nmod punct det nsubj amod case det obl aux parataxis xcomp amod compound obj case nmod amod case det obl punct

text: Because bone adapts to its loading environment [ 19 ] , [ 20 ] , [ 21 ] , geometric information from limb bones , such as lengths and cross-sectional geometry , are expected to reflect differences in loading regimes and consequently in behavior and locomotor patterns [ 22 ] , [ 23 ] .
label: mark nsubj advcl case nmod compound obl punct dep punct punct punct dep punct punct punct dep punct punct amod nsubj case compound nmod punct case fixed nmod cc amod conj punct aux root mark xcomp obj case compound nmod cc advmod case compound cc conj conj punct dep punct punct punct dep punct punct

text: In this framework , scaling differences in femoral geometry between non-avian theropods and birds have been suggested to be the result of postural differences between these groups [ 6 ] , [ 23 ] .
label: case det obl punct compound nsubj case amod nmod case amod nmod cc conj aux aux root mark cop det xcomp case amod nmod case det nmod punct dep punct punct punct dep punct punct

text: Birds have relatively shorter , stouter femora than non-avian theropods , presumed to be associated with more horizontal orientation .
label: nsubj root advmod amod punct amod obj case amod nmod punct acl mark aux xcomp case advmod amod obl punct

text: Experimental manipulations of femoral orientation in chickens suggest that torsional loads increase as the femur becomes more horizontal [ 7 ] supporting the idea that postural differences could be reflected in differences in limb cross-sectional geometry .
label: amod nsubj case amod nmod case nmod root mark amod nsubj ccomp mark det nsubj advcl advmod xcomp punct dep punct advcl det obj mark amod nsubj aux aux acl case obl case compound amod nmod punct

text: To test if the postural differences observed in this study produced changes in limb morphology , we measured the length and mid-shaft cross-sectional properties of the femur in all our individuals .
label: mark advcl mark det amod nsubj acl case det obl ccomp obj case compound nmod punct nsubj root det obj cc amod amod conj case det nmod case det nmod nmod punct

text: However , we found no differences in cross-sectional femoral geometry among groups .
label: advmod punct nsubj root det obj case amod amod nmod case nmod punct

text: Maybe this is not surprising considering that a recent study analyzing the relationship between posture and femur cross-sectional properties failed to find differences between birds and non-avian theropods [ 24 ] , suggesting that simple morphological correlates of limb posture should be used with caution .
label: advmod nsubj cop advmod root advcl mark det amod nsubj acl det obj case nmod cc compound amod conj ccomp mark xcomp obj case nmod cc amod conj punct dep punct punct advcl mark amod amod nsubj case compound nmod aux aux ccomp case obl punct

text: Interestingly , femur length tended to be greater in the experimental group than in both the control - weight and the control group ( by 4 and 7 % , respectively ) , although not signifcant .
label: advmod punct compound nsubj root mark cop xcomp case det amod obl mark case cc det compound punct advcl cc det compound conj punct case nummod cc conj obl punct nmod punct punct mark advmod advcl punct

text: Longer limbs are expected to experience larger bending and torsional moments , so the fact that experimental animals had longer femora suggests that limb verticalization reduces these moments by orienting the bone more parallel to the GRF line of action .
label: amod nsubj aux root mark xcomp amod compound cc conj obj punct advmod det nsubj mark amod nsubj acl amod obj parataxis mark compound nsubj ccomp det obj mark advcl det obj advmod xcomp case det compound obl case nmod punct

text: If this were the case , it would support the idea that non-avian theropods have relatively thinner femora than extant birds because of postural differences [ 6 ] .
label: mark nsubj cop det advcl punct nsubj aux root det obj mark amod nsubj acl advmod amod obj case amod obl case fixed amod obl punct dep punct punct

text: The present study was inspired by Carrano & Biewener [ 7 ] but our results differed markedly from theirs .
label: det amod nsubj aux root case obl cc conj punct dep punct cc nmod nsubj conj advmod case obl punct

text: We suggest that the different outcomes are due to the distinct rearing and exercising conditions used in each study , in addition to the different artificial tails used .
label: nsubj root mark det amod nsubj cop ccomp case det amod compound cc conj obl acl case det obl punct case nmod case det amod amod nmod acl punct

text: First , our experimental subjects lived in a large enclosure under conditions that allowed them to exercise all day long .
label: advmod punct nmod amod nsubj root case det amod obl case obl nsubj acl iobj mark xcomp det obl advmod punct

text: In Carrano & Biewener 's study , experimental chickens were housed individually in smaller cages and were only allowed to exercise 20 minutes per day , 3 days per week , from the 6th to the 12th week .
label: case nmod cc conj case obl punct amod nsubj aux root advmod case amod obl cc aux advmod conj mark xcomp nummod obl case nmod punct nummod obl case nmod punct case det obl case det amod obl punct

text: Second , in their study , a lead mass was attached at the distal end of the experimental tail , probably generating excessive displacement of the CoM .
label: advmod punct case nmod obl punct det amod nsubj aux root case det amod obl case det amod nmod punct advmod advcl amod obj case det nmod punct

text: During avian evolution , the loss of the CFL and reorganization of the pelvic musculature [ 5 ] , [ 13 ] could have made birds unable to properly carry a postacetabular mass equivalent to that carried by non-avian theropods [ 5 ] , [ 6 ] .
label: case amod obl punct det nsubj case det nmod cc conj case det amod nmod punct dep punct punct punct dep punct aux aux root obj amod mark advmod xcomp det amod obj amod case obl acl case amod obl punct dep punct punct punct dep punct punct

text: In our experimental setup , we attempted to more closely mimic non-avian theropod tail morphology , in which mass is distributed through a distally tapering tail .
label: case nmod amod obl punct nsubj root mark advmod advmod xcomp amod compound compound obj punct case obl nsubj aux acl case det advmod amod obl punct

text: In addition , we reduced the total tail mass to 15 % body mass from the 20 % body mass used by Carrano and Biewener .
label: case obl punct nsubj root det amod compound obj case nummod compound compound obl case det nummod compound compound obl acl case obl cc conj punct

text: Thus , our study seems to have generated a more gradual and less pronounced change in the moment of inertia produced by the artificial tail , allowing experimental subjects to adjust to the posterior mass by adopting a more vertical position of the femur while standing .
label: advmod punct nmod nsubj root mark aux xcomp det advmod amod cc advmod conj obj case det nmod case nmod acl case det amod obl punct advcl amod iobj mark xcomp case det amod obl mark advcl det advmod amod obj case det nmod mark advcl punct

text: Interestingly , the femur kinematics during walking in our control - weight group resembles the results reported in the experimental subjects of Carrano and Biewener .
label: advmod punct det compound nsubj case nmod case nmod compound punct compound nmod root det obj acl case det amod obl case nmod cc conj punct

text: This suggests that their results could be partially explained as a response to the increased loading rather than to the displacement of the CoM .
label: nsubj root mark nmod nsubj aux aux advmod ccomp case det obl case det amod nmod cc fixed case det conj case det nmod punct

text: Due to the phylogenetic relatedness , extant birds have been used to inform functional aspects of non-avian dinosaur locomotion .
label: case fixed det amod obl punct amod nsubj aux aux root mark advcl amod obj case amod compound nmod punct

text: However , substantial differences in hindlimb morphology between these groups make difficult to assess the validity of inferences obtained from such studies .
label: advmod punct amod nsubj case compound nmod case det nmod root xcomp mark xcomp det obj case nmod acl case amod obl punct

text: It has even been proposed that , due to functional convergence , mammals might be a better system to study bipedal dinosaur locomotion [ 7 ] , [ 23 ] , but the results reported here show that important aspects of non-avian theropod locomotion can be experimentally recreated in modern birds .
label: expl aux advmod aux root mark punct case fixed amod nmod punct nsubj aux cop det amod csubj mark acl amod compound obj punct dep punct punct punct dep punct punct cc det nsubj acl advmod conj mark amod nsubj case amod compound nmod aux aux advmod ccomp case amod obl punct

text: One caveat , however , is that our approach uses tail reduction as the mechanism for CoM displacement despite it has been recently shown that the evolutionary change in CoM position was driven instead by forelimb enlargement [ 8 ] .
label: nummod nsubj punct advmod punct cop mark nmod nsubj root compound obj case det obl case compound nmod mark expl aux aux advmod advcl mark det amod nsubj case compound nmod aux csubj advmod case compound obl punct dep punct punct

text: Nonetheless , this does not mean that tail reduction had no effect on CoM displacement , but that it was not the most important factor .
