text: Thank you also to our colleagues from across the White House and NASA and everyone else joining us from home .
label: root obj advmod case nmod obl case case det amod nmod cc conj cc conj advmod acl obj case obl punct

text: So , yes , as Chair of the National Space Council , I know that today represents an exciting new chapter in the exploration of our universe .
label: advmod punct discourse punct case obl case det amod compound nmod punct nsubj root mark nsubj ccomp det amod amod obj case det nmod case nmod nmod punct

text: From the beginning of history , humans have looked up to the night sky with wonder .
label: case det obl case nmod punct nsubj aux root advmod case det compound obl case obl punct

text: And thanks to dedicated people who have been working for decades in engineering and on scientific marvels , we can look to the sky with new understanding .
label: cc obl case amod nmod nsubj aux aux acl case obl case obl cc case amod conj punct nsubj aux root case det obl case amod obl punct

text: When NASA launched the Hubble Space Telescope in 1990 , we were able to see the stars unobstructed by the Earth ’s atmosphere and understand the universe in ways we could have never imagined even a few decades earlier .
label: advmod nsubj advcl det compound compound obj case obl punct nsubj cop root mark xcomp det obj advcl case det nmod case obl cc conj det obj case obl nsubj aux aux advmod acl advmod det amod obl advmod punct

text: And now we enter a new phase of scientific discovery .
label: cc advmod nsubj root det amod obj case amod nmod punct

text: Building on the legacy of Hubble , the James Webb Space Telescope allows us to see deeper into space than ever before and in stunning clarity .
label: advcl case det obl case nmod punct det compound flat compound nsubj root iobj mark xcomp advmod case obl case advmod obl cc case amod conj punct

text: It will enhance what we know about the origins of our universe , our solar system , and possibly life itself .
label: nsubj aux root obj nsubj acl case det obl case nmod nmod punct nmod amod conj punct cc advmod conj nmod punct

text: This was made possible by partnership among nations .
label: nsubj aux root xcomp case obl case nmod punct

text: And it is an example of how the scientific endeavor can build upon the international rules and norms that govern our cooperation in space .
label: cc nsubj cop det root case nmod det amod nsubj aux advcl case det amod obl cc conj nsubj acl nmod obj case nmod punct

text: This telescope is one of humanity ’s great engineering achievements .
label: det nsubj cop root case nmod case amod compound nmod punct

text: And the images we will see today are a testament to the amazing work done by the thousands of workers across our nation who dedicated years to this project .
label: cc det nsubj nsubj aux acl obl cop det root case det amod nmod acl case det obl case nmod case nmod nmod nsubj acl obj case det obl punct

text: They embarked on this complex endeavor for the benefit of humankind , and in the process , accelerated American innovation , strengthened partnerships with our allies , and will undoubtedly inspire generations to look to the heavens with excitement and ambition .
label: nsubj root case det amod obl case det obl case nmod punct cc case det obl punct conj amod obj punct conj obj case nmod nmod punct cc aux advmod conj obj mark xcomp case det obl case obl cc conj punct

text: With that , it is my great honor to introduce a leader who has always believed in the power of American innovation and international cooperation to achieve the remarkable : our President , the President of the United States , Joe Biden .
label: case obl punct expl cop nmod amod root mark csubj det obj nsubj aux advmod acl case det obl case amod nmod cc amod conj mark acl det obj punct nmod appos punct det appos case det amod nmod punct appos flat punct

text: THE PRESIDENT :
label: det root punct

text: Well , it ’s great to be with you all .
label: discourse punct expl cop root mark cop case csubj det punct

text: And I was going to say “ good afternoon , ” but we ’re starting this meeting late because I was engaged in preparing for a trip to the Middle East .
label: cc nsubj aux root mark xcomp punct amod ccomp punct punct cc nsubj aux conj det obj advmod mark nsubj aux advcl mark advcl case det obl case det amod nmod punct

text: But today is a historic day .
label: cc nsubj cop det amod root punct

text: And thank you , Vice President Harris , Chair of the National Space Council .
label: cc root obj punct compound vocative flat punct appos case det amod compound nmod punct

text: And thank you , my dear friend and our outstanding NASA Administrator and the guy — the only guy here who ’s been in space , Bill Nelson .
label: cc root obj punct nmod amod vocative cc nmod amod compound conj cc det reparandum punct det amod conj advmod nsubj aux cop case acl punct appos flat punct

text: Bill , you ’re a good friend .
label: vocative punct nsubj cop det amod root punct

text: Thank you very much for what you ’re doing .
label: root obj advmod advmod case obl nsubj aux acl punct

text: And — and , Dr. Nelson , you ’re doing a great job leading this Office of Science and Technology Policy .
label: cc punct cc punct vocative flat punct nsubj aux root det amod obj advcl det obj case compound cc conj nmod punct

text: It really is a matter — it really is amazing .
label: nsubj advmod cop det reparandum punct nsubj advmod cop root punct

text: Six and a half months ago , a rocket launched from Earth carrying the world ’s newest , most powerful deep - space telescope on a journey one million miles into the cosmos — first of all , that blows my mind : a million miles into the cosmos — along the way unfolding itself , deploying a mirror 21 feet wide , a sunshield the size of a tennis court , and 250,000 tiny shutters , each one smaller than a grain of sand .
label: nummod cc det conj obl advmod punct det nsubj root case obl advcl det nmod case amod punct advmod amod amod punct compound obj case det obl compound nummod nmod case det nmod punct obl case obl punct nsubj parataxis nmod obj punct det nummod parataxis case det nmod punct case det obl advcl obj punct advcl det obj nummod obl amod punct det conj det nmod case det compound nmod punct cc nummod amod conj punct det nsubj acl case det obl case nmod punct

text: Put together , it ’s a new window into the history of our universe .
label: advcl advmod punct nsubj cop det amod root case det nmod case nmod nmod punct

text: And today , we ’re going to get a glimpse of the first light to shine through that window — light from other worlds , orbiting stars far beyond our own .
label: cc obl punct nsubj aux root mark xcomp det obj case det amod nmod mark acl case det obl punct appos case amod nmod punct acl obj advmod case nmod nmod punct

text: It ’s astounding to me when I read this and saw the — I mean , it really is .
label: nsubj cop root case obl advmod nsubj advcl obj cc conj obj punct nsubj parataxis punct nsubj advmod parataxis punct

text: It ’s — it ’s — anyway , I do n’t want to — I ’ll see what they think when we see this .
label: nsubj reparandum punct nsubj reparandum punct advmod punct nsubj aux advmod reparandum xcomp punct nsubj aux root obj nsubj acl advmod nsubj advcl obj punct

text: But light where stars were born and from where they die .
label: cc root advmod nsubj aux acl cc case conj nsubj advcl punct

text: Light from the oldest galaxies .
label: root case det amod nmod punct

text: The oldest documented light in the history of the universe from over 13 billion — let me say that again : 13 billion years ago .
label: det amod amod root case det nmod case det nmod case advmod compound nummod punct parataxis obj xcomp obj advmod punct compound parataxis obl nmod punct

text: It ’s hard to even fathom .
label: nsubj cop root mark advmod xcomp punct

text: Tomorrow , when this image is shared with the world , it will be a historic moment for science and technology , for astronomy and space exploration , for America and all of humanity .
label: obl punct advmod det nsubj aux advcl case det obl punct nsubj aux cop det amod root case nmod cc conj punct case conj cc compound conj punct case conj cc conj case nmod punct

text: You know , as an international collaboration , this telescope embodies how America leads the world not by the example of our power , but the power of our example .
label: nsubj parataxis punct case det amod obl punct det nsubj root obj nsubj advcl det obj advmod case det obl case nmod nmod punct cc det conj case nmod nmod punct

text: A partnership with others , it symbolizes the relentless spirit of American ingenuity .
label: det dislocated case nmod punct nsubj root det amod obj case amod nmod punct

text: And it shows what we can achieve , what more we can discover , not just about distant places , but about our very own planet and climate , like NASA ’s Earth System Observatory that we launched last year .
label: cc nsubj root obj nsubj aux acl punct appos advmod nsubj aux acl punct advmod advmod case amod obl punct cc case nmod amod amod conj cc conj punct case nmod case compound compound nmod obj nsubj acl amod obl punct

text: That ’s why the federal government must invest — must invest in science and technology , more than we have in the past .
label: nsubj cop root det amod nsubj aux reparandum punct aux advcl case obl cc conj punct advmod mark nsubj advcl case det obl punct

text: These images are going to remind the world that America can do big things .
label: det nsubj aux root mark xcomp det iobj mark nsubj aux ccomp amod obj punct

text: And they ’ll remind the American people , especially our children , that there ’s nothing beyond our capacity — nothing beyond our capacity .
label: cc nsubj aux root det amod iobj punct advmod nmod appos punct mark expl ccomp nsubj case nmod nmod punct appos case nmod nmod punct

text: We can see possibilities no one has ever seen before .
label: nsubj aux root obj det nsubj aux advmod acl advmod punct

text: We can go places no one has ever gone before .
label: nsubj aux root obl det nsubj aux advmod acl advmod punct

text: You know , you ’ve — you ’ve heard me say it over and over again .
label: nsubj parataxis punct nsubj reparandum punct nsubj aux root obj xcomp obj advmod cc conj advmod punct

text: America is defined by one single word : possibilities .
label: nsubj aux root case nummod amod obl punct appos punct

text: Possibilities .
label: root punct

text: I want to thank the team at NASA for once again showing that that ’s who we are — that ’s who we are as a nation : a nation of possibilities .

text: And now let ’s take a look at the very first image from this miraculous telescope .

text: The Texas War for Independence
label: det compound root case nmod

text: Many Americans who migrated to Texas at the invitation of the Mexican government did not completely shed their identity or loyalty to the United States .
label: amod nsubj nsubj acl case obl case det obl case det amod nmod aux advmod advmod root nmod obj cc conj case det amod nmod punct

text: They brought American traditions and expectations with them ( including , for many , the right to own slaves ) .
label: nsubj root amod obj cc conj case obl punct case punct case nmod punct det nmod mark acl obj punct punct

text: For instance , the majority of these new settlers were Protestant , and though they were not required to attend the Catholic mass , Mexico 's prohibition on the public practice of other religions upset them and they routinely ignored it .
label: case obl punct det nsubj case det amod nmod cop root punct cc mark nsubj aux advmod advcl mark xcomp det amod obj punct nmod case nsubj case det amod nmod case amod nmod conj obj cc nsubj advmod conj obj punct

text: Accustomed to representative democracy , jury trials , and the defendant ’s right to appear before a judge , the Anglo - American settlers in Texas also disliked the Mexican legal system , which provided for an initial hearing by an alcalde , an administrator who often combined the duties of mayor , judge , and law enforcement officer .
label: acl case amod obl punct compound conj punct cc det nmod case conj mark acl case det obl punct det compound punct amod nsubj case nmod advmod root det amod amod obj punct nsubj acl case det amod obl case det nmod punct det appos nsubj advmod acl det obj case nmod punct conj punct cc compound compound conj punct

text: The alcalde sent a written record of the proceeding to a judge in Saltillo , the state capital , who decided the outcome .
label: det nsubj root det amod obj case det nmod case det obl case nmod punct det compound appos punct nsubj acl det obj punct

text: Settlers also resented that at most two Texas representatives were allowed in the state legislature .
label: nsubj advmod root mark case nmod nummod compound nsubj aux ccomp case det compound obl punct

text: Their greatest source of discontent , though , was the Mexican government 's 1829 abolition of slavery .
label: nmod amod nsubj case nmod punct advmod punct cop det amod nmod case compound root case nmod punct

text: Most American settlers were from southern states , and many had brought slaves with them .
label: amod amod nsubj cop case amod root punct cc nsubj aux conj obj case obl punct

text: Mexico tried to accommodate them by maintaining the fiction that the slaves were indentured servants .
label: nsubj root mark xcomp obj mark advcl det obj mark det nsubj cop amod acl punct

text: But American slaveholders in Texas distrusted the Mexican government and wanted Texas to be a new U.S. slave state .
label: cc amod nsubj case nmod root det amod obj cc conj obj mark cop det amod compound compound xcomp punct

text: The dislike of most for Roman Catholicism ( the prevailing religion of Mexico ) and a widely held belief in American racial superiority led them generally to regard Mexicans as dishonest , ignorant , and backward .
label: det nsubj case nmod case amod nmod punct det amod appos case nmod punct cc det advmod amod conj case amod amod nmod root obj advmod mark xcomp obj case obl punct conj punct cc conj punct

text: Figure 1.3
label: root dep

text: This 1833 map shows the extent of land grants made by Mexico to American settlers in Texas .
label: det compound nsubj root det obj case compound nmod acl case obl case amod obl case nmod punct

text: Nearly all are in the eastern portion of the state , one factor that led to war with Mexico in 1846 .
label: advmod nsubj cop case det amod root case det nmod punct nummod parataxis nsubj acl case obl case nmod case obl punct

text: Image credit : Holley ( Armstrong & Plaskitt ) , Public Domain
label: compound root punct dep punct appos cc conj punct punct amod dep

text: Belief in their own superiority inspired some Texans to try to undermine the power of the Mexican government .
label: nsubj case nmod amod nmod root det obj mark xcomp mark xcomp det obj case det amod nmod punct

text: When empresario Haden Edwards attempted to evict people who had settled his land grant before he gained title to it , the Mexican government nullified its agreement with him .
label: advcl nsubj flat flat advcl mark xcomp obj nsubj aux acl nmod compound obj mark nsubj advcl obj case obl punct det amod nsubj root nmod obj case nmod punct

text: Outraged , Edwards and a small party of men took prisoner the alcalde of Nacogdoches .
label: advcl punct nsubj cc det amod conj case nmod root xcomp det obj case nmod punct

text: The Mexican army marched to the town , and Edwards and his troops then declared the formation of the Republic of Fredonia between the Sabine and Rio Grande Rivers .
label: det amod nsubj root case det obl punct cc nsubj cc nmod conj advmod conj det obj case det nmod case nmod case det compound cc conj flat nmod punct

text: To demonstrate loyalty to their adopted country , a force led by Stephen Austin hastened to Nacogdoches to support the Mexican army .
label: mark advcl obj case nmod amod nmod punct det nsubj acl case obl flat root case obl mark advcl det amod obj punct

text: Edwards ’s revolt collapsed , and the revolutionaries fled Texas .
label: nmod case nsubj root punct cc det nsubj conj obj punct

text: The growing presence of American settlers in Texas , their reluctance to abide by Mexican law , and their desire for independence caused the Mexican government to grow wary .
label: det amod nsubj case amod nmod case nmod punct nmod conj mark acl case amod obl punct cc nmod conj case nmod root det amod iobj mark xcomp xcomp punct

text: In 1830 , it forbade future U.S. immigration and increased its military presence in Texas .
label: case obl punct nsubj root amod compound obj cc conj nmod amod obj case nmod punct

text: Settlers continued to stream illegally across the long border ; by 1835 , after immigration resumed , there were twenty thousand Anglo - Americans in Texas .
label: nsubj root mark xcomp advmod case det amod obl punct case obl punct mark nsubj advcl punct expl parataxis nummod nummod compound punct nsubj case obl punct

text: Fifty - five delegates from the Anglo - American settlements gathered in 1831 to demand the suspension of customs duties , the resumption of immigration from the United States , better protection from Indian tribes , the granting of promised land titles , and the creation of an independent state of Texas separate from Coahuila .
label: nummod punct compound nsubj case det compound punct amod nmod root case obl mark advcl det obj case compound nmod punct det conj case nmod case det amod nmod punct amod conj case amod nmod punct det conj case amod compound nmod punct cc det conj case det amod nmod case nmod acl case obl punct

text: Ordered to disband , the delegates reconvened in early April 1833 to write a constitution for an independent Texas .
label: advcl mark xcomp punct det nsubj root case amod obl nmod mark advcl det obj case det amod nmod punct

text: Surprisingly , General Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna , Mexico ’s new president , agreed to all demands , except the call for statehood .
label: advmod punct nsubj flat flat flat flat flat punct nmod case amod appos punct root case det obl punct case det nmod case nmod punct

text: Coahuila y Texas made provisions for jury trials , increased Texas ’s representation in the state legislature , and removed restrictions on commerce .
label: nsubj flat flat root obj case compound nmod punct conj nmod case obj case det compound nmod punct cc conj obj case nmod punct

text: Figure 1.4
label: root dep

text: This portrait of General Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna depicts the Mexican president and general in full military regalia .
label: det nsubj case nmod flat flat flat flat flat root det amod obj cc conj case amod amod nmod punct

text: Image credit : Public Domain
label: compound root punct amod dep

text: Texans ' hopes for independence were quashed in 1834 , however , when Santa Anna dismissed the Mexican Congress and abolished all state governments , including that of Coahuila y Texas .
label: nmod case nsubj case nmod aux root case obl punct advmod punct advmod nsubj flat advcl det amod obj cc conj det compound obj punct case nmod case nmod flat flat punct

text: In January 1835 , reneging on earlier promises , he dispatched troops to the town of Anahuac to collect customs duties .
label: case obl nmod punct advcl case amod obl punct nsubj root obj case det obl case nmod mark advcl compound obj punct

text: Lawyer and soldier William B. Travis and a small force marched on Anahuac in June , and the fort surrendered .
label: nsubj cc conj appos flat flat cc det amod conj root case obl case obl punct cc det nsubj conj punct

text: On October 2 , Anglo - American forces met Mexican troops at the town of Gonzales ; the Mexican troops fled and the Americans moved on to take San Antonio .
label: case compound obl punct compound punct amod nsubj root amod obj case det obl case nmod punct det amod nsubj parataxis cc det nsubj conj advmod mark advcl obj flat punct

text: Now more cautious , delegates to the Consultation of 1835 at San Felipe de Austin voted against declaring independence , instead drafting a statement , which became known as the Declaration of Causes , promising continued loyalty if Mexico returned to a constitutional form of government .
label: advmod advmod advcl punct nsubj case det nmod case nmod case nmod flat flat flat root mark advcl obj punct advmod advcl det obj punct nsubj acl xcomp case det obl case nmod punct acl amod obj mark nsubj advcl case det amod obl case nmod punct

text: They selected Henry Smith , leader of the Independence Party , as governor of Texas and placed Sam Houston , a former soldier who had been a congressman and governor of Tennessee , in charge of its small military force .
label: nsubj root obj flat punct appos case det compound nmod punct case obl case nmod cc conj obj flat punct det amod appos nsubj aux cop det acl cc conj case nmod punct case obl case nmod amod amod nmod punct

text: The Consultation delegates met again in March 1836 .
label: det compound nsubj root advmod case obl nmod punct

text: They declared their independence from Mexico and drafted a constitution calling for an American - style judicial system and an elected president and legislature .
label: nsubj root nmod obj case nmod cc conj det obj acl case det amod punct compound amod obl cc det amod conj cc conj punct

text: Significantly , they also established that slavery would not be prohibited in Texas .
label: advmod punct nsubj advmod root mark nsubj aux advmod aux ccomp case obl punct

text: Many wealthy Tejanos supported the push for independence , hoping for liberal governmental reforms and economic benefits .
label: amod amod nsubj root det obj case nmod punct advcl case amod amod obl cc amod conj punct

text: Remember the Alamo !
label: root det obj punct

text: Mexico had no intention of losing its northern province .
label: nsubj root det obj mark acl nmod amod obj punct

text: Santa Anna and his army of four thousand had besieged San Antonio in February 1836 .
label: nsubj flat cc nmod conj case nummod nmod aux root obj flat case obl nmod punct

text: Hopelessly outnumbered , its two hundred defenders , under Travis , fought fiercely from their refuge in an old mission known as the Alamo .
label: advmod advcl punct nmod nummod nummod nsubj punct case obl punct root advmod case nmod obl case det amod nmod acl case det obl punct

text: After ten days , however , the mission was taken and all but a few of the defenders were dead , including Travis and James Bowie , the famed frontiersman who was also a land speculator and slave trader .
label: case nummod obl punct advmod punct det nsubj aux root cc nsubj case det nmod case det nmod cop conj punct case obl cc conj flat punct det amod appos nsubj cop advmod det compound acl cc compound conj punct

text: A few male survivors , possibly including the frontier legend and former Tennessee congressman Davy Crockett , were led outside the walls and executed .
label: det amod amod nsubj punct advmod case det compound nmod cc amod compound conj appos flat punct aux root case det obl cc conj punct

text: The few women and children inside the mission were allowed to leave with the only adult male survivor , a slave owned by Travis who was then freed by the Mexican Army .
label: det amod nsubj cc conj case det nmod aux root mark xcomp case det amod amod amod obl punct det appos acl case obl nsubj aux advmod acl case det amod obl punct

text: Terrified , they fled .
label: advcl punct nsubj root punct

text: Figure 1.5
label: root dep

text: The Fall of the Alamo , painted by Theodore Gentilz fewer than ten years after this pivotal moment in the Texas Revolution , depicts the 1836 assault on the Alamo complex .

text: Consider this scenario .
label: root det obj punct

text: A student comes to class one day , and the instructor says , “ I ’ve decided that you ’re all a bunch of failures and I ’m flunking the entire class . ”
label: det nsubj root case obl nummod obl punct cc det nsubj conj punct punct nsubj aux ccomp mark nsubj cop advmod det ccomp case nmod cc nsubj aux conj det amod obj punct punct

text: Imagine then that the instructor simply stands there after that announcement , blinking calmly as the class erupts in protest .
label: root advmod mark det nsubj advmod ccomp advmod case det obl punct advcl advmod mark det nsubj advcl case obl punct

text: Now imagine that same scenario with one very slight difference .
label: advmod root det amod obj case nummod advmod amod obl punct

text: The instructor announces , “ I ’ve decided that you ’re all a bunch of failures and I ’m flunking the entire class . ”
label: det nsubj root punct punct nsubj aux ccomp mark nsubj cop advmod det ccomp case nmod cc nsubj aux conj det amod obj punct punct

text: Then , as the class erupts in protest , the instructor calmly blinks one eye , leaving the other eye open .
label: advmod punct mark det nsubj advcl case obl punct det nsubj advmod root nummod obj punct advcl det amod obj xcomp punct

text: Figure 3.4
label: root dep

text: Would you take this woman seriously ?
label: aux nsubj root det obj advmod punct

text: In American culture , winking , related to the normal biological function of blinking , takes on special meaning in social interactions .
label: case amod obl punct csubj punct advcl case det amod amod obl case nmod punct root compound amod obj case amod obl punct

text: ( credit : Motion Picture News / Wikimedia Commons , Public Domain )
label: punct root punct compound compound dep punct compound conj punct compound dep punct

text: What just happened there ?
label: nsubj advmod root advmod punct

text: Blinking is a biological compulsion common to humans everywhere .
label: csubj cop det amod root amod case obl advmod punct

text: Humans blink to keep eyes hydrated and clear of debris .
label: nsubj root mark advcl obj xcomp cc conj case obl punct

text: Humans are born knowing how to blink ; nobody has to teach us .
label: nsubj aux root advcl obj mark acl punct nsubj parataxis mark xcomp iobj punct

text: On average , humans blink 15 to 20 times every minute .
label: case obl punct nsubj root nummod case nmod obl det obl punct

text: Without realizing it , people are necessarily blinking throughout every conversation , every social interaction , every activity during the day .
label: mark advcl obj punct nsubj aux advmod root case det obl punct det amod conj punct det conj case det nmod punct

text: The people we talk to and interact with are also blinking constantly , so often that everyone is accustomed to ignoring it .
label: det nsubj nsubj acl obl cc conj obl aux advmod root advmod punct advmod advmod mark nsubj aux advcl mark advcl obj punct

text: Blinking does not affect the perceived meaning of speech or actions .
label: csubj aux advmod root det amod obj case nmod cc conj punct

text: But if someone deliberately blinks one eye , leaving the other one open , that ’s a completely different matter .
label: cc mark nsubj advmod advcl nummod obj punct advcl det amod obj xcomp punct nsubj cop det advmod amod root punct

text: In fact , leaving one eye open makes a blink a wink .
label: case obl punct csubj nummod obj xcomp root det obj det xcomp punct

text: Winking is not a biological necessity .
label: csubj cop advmod det amod root punct

text: Humans are not born knowing to how to wink , and it takes some practice to learn how to do it .
label: nsubj aux advmod root advcl case obl mark acl punct cc expl conj det obj mark csubj obj mark acl obj punct

text: Because it requires deliberate effort and people are not constantly doing it , winking can acquire special meaning in social interactions .
label: mark nsubj advcl amod obj cc nsubj aux advmod advmod conj obj punct csubj aux root amod obj case amod obl punct

text: In American culture ( and many others ) , a wink often indicates that someone is joking around and that whatever they ’ve just said or done should not be taken seriously .
label: case amod obl punct cc amod conj punct punct det nsubj advmod root mark nsubj aux ccomp advmod cc mark nsubj nsubj aux advmod acl cc conj aux advmod aux conj advmod punct

text: Of course , a wink can mean different things in different societies .
label: advmod fixed punct det nsubj aux root amod obj case amod obl punct

text: Moreover , a wink can mean different things in the same society .
label: advmod punct det nsubj aux root amod obj case det amod obl punct

text: If someone on a date takes their companion ’s hand and gives a cute little wink , the person may have reason to hope the winker is not just joking around .
label: mark nsubj case det nmod advcl nmod nmod case obj cc conj det amod amod obj punct det nsubj aux root obj mark acl det nsubj aux advmod advmod ccomp advmod punct

text: American cultural anthropologist Clifford Geertz ( 1973 ) used the example of winking to illustrate two important aspects of culture .
label: amod amod nsubj flat flat punct nmod punct root det obj case nmod mark advcl nummod amod obj case nmod punct

text: First , culture is learned .
label: advmod punct nsubj aux root punct

text: Innate human behaviors — that is , behaviors that people are born with — are biological , not cultural .
label: amod amod nsubj punct obl fixed punct appos obl nsubj aux acl case punct cop root punct advmod conj punct

text: Blinking is biological .
label: csubj cop root punct

text: Acquired human behaviors — that is , behaviors that people are taught — are cultural .
label: amod amod nsubj punct obl fixed punct appos obj nsubj aux acl punct cop root punct

text: Winking is cultural .
label: csubj cop root punct

text: This means that cultural behaviors are not genetically inherited from generation to generation but must be passed down from older members of a society to younger members .
label: nsubj root mark amod nsubj aux advmod advmod ccomp case obl case obl cc aux aux conj compound case amod obl case det nmod case amod obl punct

text: This process , as you ’ll recall from What is Anthropology ? is called enculturation .
label: det nsubj punct mark nsubj aux advcl case obl cop nsubj punct aux root xcomp punct

text: Some aspects of enculturation are deliberate and systematic , such as learning the rules of written punctuation in a language .
label: det nsubj case nmod cop root cc conj punct mark fixed advcl det obj case amod nmod case det nmod punct

text: At some point in an English speaker ’s childhood , someone explicitly told them the difference between a question mark and an exclamation point .
label: case det obl case det amod nmod case nmod punct nsubj advmod root iobj det obj case det compound nmod cc det compound conj punct

text: Most likely , they learned this distinction in school , a fundamental institution of enculturation in many societies .
label: advmod advmod punct nsubj root det obj case obl punct det amod appos case nmod case amod nmod punct

text: Religious institutions are another common force of enculturation , providing explicit instruction in cultural rules of morality and social interaction .
label: amod nsubj cop det amod root case nmod punct acl amod obj case amod nmod case nmod cc amod conj punct

text: Extracurricular activities such as sports , dance , and music lessons also teach children cultural rules and norms .
label: amod nsubj case fixed nmod punct conj punct cc compound conj advmod root iobj amod obj cc conj punct

text: While a great deal of very important cultural content is deliberately conveyed in these systematic contexts , the greater part of culture is acquired unconsciously by happenstance — that is , nobody planned to teach it , and no one made an effort to consciously try to learn it .
label: mark det amod nsubj case advmod amod amod nmod aux advmod advcl case det amod obl punct det amod nsubj case nmod aux root advmod case obl punct obl fixed punct nsubj parataxis mark xcomp obj punct cc det nsubj conj det obj mark advmod acl mark xcomp obj punct

text: By virtue of growing up in a culture , children learn what certain actions and objects mean , how their society operates , and what the rules are for appropriate behavior .
label: case obl mark acl compound case det obl punct nsubj root obj amod nsubj cc conj acl punct conj nmod nsubj advcl punct cc conj det nsubj acl case amod nmod punct

text: Going back to the cultural notion of home , did anyone ever explain to you why your childhood home was structured in a certain way ?
label: advcl advmod case det amod obl case nmod punct aux nsubj advmod root case obl obj nmod compound nsubj aux advcl case det amod obl punct

text: Did anyone ever point out the cultural assumptions about gender and family built into your house ?
label: aux nsubj advmod root compound det amod obj case nmod cc conj acl case nmod obl punct

text: Probably not .
label: advmod root punct

text: Now , imagine that you were taken away from your parents as a baby and adopted by a family far away , with a very different way of life situated in a very different environment .
label: advmod punct root mark nsubj aux ccomp advmod case nmod obl case det obl cc conj case det obl advmod advmod punct case det advmod amod nmod case nmod acl case det advmod amod obl punct

text: With your adoptive family , you might have been raised in a very different kind of home .
label: case nmod amod obl punct nsubj aux aux aux root case det advmod amod obl case nmod punct

text: Growing up , your everyday habits , activities , and expectations would have been shaped by the setup of that home .
label: advcl compound punct nmod amod nsubj punct conj punct cc conj aux aux aux root case det obl case det nmod punct

text: Living in that house , you would have wordlessly absorbed a set of assumptions about family , gender , work , leisure , hospitality , and property .
label: advcl case det obl punct nsubj aux aux advmod root det obj case nmod case nmod punct conj punct conj punct conj punct conj punct cc conj punct

text: And all of it would seem quite natural to you .

text: Many forms of culture are passed down through a combination of deliberate and unconscious processes .
label: amod nsubj case nmod aux root compound case det obl case amod cc conj nmod punct

text: Perhaps when you were a child , someone told you what a wink was and showed you how to accomplish one ; or perhaps you just witnessed a few winks , figured out what they meant from their contexts , and then learned how to accomplish one through trial and error .

text: Geertz pointed out that there are two important aspects to winking : the meaning and the action .

text: As both are learned , both are cultural .

text: But perhaps more importantly , both the standardized action of winking and the assumed meaning of this action are commonly known among members of a group .

text: A relevant question to our concern might be , would this artistic excellence in the Chinese tradition be the same as beauty ?

text: Arguably , beauty is regarded as the keyword in Western art tradition since antiquity .

text: If we browse Chinese classical writings on art criticism , a striking difference manifests — there the category of mei or beauty does not have a dominant presence .

text: For instance , among the 24 aesthetic categories of poetry listed by Sikong Tu 司空 图 ( 837 – 908 ) in his celebrated treatise ( Sikong n.d. ) , only three or four categories can be regarded as related to the Western notion of beauty .
label: case obl punct case det nummod amod obl case nmod acl case obl flat appos flat punct dep punct nmod punct case nmod amod obl punct dep dep punct punct advmod nummod cc conj nsubj aux aux root mark advcl case det amod obl case nmod punct

text: Moreover , according to Xu Hong ’s ( c. 1580 – 1660 ) Xishan Qinkuang 谿山 琴况 ( c. 1640 ) , the most influential treatise on the aesthetics of guqin ( Chinese zither ) music , the category of li ( pretty , beautiful ) is merely the 10th of the 24 aesthetic categories , and the top six were harmony , tranquillity , clarity , profundity , antiquity , subtlety . text: CONTEMPORARY DISCOURSE : BRIEF REMARK
label: amod root punct amod dep

text: The Hegelian definition of aesthetics as the philosophy of art that considers the issue of artistic beauty as its core concern is no more enchanting in our time .
label: det amod nsubj case nmod case det nmod case nmod nsubj acl det obj case amod nmod case nmod amod nmod cop advmod advmod root case nmod obl punct

text: Many would agree that the question “ what makes an artwork beautiful ” plays a minor role in contemporary aesthetics and philosophy of art , where the question has been updated to “ what makes an artwork meaningful or valuable ? ”
label: nsubj aux root mark det nsubj punct nsubj appos det obj xcomp punct ccomp det amod obj case amod obl cc conj case nmod punct advmod det nsubj aux aux acl mark punct nsubj advcl det obj xcomp cc conj punct punct

text: Two factors might contribute to this situation .
label: nummod nsubj aux root case det obl punct

text: Firstly , it is not a coincidence that the loss of interest in the inquiry into artistic beauty coincides with a sea change in the artworld , transformed by new art movements as well as struggles in defining art .
label: advmod punct expl cop advmod det root mark det nsubj case nmod case det nmod case amod nmod csubj case det compound obl case det nmod punct acl case amod compound obl cc fixed fixed conj mark acl obj punct

text: Being beautiful is no longer a defining feature of art .
label: cop csubj cop advmod advmod det amod root case nmod punct

text: Also , when the representationalism , the expression theories , formalism , neoformalism , aesthetic theories in defining art all fail to offer an account that is capable of coping with the dynamic scenes of the artworld , and when the anti-essentialist movement in philosophical aesthetics then paves a way to functionalism , institutionalism and various versions of historicism , the question of artistic beauty as such not only loses its limelight , but also is , to some extent , abandoned for its strong Hegelian colour .
label: advmod punct advmod det nsubj punct det compound conj punct conj punct conj punct amod conj mark acl obj advmod advcl mark xcomp det obj nsubj cop acl mark advcl case det amod obl case det nmod punct cc advmod det amod nsubj case amod nmod advmod conj det obj case obl punct conj cc amod conj case nmod punct det nsubj case amod nmod case nmod advmod advmod root nmod obj punct cc advmod aux punct case det obl punct conj case nmod amod amod obl punct

text: Now if “ art ” itself becomes an open concept or a socially , historically , culturally sensitive notion , then whatever makes an artwork beautiful is unlikely to be something homogeneous and unitary .
label: advmod mark punct nsubj punct nmod advcl det amod xcomp cc det advmod punct advmod punct advmod amod conj punct advmod nsubj acl det obj xcomp cop root mark cop csubj amod cc conj punct

text: Secondly , the inquiry into “ beauty ” experienced a shift of focus from the emphasis on aesthetic properties of the objects to the subjective experience involved in aesthetic appreciation .
label: advmod punct det nsubj case punct nmod punct root det obj case nmod case det nmod case amod nmod case det nmod case det amod nmod acl case amod obl punct

text: In other words , a shift from an inquiry about “ the beauty of object ” to the issue of “ the pleasure of beauty . ”
label: case amod nmod punct det root case det nmod case punct det nmod case nmod punct case det nmod case punct det nmod case nmod punct punct

text: The contemporary inquiry into beauty in general is often classified in light of the framework of realism vs non-realism .
label: det amod nsubj case nmod case nmod aux advmod root case obl case det nmod case nmod case nmod punct

text: Realism regards artistic beauty as a property of artworks which is independent of the subject , while non-realism holds that artistic beauty is not an independent property of artworks .
label: nsubj root amod obj case det obl case nmod nsubj cop acl case det obl punct mark nsubj advcl mark amod nsubj cop advmod det amod ccomp case nmod punct

text: This shift has a long historical preparation , contributed especially by the British empiricists such as Francis Hutcheson ( 1694 – 1746 ) and David Hume ( 1711 – 1776 ) .
label: det nsubj root det amod amod obj punct acl advmod case det amod obl case fixed nmod flat punct dep punct nmod punct cc conj flat punct dep punct nmod punct punct

text: Hutcheson thinks that beauty lies in both the object and the subject , and artistic beauty comes from the quality of “ uniformity amidst variety ” in the object and the involvement of an “ internal sense ” in the subject . [ 39 ]
label: nsubj root mark nsubj ccomp case cc det obl cc det conj punct cc amod nsubj conj case det obl case punct nmod case nmod punct case det nmod cc det conj case det punct amod nmod punct case det nmod punct punct dep punct

text: Hume argues that “ beauty is no quality in things themselves , ” but a “ sentiment ” in “ the mind that contemplates them ” and “ to seek the real beauty … is … fruitless . ” [ 40 ]
label: nsubj root mark punct nsubj cop det ccomp case nmod nmod punct punct cc det punct conj punct case punct det nmod nsubj acl obj punct cc punct mark csubj det amod obj punct cop punct conj punct punct punct dep punct

text: In contemporary aesthetics , from the study of empathy to Freud ’s libido , to the evolutionary theory of beauty , to the focus on perception in aesthetic experience , more and more philosophers seek to answer the question of what makes an artwork beautiful in light of human physiology and psychology .
label: case amod obl punct case det obl case nmod case nmod case nmod punct case det amod conj case nmod punct case det conj case nmod case amod nmod punct amod cc conj nsubj root mark xcomp det obj case nmod acl det obj xcomp case obl case amod nmod cc conj punct

text: For instance , the evolutionary theory regards artistic beauty as “ fitness signal ” that displays desirable personal qualities that strengthen reproductive advantage , and our pleasant feeling caused by something beautiful , like sexual pleasure , is engraved in our minds by the process of evolution , assisting us to make the “ the most adaptive decisions for survival and reproduction . ” [ 41 ]
label: case obl punct det amod nsubj root amod obj case punct compound obl punct nsubj acl amod amod obj nsubj acl amod obj punct cc nmod amod nsubj acl case obl amod punct case amod nmod punct aux conj case nmod obl case det obl case nmod punct advcl obj mark xcomp det punct det advmod amod obj case nmod cc conj punct punct punct dep punct

text: 39. “ The Figures which excite in us the Ideas of Beauty , seem to be those in which there is Uniformity amidst Variety ” ( § II , p. 28 ) .
label: dep punct det nsubj nsubj acl case obl det obj case nmod punct root mark cop xcomp case obl expl acl nsubj case obl punct punct dep dep punct dep dep punct punct

text: “ The internal Sense is , a passive Power of receiving Ideas of Beauty from all Objects in which there is Uniformity amidst Variety ” ( § VI , 67 ) .
label: punct det amod nsubj cop punct det amod root mark acl obj case nmod case det obl case obl expl acl nsubj case obl punct punct dep dep punct dep punct punct

text: 40. “ Beauty is no quality in things themselves : it exists merely in the mind which contemplates them ; and each mind perceives a different beauty … every individual ought to acquiesce in his own sentiment , without pretending to regulate those of others .
label: dep punct nsubj cop det root case nmod nmod punct nsubj parataxis advmod case det obl nsubj acl obj punct cc det nsubj conj det amod obj punct det nsubj parataxis mark xcomp case nmod amod obl punct mark advcl mark xcomp obj case nmod punct

text: To seek the real beauty , or real deformity , is as fruitless an inquiry , as to pretend to ascertain the real sweet or real bitter ” ( Hume 1998 , 136 – 137 ) .
label: mark csubj det amod obj punct cc amod conj punct cop advmod amod det root punct mark mark advcl mark xcomp det amod obj cc amod conj punct punct dep nmod punct dep punct nmod punct punct

text: 41. Denis Dutton ( 2010 ) provides such an account in his TED talk , “ A Darwinian Theory of Beauty . ”

text: Learning Objectives
label: compound root

text: By the end of this section , you will be able to :
label: case det obl case det nmod punct nsubj aux cop root xcomp punct

text: Describe cognition
label: root obj

text: Distinguish concepts and prototypes
label: root obj cc conj

text: Explain the difference between natural and artificial concepts
label: root det obj case amod cc conj nmod

text: Imagine all of your thoughts as if they were physical entities , swirling rapidly inside your mind .
label: root obj case nmod nmod mark fixed nsubj cop amod advcl punct acl advmod case nmod obl punct

text: How is it possible that the brain is able to move from one thought to the next in an organized , orderly fashion ?
label: advmod cop expl root mark det nsubj cop csubj mark xcomp case nummod obl case det obl case det amod punct amod obl punct

text: The brain is endlessly perceiving , processing , planning , organizing , and remembering — it is always active .
label: det nsubj aux advmod root punct conj punct conj punct conj punct cc conj punct nsubj cop advmod parataxis punct

text: Yet , you do n’t notice most of your brain ’s activity as you move throughout your daily routine .
label: cc punct nsubj aux advmod root obj case nmod nmod case obl mark nsubj advcl case nmod amod obl punct

text: This is only one facet of the complex processes involved in cognition .
label: nsubj cop advmod nummod root case det amod nmod acl case obl punct

text: Simply put , cognition is thinking , and it encompasses the processes associated with perception , knowledge , problem solving , judgment , language , and memory .
label: advmod advcl punct nsubj cop root punct cc nsubj conj det obj acl case obl punct conj punct compound conj punct conj punct conj punct cc conj punct

text: Scientists who study cognition are searching for ways to understand how we integrate , organize , and utilize our conscious cognitive experiences without being aware of all of the unconscious work that our brains are doing ( for example , Kahneman , 2011 ) .
label: nsubj nsubj acl obj aux root case obl mark acl obj nsubj advcl punct conj punct cc conj nmod amod amod obj mark cop advcl case obl case det amod nmod obj nmod nsubj aux acl punct case obl punct parataxis punct nmod punct punct

text: Cognition
label: root

text: Upon waking each morning , you begin thinking — contemplating the tasks that you must complete that day .
label: mark advcl det obl punct nsubj root xcomp punct parataxis det obj obj nsubj aux acl det obl punct

text: In what order should you run your errands ?
label: case det obl aux nsubj root nmod obj punct

text: Should you go to the bank , the cleaners , or the grocery store first ?
label: aux nsubj root case det obl punct det conj punct cc det compound conj advmod punct

text: Can you get these things done before you head to class or will they need to wait until school is done ?
label: aux nsubj root det obj xcomp mark nsubj advcl case obl cc aux nsubj conj mark xcomp mark nsubj cop advcl punct

text: These thoughts are one example of cognition at work .
label: det nsubj cop nummod root case nmod case nmod punct

text: Exceptionally complex , cognition is an essential feature of human consciousness , yet not all aspects of cognition are consciously experienced .
label: advmod acl punct nsubj cop det amod root case amod nmod punct cc advmod det nsubj case nmod aux advmod conj punct

text: Cognitive psychology is the field of psychology dedicated to examining how people think .
label: amod nsubj cop det root case nmod acl mark advcl obj nsubj advcl punct

text: It attempts to explain how and why we think the way we do by studying the interactions among human thinking , emotion , creativity , language , and problem solving , in addition to other cognitive processes .
label: nsubj root mark xcomp obj cc conj nsubj advcl det obl nsubj acl mark advcl det obj case amod nmod punct conj punct conj punct conj punct cc compound conj punct case nmod case amod amod nmod punct

text: Cognitive psychologists strive to determine and measure different types of intelligence , why some people are better at problem solving than others , and how emotional intelligence affects success in the workplace , among countless other topics .
label: amod nsubj root mark xcomp cc conj amod obj case nmod punct advmod det nsubj cop conj case compound obl case obl punct cc advmod amod nsubj conj obj case det obl punct case amod amod nmod punct

text: They also sometimes focus on how we organize thoughts and information gathered from our environments into meaningful categories of thought , which will be discussed later .
label: nsubj advmod advmod root case obl nsubj advcl obj cc conj acl case nmod obl case amod obl case nmod punct nsubj aux aux advcl advmod punct

text: Concepts and Prototypes
label: root cc conj

text: The human nervous system is capable of handling endless streams of information .
label: det amod amod nsubj cop root mark advcl amod obj case nmod punct

text: The senses serve as the interface between the mind and the external environment , receiving stimuli and translating it into nervous impulses that are transmitted to the brain .
label: det nsubj root case det obl case det nmod cc det amod conj punct advcl obj cc conj obj case amod obl nsubj aux acl case det obl punct

text: The brain then processes this information and uses the relevant pieces to create thoughts , which can then be expressed through language or stored in memory for future use .
label: det nsubj advmod root det obj cc conj det amod obj mark advcl obj punct nsubj aux advmod aux acl case obl cc conj case obl case amod obl punct

text: To make this process more complex , the brain does not gather information from external environments only .
label: mark advcl det obj advmod xcomp punct det nsubj aux advmod root obj case amod obl advmod punct

text: When thoughts are formed , the brain also pulls information from emotions and memories ( Figure 7.2 ) .
label: advmod nsubj aux advcl punct det nsubj advmod root obj case obl cc conj punct dep dep punct punct

text: Emotion and memory are powerful influences on both our thoughts and behaviors .
label: nsubj cc conj cop amod root case cc nmod nmod cc conj punct

text: Figure 7.2
label: root dep

text: Sensations and information are received by our brains , filtered through emotions and memories , and processed to become thoughts .
label: nsubj cc conj aux root case nmod obl punct conj case obl cc conj punct cc conj mark advcl xcomp punct

text: In order to organize this staggering amount of information , the brain has developed a file cabinet of sorts in the mind .
label: mark fixed mark advcl det amod obj case nmod punct det nsubj aux root det compound obj case nmod case det obl punct

text: The different files stored in the file cabinet are called concepts .
label: det amod nsubj acl case det compound obl aux root xcomp punct

text: Concepts are categories or groupings of linguistic information , images , ideas , or memories , such as life experiences .
label: nsubj cop root cc conj case amod nmod punct conj punct conj punct cc conj punct case fixed compound nmod punct

text: Concepts are , in many ways , big ideas that are generated by observing details , and categorizing and combining these details into cognitive structures .
label: nsubj cop punct case amod obl punct amod root nsubj aux acl mark advcl obj punct cc conj cc conj det obj case amod obl punct

text: You use concepts to see the relationships among the different elements of your experiences and to keep the information in your mind organized and accessible .
label: nsubj root obj mark advcl det obj case det amod nmod case nmod nmod cc mark conj det obj case nmod nmod xcomp cc conj punct

text: Concepts are informed by our semantic memory ( you will learn more about semantic memory in a later chapter ) and are present in every aspect of our lives ; however , one of the easiest places to notice concepts is inside a classroom , where they are discussed explicitly .
label: nsubj aux root case nmod amod obl punct nsubj aux parataxis advmod case amod obl case det amod obl punct cc cop conj case det obl case nmod nmod punct advmod punct nsubj case det amod nmod mark acl obj cop case det parataxis punct advmod nsubj aux acl advmod punct

text: When you study United States history , for example , you learn about more than just individual events that have happened in America ’s past .
label: advmod nsubj advcl amod compound obj punct case nmod punct nsubj root case obl case advmod amod obl nsubj aux acl case nmod case obl punct

text: You absorb a large quantity of information by listening to and participating in discussions , examining maps , and reading first - hand accounts of people ’s lives .
label: nsubj root det amod obj case nmod mark advcl obl cc conj case obl punct conj obj punct cc conj amod punct compound obj case nmod case nmod punct

text: Your brain analyzes these details and develops an overall understanding of American history .
label: nmod nsubj root det obj cc conj det amod obj case amod nmod punct

text: In the process , your brain gathers details that inform and refine your understanding of related concepts like democracy , power , and freedom .
label: case det obl punct nmod nsubj root obj nsubj acl cc conj nmod obj case amod nmod case nmod punct conj punct cc conj punct

text: Concepts can be complex and abstract , like justice , or more concrete , like types of birds .
label: nsubj aux cop root cc conj punct case obl punct cc advmod conj punct case obl case nmod punct

text: In psychology , for example , Piaget ’s stages of development are abstract concepts .
label: case nmod punct case obl punct nmod case nsubj case nmod cop amod root punct

text: Some concepts , like tolerance , are agreed upon by many people , because they have been used in various ways over many years .
label: det nsubj punct case nmod punct aux root obl case amod obl punct mark nsubj aux aux advcl case amod obl case amod obl punct

text: Other concepts , like the characteristics of your ideal friend or your family ’s birthday traditions , are personal and individualized .
label: amod nsubj punct case det nmod case nmod amod nmod cc nmod nmod case compound conj punct cop root cc conj punct

text: In this way , concepts touch every aspect of our lives , from our many daily routines to the guiding principles behind the way governments function .
label: case det obl punct nsubj root det obj case nmod nmod punct case nmod amod amod obl case det amod obl case det nmod nsubj acl punct

text: Another technique used by your brain to organize information is the identification of prototypes for the concepts you have developed .
label: det nsubj acl case nmod obl mark advcl obj cop det root case nmod case det nmod nsubj aux acl punct

text: A prototype is the best example or representation of a concept .
label: det nsubj cop det amod root cc conj case det nmod punct

text: For example , for the category of civil disobedience , your prototype could be Rosa Parks .
label: case nmod punct case det nmod case amod nmod punct nmod nsubj aux cop root flat punct

text: Her peaceful resistance to segregation on a city bus in Montgomery , Alabama , is a recognizable example of civil disobedience .
label: nmod amod nsubj case nmod case det compound nmod case nmod punct appos punct cop det amod root case amod nmod punct

text: Or your prototype could be Mohandas Gandhi , sometimes called Mahatma Gandhi ( “ Mahatma ” is an honorific title ) ( Figure 7.3 ) .
label: cc nmod nsubj aux cop root flat punct advmod acl xcomp flat punct punct nsubj punct cop det amod parataxis punct punct dep dep punct punct

text: Figure 7.3
label: root dep

text: In 1930 , Mohandas Gandhi led a group in peaceful protest against a British tax on salt in India .
label: case obl punct nsubj flat root det obj case amod obl case det amod obl case nmod case nmod punct

text: Mohandas Gandhi served as a nonviolent force for independence for India while simultaneously demanding that Buddhist , Hindu , Muslim , and Christian leaders — both Indian and British — collaborate peacefully .
label: nsubj flat root case det amod obl case nmod case nmod mark advmod advcl mark amod punct conj punct conj punct cc conj nsubj punct cc appos cc conj punct ccomp advmod punct

text: Although he was not always successful in preventing violence around him , his life provides a steadfast example of the civil disobedience prototype ( Constitutional Rights Foundation , 2013 ) .
label: mark nsubj cop advmod advmod advcl mark advcl obj case obl punct nmod nsubj root det amod obj case det amod compound nmod punct compound compound dep punct nmod punct punct

text: Just as concepts can be abstract or concrete , we can make a distinction between concepts that are functions of our direct experience with the world and those that are more artificial in nature .
label: advmod mark nsubj aux cop advcl cc conj punct nsubj aux root det obj case nmod nsubj cop acl case nmod amod nmod case det nmod cc conj nsubj cop advmod acl case obl punct

text: An Entrepreneurial Mindset in Your Discipline or Field
label: det amod root case nmod nmod cc conj

text: Within your industry of interest or area of study , what are the challenges that create frustration ?
label: case nmod nmod case nmod cc conj case nmod punct nsubj cop det root nsubj acl obj punct

text: How can these be turned into opportunities ?
label: advmod aux nsubj aux root case obl punct

text: Earlier in this chapter , we discussed Evernote , a company that focuses on expanding our memories by storing and organizing information .
label: advmod case det obl punct nsubj root obj punct det appos nsubj acl mark advcl nmod obj mark advcl cc conj obj punct

text: Let ’s look at some other examples of entrepreneurial endeavors in specific industries to help you plan your own venture in your own industry .
label: root obj xcomp case det amod obl case amod nmod case amod nmod mark advcl obj xcomp nmod amod obj case nmod amod nmod punct

text: In the agriculture industry , insects , weeds , weather conditions , and the challenges of harvesting crops are all ripe for entrepreneurial activities .
label: case det compound obl punct nsubj punct conj punct compound conj punct cc det conj mark acl obj cop advmod root case amod obl punct

text: The move toward organic produce has also affected this industry .
label: det nsubj case amod nmod aux advmod root det obj punct

text: From an entrepreneurial perspective , what products could you invent to support both organic farming and the problems of insects that damage or destroy crops ?
label: case det amod obl punct det obj aux nsubj root mark advcl cc amod obj cc det conj case nmod nsubj acl cc conj obj punct

text: The old method was to use chemical sprays to kill the insects , but today , the growing demand for organic foods and increased awareness of the impact of chemical sprays on our environment are changing this scenario .
label: det amod nsubj cop mark root amod obj mark advcl det obj punct cc obl punct det amod nsubj case amod nmod cc amod conj case det nmod case amod nmod case nmod nmod aux conj det obj punct

text: One new idea to solve this problem combines a vacuum cleaner with an agriculture product .
label: nummod amod nsubj mark acl det obj root det compound obj case det compound obl punct

text: LINK TO LEARNING
label: root case nmod

text: Watch this video on the creation of a crop vacuum that sucks up insects and bugs to learn more .
label: root det obj case det nmod case det compound nmod nsubj acl compound obj cc conj mark advcl obj punct

text: A bug vacuum is an example of how using divergent thinking contributed to the solution of removing bugs from crops without using chemicals .
label: det compound nsubj cop det root case nmod csubj amod obj advcl case det obl mark acl obj case obl mark advcl obj punct

text: In the group activity of creating divergent ideas , this idea may not have been received well .
label: case det compound obl mark acl amod obj punct det nsubj aux advmod aux aux root advmod punct

text: However , in the incubation stage , the idea must have come forward as a viable solution .
label: advmod punct case det compound obl punct det nsubj aux aux root advmod case det amod obl punct

text: Entrepreneurs frequently face the challenge of pressure to conform to established habits and patterns within industries .
label: nsubj advmod root det obj case nmod mark acl case amod obl cc conj case nmod punct

text: Often , the entrepreneurial mindset includes futuristic ideas that shake up the normal , conventional processes that are grounded in experience over time .
label: advmod punct det amod nsubj root amod obj nsubj acl compound det amod punct amod obj nsubj aux acl case obl case obl punct

text: Tried - and - tested processes and products that have a proven history of success can be a formidable obstacle to new ideas .
label: amod punct cc punct conj nsubj cc conj nsubj acl det amod obj case nmod aux cop det amod root case amod nmod punct

text: A new idea may even appear as impossible or outlandish , perhaps even an embarrassment to the steady and predictable practices established within an industry .
label: det amod nsubj aux advmod root case obl cc conj punct advmod advmod det obl case det amod cc conj nmod acl case det obl punct

text: This can create a dilemma : Do we try something new and unproven that lacks documented research ?
label: nsubj aux root det obj punct aux nsubj parataxis obj amod cc conj nsubj acl amod obj punct

text: Sometimes , we must disregard our past successes and research to be open to new possibilities for success and failure .
label: advmod punct nsubj aux root nmod amod obj cc conj mark cop advcl case amod obl case nmod cc conj punct

text: An entrepreneurial mindset includes creativity , problem - solving skills , and a propensity to innovation . 23
label: det amod nsubj root obj punct compound punct compound conj punct cc det conj case nmod punct dep

text: Open - mindedness is one characteristic that supports creativity , problem solving , and innovation .
label: amod punct nsubj cop nummod root nsubj acl obj punct compound conj punct cc conj punct

text: Taking the time to explore new ideas , dream , reflect , and view situations from a new perspective contribute to the entrepreneurial mindset .
label: csubj det obj mark acl amod obj punct conj punct conj punct cc conj obj case det amod obl root case det amod obl punct

text: Some innovations can lead to disruptions within the industry , or even create a new industry .
label: det nsubj aux root case obl case det nmod punct cc advmod conj det amod obj punct

text: The innovator ’s dilemma was presented by Clayton Christensen to explain disruptive technology , which are technologies that , once introduced , displace established patterns , processes , and systems previously accepted as normal or accepted .
label: det nmod case nsubj aux root case obl flat mark advcl amod obj punct nsubj cop acl nsubj punct mark advcl punct acl amod obj punct conj punct cc conj advmod acl case obl cc conj punct

text: One example of a disruptive technology is Airbnb , a company that threatens the established hotel industry by connecting personal resources to people who desire those resources .
label: nummod nsubj case det amod nmod cop root punct det appos nsubj acl det amod compound obj mark advcl amod obj case obl nsubj acl det obj punct

text: If you have a spare bedroom that you are n’t using , why not sell that space to someone who wants and needs the space ?
label: mark nsubj advcl det amod obj obj nsubj aux advmod acl punct advmod advmod root det obj case obl nsubj acl cc conj det obj punct

text: Airbnb has become a significant threat to the established hotel industry ’s business model of building large hotels and renting rooms within those hotels to their customers .
label: nsubj aux root det amod xcomp case det amod compound nmod case compound nmod mark acl amod obj cc conj obj case det nmod case nmod obl punct

text: Airbnb has reconfigured that model , and since its 2008 launch , 150 million travelers have taken advantage of 3 million Airbnb listings in more than 191 countries .
label: nsubj aux root det obj punct cc case nmod nmod obl punct compound nummod nsubj aux conj obj case compound nummod compound obl case advmod fixed nummod nmod punct

text: Airbnb has raised more than $ 3 billion ( plus a $ 1 billion credit line ) and is considering selling stocks to support significant expansion .
label: nsubj aux root advmod fixed obj compound nummod punct cc det compound compound nummod compound conj punct cc aux conj xcomp obj mark advcl amod obj punct

text: The value of Airbnb is approximately $ 30 billion .
label: det nsubj case nmod cop advmod root compound nummod punct

text: Compare this market value to Hilton ’s market capitalization of $ 19 billion and Marriott ’s of $ 35 billion .
label: root det compound obj case nmod case compound obl case nmod compound nummod cc conj case case nmod compound nummod punct

text: If you were the CEO of Hilton or Marriott , would you be worried ?
label: mark nsubj cop det advcl case nmod cc conj punct aux nsubj aux root punct

text: The hotel industry recognized Airbnb as a threat , and in 2016 , began a campaign to create legislation to rein in Airbnb ’s growth and popularity .
label: det compound nsubj root obj case det obl punct cc case obl punct conj det obj mark acl obj mark acl compound nmod case obj cc conj punct

text: From the hotel industry ’s perspective , Airbnb is not playing by the same rules .
label: case det compound nmod case obl punct nsubj aux advmod root case det amod obl punct

text: This is the definition of disruptive technology , the focus on creating a new idea or process that negates or challenges established process or products . 24
label: nsubj cop det root case amod nmod punct det appos mark acl det amod obj cc conj nsubj acl cc conj amod obj cc conj punct dep

text: Sometimes disruptive technologies result from not listening to customers .
label: advmod amod nsubj root mark advmod advcl case obl punct

text: Customers do n’t always know what they want .
label: nsubj aux advmod advmod root obj nsubj acl punct

text: Customer groups might need to be redefined by the entrepreneurial team on the basis of better models , knowing when to invest in developing lower - performance products that promise lower margins while still satisfying the need , and knowing when to pursue small markets at the expense of larger or established markets .
label: compound nsubj aux root mark aux xcomp case det amod obl case det obl case amod nmod punct advcl obj mark acl mark advcl amod punct compound obj nsubj acl amod obj mark advmod advcl det obj punct cc conj obj mark acl amod obj case det obl case amod cc conj nmod punct

text: Basically , disruptive technologies occur through identifying new and valuable processes and products .
label: advmod punct amod nsubj root mark advcl amod cc conj obj cc conj punct

text: The founders of Airbnb recognized that some people have unused resources , bedrooms , that other people need .
label: det nsubj case nmod root mark det nsubj ccomp amod obj punct appos punct obj amod nsubj acl punct

text: We can apply this idea to other unused resources such as vehicles and motor homes .
label: nsubj aux root det obj case amod amod obl case fixed nmod cc compound conj punct

text: We see this model reproduced in short - term car rental and bike - sharing programs .
label: nsubj root det nsubj ccomp case amod punct compound compound compound cc compound punct compound obl punct

label: root flat punct punct dep punct amod dep punct punct amod compound compound dep punct dep punct dep punct punct dep punct dep
