text: Respect
label: root

text: Thais are a polite people and , while remarkably tolerant of foreigners gallivanting on their beaches and with their women , you ll find that you will get more respect if you in turn treat them and their customs with respect .
label: nsubj cop det amod root cc punct mark advmod advcl case obl acl case nmod obl cc case nmod conj punct nsubj aux conj mark nsubj aux ccomp amod obj mark nsubj case obl advcl obj cc nmod conj case obl punct

text: The wai
label: det root

text: Ronald McDonald showing how it 's done
label: root flat acl obj nsubj aux advcl

text: The traditional greeting known as the wai , where you press your hands together as is in prayer and bow slightly , is derived from the Hindu cultural influence from India , and still widely practised .
label: det amod nsubj acl case det obl punct advmod nsubj acl nmod obj xcomp mark cop case advcl cc conj advmod punct aux root case det compound amod obl case nmod punct cc advmod advmod conj punct

text: Among Thais , there are strict rules of hierarchy that dictate how and when the wai should be given .
label: case obl punct expl root amod nsubj case nmod nsubj acl obj cc conj det nsubj aux aux advcl punct

text: In brief , inferiors salute superiors first .
label: case obl punct nsubj root obj advmod punct

text: You should not wai service people or street vendors .
label: nsubj aux advmod root compound obj cc compound conj punct

text: The higher your hands go , the more respectful you are .
label: det advcl nmod nsubj advcl punct det advmod root nsubj advcl punct

text: You will also often see Thais doing a wai as they walk past temples and spirit houses .
label: nsubj aux advmod advmod root obj xcomp det obj mark nsubj advcl case obl cc compound conj punct

text: As a foreign visitor , you are not expected to know how to wai , nor to reciprocate when wai'd to ;
label: case det amod obl punct nsubj aux advmod root mark xcomp obj mark acl punct cc mark conj advmod advcl obl punct

text: while you 're unlikely to cause offense if you do , you may well look slightly strange .
label: mark nsubj cop advcl mark xcomp obj mark nsubj advcl punct nsubj aux advmod root advmod xcomp punct

text: If somebody makes a wai to you , a slight bow alone is more than sufficient for ordinary occasions , and for business , most Thais will shake hands with foreigners instead of waiing anyway .
label: mark nsubj advcl det obj case obl punct det amod nsubj advmod cop advmod fixed root case amod obl punct cc case obl punct amod nsubj aux conj obj case obl mark fixed advcl advmod punct

text: Dress
label: root

text: Personal appearance is very important in Thailand as a measure of respect to other people .
label: amod nsubj cop advmod root case obl case det obl case nmod case amod nmod punct

text: You will find that dressing appropriately means that you are shown more respect in return .
label: nsubj aux root mark csubj advmod ccomp mark nsubj aux ccomp amod obj case obl punct

text: This translates in many ways , even sometimes lowering initial offering prices at markets .
label: nsubj root case amod obl punct advmod advmod advcl amod compound obj case obl punct

text: While some allowance is made for the differing customs of foreigners , Thais respond more positively to well - dressed Westerners .
label: mark det nsubj aux advcl case det amod obl case nmod punct nsubj root advmod advmod case advmod punct amod obl punct

text: Traditionally , Thais are modest and conservative dressers .
label: advmod punct nsubj cop amod cc conj root punct

text: At a minimum your clothes should be neat , clean , and free from holes or tears .
label: case det obl nmod nsubj aux cop root punct conj punct cc conj case obl cc conj punct

text: Except at the beach or at sacred sites normal western dress is acceptable for both men and women , except that you should avoid clothing showing a lot of skin .
label: mark case det advcl cc case amod conj amod amod nsubj cop root case cc obl cc conj punct mark mark nsubj aux advcl obj acl det obj case nmod punct

text: Pants are preferable to shorts , blouses should have capped sleeves , and if tank tops are worn , the straps should be thick ( i.e. , not spaghetti straps ) .
label: nsubj cop root case obl punct nsubj aux conj amod obj punct cc mark compound nsubj aux advcl punct det nsubj aux cop conj punct advmod punct advmod compound parataxis punct punct

text: Thai men generally wear pants , and most Thais view an adult man wearing shorts as fairly ridiculous ;
label: amod nsubj advmod root obj punct cc amod nsubj conj det amod obj acl obj case advmod obl punct

text: shorts are primarily worn by laborers and schoolchildren .
label: nsubj aux advmod root case obl cc conj punct

text: Men 's shorts should be knee length or more , if worn at all .
label: nmod case nsubj aux cop compound root cc conj punct mark advcl case obl punct

text: Taking off one 's shoes at temples and private homes is mandatory etiquette , and this may even be requested at some shops .
label: csubj compound nmod case obj case obl cc amod conj cop amod root punct cc nsubj aux advmod aux conj case det obl punct

text: Wear shoes that slip on and off easily .
label: root obj nsubj acl compound cc conj advmod punct

text: Flip - flops , hiking sandals , and clog - type shoes are usually a good pragmatic choice for traveling in Thailand ;
label: compound punct nsubj punct compound conj punct cc compound punct compound conj cop advmod det amod amod root mark acl case obl punct

text: only in the most top - end establishments are shoes required .
label: advmod case det amod amod punct compound obl aux nsubj root punct

text: It is best to play it safe with wats and other sacred sites in Thailand ;
label: expl cop root mark csubj obj xcomp case obl cc amod amod conj case nmod punct

text: your dress should be unambiguously modest and cover your entire torso and most of your limbs .
label: nmod nsubj aux cop advmod root cc conj nmod amod obj cc conj case nmod obl punct

text: For men , ankle - length pants are mandatory ;
label: case obl punct compound punct compound nsubj cop root punct

text: on top , t - shirts are acceptable , though a button - front or polo shirt would be best .
label: case obl punct compound punct nsubj cop root punct mark det compound punct compound cc conj nsubj aux cop advcl punct

text: Many recommend that women wear only full length dresses and skirts ;
label: nsubj root mark nsubj ccomp advmod amod compound obj cc conj punct

text: you should make sure that your clothing covers at least your shoulders and your knees and some places may require that you wear ankle - length pants or skirts and long sleeved tops .
label: nsubj aux root xcomp mark nmod nsubj ccomp advmod fixed nmod obj cc nmod conj cc det nsubj aux conj mark nsubj ccomp compound punct compound obj cc conj cc amod amod conj punct

text: Shorts and sleeveless shirts are highly inappropriate , as are short skirts .
label: nsubj cc amod conj cop advmod root punct mark cop amod advcl punct

text: The rules are even more strict for foreign visitors , so even if you see a local in shorts it 's not OK for everyone .
label: det nsubj cop advmod advmod root case amod obl punct advmod advmod mark nsubj advcl det obj case nmod nsubj cop advmod parataxis case obl punct

text: Topless sunbathing is common by Western women at many tourist beaches .
label: amod nsubj cop root case amod obl case amod compound obl punct

text: At beaches which are primarily Thai visitors however , this is not advised .
label: case obl nsubj cop advmod amod acl advmod punct nsubj aux advmod root punct

text: Religion
label: root

text: Buddhist prayer flags , Wat Arun , Bangkok
label: amod compound root punct parataxis flat punct appos

text: Monks are an integral part of Buddhism in Thailand , and Thai men are generally expected to spend a certain amount of time living as a monk at least once in their lifetime .
label: nsubj cop det amod root case nmod case nmod punct cc amod nsubj aux advmod conj mark xcomp det amod obj case nmod advcl case det obl case obl advmod case nmod obl punct

text: Buddhist monks are meant to avoid sexual temptations , and in particular they do not touch women or take things from women 's hands .
label: amod nsubj aux root mark xcomp amod obj punct cc case obl nsubj aux advmod conj obj cc conj obj case nmod case obl punct

text: Women should make every effort to make way for monks on the street and give them room so they do not have to make contact with you .
label: nsubj aux root det obj mark acl obj case obl case det obl cc conj iobj obj mark nsubj aux advmod advcl mark xcomp obj case obl punct

text: Women should avoid offering anything to a monk with their hands .
label: nsubj aux root xcomp obj case det obl case nmod obl punct

text: Objects or donations should be placed in front of a monk so he can pick it up , or place it on a special cloth he carries with him .
label: nsubj cc conj aux aux root case obl case det nmod mark nsubj aux advcl obj compound punct cc conj obj case det amod obl nsubj acl case obl punct

text: Monks will sometimes be aided by a layman who will accept things from women merit - makers on their behalf .
label: nsubj aux advmod aux root case det obl nsubj aux acl obj case compound compound punct obl case nmod obl punct

text: Theravada Buddhist monks are also supposed to avoid material temptations and as such , are not allowed to touch money , so offering money to a monk is considered to be a sign of disrespect in most Theravada Buddhist cultures .
label: compound amod nsubj aux advmod root mark xcomp compound obj cc advmod fixed punct aux advmod conj mark xcomp obj punct advmod csubj obj case det obl aux parataxis mark cop det xcomp case nmod case amod compound amod obl punct

text: Therefore , should you wish to donate to a monk , you should only offer food , and put your monetary donation in the appropriate donation box at the temple .
label: advmod punct aux nsubj advcl mark xcomp case det obl punct nsubj aux advmod root obj punct cc conj nmod amod obj case det amod compound obl case det nmod punct

text: Those monks that accept money are almost always fakes .
label: det nsubj nsubj acl obj cop advmod advmod root punct

text: Tulsa
label: root

text: Tulsa is in the Green Country region of Oklahoma .
label: nsubj cop case det amod compound root case nmod punct

text: It is also called “ T - town ” by the locals and has been called the " Oil Capital of the World " .
label: nsubj aux advmod root punct compound punct xcomp punct case det nmod cc aux aux conj det punct compound obj case det nmod punct punct

text: The city had about 391,000 people and the metro area had about 937,000 people as of 2010 from the US Census Bureau .
label: det nsubj root advmod nummod obj cc det compound nsubj conj advmod nummod obj mark case advcl case det compound compound obl punct

text: The Tulsa Bartlesville Combined area had 988,000 in the 2010 census .
label: det compound compound compound nsubj root obj case det compound nmod punct

text: Understand
label: root

text: Tulsa lies in northeastern Oklahoma , at the convergence of the Great Plains and the Ozark Plateau , and receives an average of 40 inches of precipitation each year , both of which account for its abundant beautiful rolling green terrain .
label: nsubj root case amod obl punct case det obl case det compound nmod cc det compound conj punct cc conj det obj case nummod nmod case nmod det obl punct nsubj case nmod parataxis case nmod amod amod amod amod obl punct

text: As a result , Tulsa breaks the Oklahoma stereotype of being nothing but a flat , arid dust bowl .
label: case det obl punct nsubj root det compound obj nmod cop nsubj case det amod punct amod compound nmod punct

text: Summers can be very warm and with the cold wind across the plains it can get very cold in the winter , but it does not last long .
label: nsubj aux cop advmod root cc case det amod obl case det nmod nsubj aux conj advmod xcomp case det obl punct cc nsubj aux advmod conj advmod punct

text: The winters are considered to be very mild .
label: det nsubj aux root mark cop advmod xcomp punct

text: There is not much snow , just a few inches each year , typically , although in 2007 and again in 2008 there were rather large " ice storms " .
label: expl root advmod amod nsubj punct advmod det amod parataxis det obl punct advmod punct mark case obl cc advmod case conj expl advcl advmod amod punct compound nsubj punct punct

text: Tulsa has over 225 days of sunshine annually .
label: nsubj root advmod nummod obj case nmod advmod punct

text: In Tulsa you will find old west charm as well as a cosmopolitan atmosphere .
label: case obl nsubj aux root amod compound obj cc fixed fixed det amod conj punct

text: You will find the people of Tulsa love their city and they have that southern charm , so they are willing to help you find your way around .
label: nsubj aux root det nsubj case nmod ccomp nmod obj cc nsubj conj det amod obj punct advmod nsubj cop parataxis mark xcomp obj xcomp nmod obj advmod punct

text: Tulsa has one of the largest concentrations of Art Deco in the nation , having been a booming city during the 1920s when the architecture was first built by rich oil barons who built stately mansions and turned the Downtown area into a treasure trove of art .
label: nsubj root obj case det amod nmod case nmod flat case det nmod punct aux cop det amod advcl case det obl advmod det nsubj aux advmod advcl case amod compound obl nsubj acl amod obj cc conj det compound obj case det compound obl case nmod punct

text: Get in
label: root advmod

text: By plane
label: case root

text: Tulsa International Airport ( IATA : TUL ) in the northern part of Tulsa .
label: compound compound root punct compound punct appos punct case det amod nmod case nmod punct

text: It has major airlines with direct flights to major cities in the U.S.
label: nsubj root amod obj case amod nmod case amod nmod case det nmod

text: It is a small but nice airport with sofas and chairs all around and a very laid - back feel .
label: nsubj cop det amod cc conj root case nmod cc conj advmod advmod cc det advmod amod punct advmod conj punct

text: The car rental area and parking is well integrated .
label: det compound compound nsubj cc conj aux advmod root punct

text: The airport offers free short term parking ( first half - hour free ) .
label: det nsubj root amod amod compound obj punct amod compound punct parataxis amod punct punct

text: Richard L. Jones , Jr. Airport ( IATA : RVS ) ( often called the " Riverside Airport " ) is south of downtown and is a general aviation airport .
label: compound flat flat punct flat nsubj punct dep punct appos punct punct advmod acl det punct compound xcomp punct punct cop root case obl cc cop det amod compound conj punct

text: By train
label: case root

text: There is no passenger train service to Tulsa .
label: expl cop det compound compound root case nmod punct

text: By car
label: case root

text: Most Tulsans drive almost everywhere , although bus , bike , and pedestrian routes are starting to catch on .
label: amod nsubj root advmod advmod punct mark compound punct conj punct cc conj nsubj aux advcl mark xcomp compound punct

text: From the North / Kansas - US - 75 South from Bartlesville , OK , or US - 169 South from Coffeyville , KS .
label: case det nmod cc conj punct root punct dep compound case nmod punct appos punct cc conj punct dep compound case nmod punct appos punct

text: From the Northeast / Missouri - I - 44 West , aka the " Will Rogers Turnpike . "
label: case det nmod cc conj punct root punct dep flat punct advmod det punct compound flat appos punct punct

text: The world 's former largest McDonalds spans the roadway near Vinita , OK .
label: det nmod case amod amod nsubj root det obj case compound punct nmod punct

text: From the East / Arkansas - US - 412 West , aka the " Cherokee Turnpike . "
label: case det nmod cc conj punct root punct dep compound punct advmod det punct compound appos punct punct

text: From the Southeast / Arkansas - The " Muskogee Turnpike . "
label: case det nmod cc conj punct det punct compound root punct punct

text: From the South - US - 75 from Okmulgee , OK , aka the " Okmulgee Beeline . "
label: case det nmod punct root punct dep case nmod punct appos punct advmod det punct compound appos punct punct

text: From the West - US - 412 East , aka the " Cimarron Turnpike . "
label: case det nmod punct root punct dep compound punct advmod det punct compound appos punct punct

text: For the slow scenic route from Northeast or Southwest come in on old Route 66 .
label: case det amod amod obl case nmod cc conj root compound case amod obl nummod punct

label: case root

text: Greyhound Bus Lines +1918584-4428 , 317 S Detroit Ave. ( downtown ) .
label: compound compound root dep punct nummod compound compound dep punct compound punct punct

text: Get around
label: root advmod

text: Thanks to urban planning , the major city streets are placed in a grid layout .
label: obl case amod nmod punct det amod compound nsubj aux root case det compound obl punct

text: Almost all major intersections are one mile from each other , and exactly in a straight line .
label: advmod det amod nsubj cop nummod root case obl fixed punct cc advmod case det amod conj punct

text: That makes it much easier to find places than in cities where streets go every which way .
label: nsubj root obj advmod xcomp mark xcomp obj mark case advcl advmod nsubj acl det det obl punct

text: The major exception is downtown , which is slanted at almost a 45 degree angle to the rest of the grid .
label: det amod nsubj cop root punct nsubj cop acl case advmod det nummod compound obl case det obl case det nmod punct

text: By car
label: case root

text: Several freeways and bypasses can be used to easily get around the Tulsa Metro area : I - 244 , I - 44 , US 169 ( Mingo Valley Expressway , aka " Pearl Harbor Memorial Expressway " ) , US 75 , Hwy 51 ( Broken Arrow Expressway , The " B.A. " ) , Creek Turnpike .
label: amod nsubj cc conj aux aux root mark advmod advcl case det compound compound obl punct parataxis punct dep punct conj punct dep punct conj flat punct compound compound appos punct advmod punct compound compound compound appos punct punct punct conj flat punct conj flat punct compound compound appos punct det punct appos punct punct punct compound conj punct

text: The streets and avenues are planned on a 1 mile by 1 mile grid system , with the main arterials running on each mile .
label: det nsubj cc conj aux root case det nummod compound case nummod nmod compound obl punct mark det amod nsubj acl case det obl punct

text: In the core of the city , named avenues run north / south and are named after US cities , generally in repeating alphabetical order ( for example , Winston - Yale - Allegheny - Braden ) .
label: case det obl case det nmod punct amod nsubj root advmod cc conj cc aux conj case compound obl punct advmod case amod amod nmod punct case dep punct dep punct conj punct conj punct conj punct punct

text: In the mid-town area the names are taken from colleges and college towns .
label: case det compound obl det nsubj aux root case obl cc compound conj punct

text: North / South is divided by Admiral Blvd .
label: nsubj cc conj aux root case compound obl punct

text: Name streets East of Main are cities east of the Mississippi River , vice versa for name streets west of Main .
label: compound nsubj advmod case obl cop root advmod case det compound obl punct parataxis fixed case compound obl advmod case obl punct

text: In the parts of the city farther from downtown , north - south streets are numbered .
label: case det obl case det nmod amod case obl punct compound punct amod nsubj aux root punct

text: It is important to recognize that the specific format of the north - south numbered street names is North / South 145th East / West Avenue .
label: expl cop root mark csubj mark det amod ccomp case det compound punct amod amod compound nmod cop compound cc conj compound compound cc conj nsubj punct

text: Numbered streets run East / West with Main Street and the Arkansas River as the dividing line .
label: amod nsubj root advmod cc conj mark amod nsubj cc det compound conj case det amod advcl punct

text: Watch out for Place , Street , Avenue designation , e.g. 47th Place , 47th Street , or Florence Place , Florence Avenue .
label: root compound case compound punct compound punct compound obl punct advmod amod appos punct amod conj punct cc compound conj punct compound conj punct

text: It is important to recognize that the specific format of the east - west numbered street names is West / East 71st Street North / South .
label: expl cop root mark csubj mark det amod nsubj case det compound punct amod amod compound nmod cop compound cc conj compound ccomp compound cc conj punct

text: In some parts of the city , numbered streets intersect , so the distinction is important .
label: case det obl case det nmod punct amod nsubj root punct advmod det nsubj cop parataxis punct

text: Although rare , one east - west numbered street may even intersect with a street of the same number running north - south .
label: mark advcl punct nummod compound punct amod amod nsubj aux advmod root case det obl case det amod nmod acl compound punct advmod punct

text: Downtown streets were originally platted parallel to the Frisco railroad tracks .
label: compound nsubj aux advmod root xcomp case det compound compound obl punct

text: When Tulsa expanded beyond the bounds of its original plat , the expanded areas were platted in alignment with the points of the compass .
label: advmod nsubj advcl case det obl case nmod amod nmod punct det amod nsubj aux root case obl case det nmod case det nmod punct

text: Thus the " twisted " area down - town represents the original extent of Tulsa ca 1907 .
label: advmod det punct amod punct nsubj compound punct obl root det amod obj case nmod case nmod punct

text: By bus
label: case root

text: Tulsa Transit provides bus service for the Tulsa Metro area .
label: compound nsubj root compound obj case det compound compound nmod punct

text: Cities served are Tulsa , Sand Springs , Sapulpa , Jenks , and Broken Arrow .
label: nsubj acl cop root punct compound conj punct conj punct conj punct cc amod conj punct

text: The central station is at 319 S. Denver ( downtown ) .
label: det amod nsubj cop case nummod compound root punct compound punct punct

text: They do not run that often , especially to the outer towns like Broken Arrow .
label: nsubj aux advmod root advmod advmod punct advmod case det amod obl case amod nmod punct

text: Unlike major cities in the Northeast , the city bus is not a major form of transportation in the city .
label: case amod nmod case det nmod punct det compound nsubj cop advmod det amod root case nmod case det nmod punct

text: It is usually a means of travel for those who are without their own motor vehicle .
label: nsubj cop advmod det root case nmod case nmod nsubj acl case nmod amod compound obl punct

text: By bicycle
label: case root

text: Tulsa has an extensive interconnected paved bike trail system .
label: nsubj root det amod amod amod compound compound obj punct

text: Rivertrail follows the Arkansas River from downtown Tulsa south to the suburbs .
label: nsubj root det compound obj case amod obl advmod case det obl punct

text: The Katy Trail runs west to Sand Springs .
label: det compound nsubj root advmod case compound obl punct

text: The Osage Trail is a rails - to - trails route that begins at the OSU - Tulsa campus and travels north 15 miles to Skiatook .
label: det compound nsubj cop det compound punct case punct nmod root nsubj acl case det compound punct compound obl cc conj advmod nummod obl case obl punct

text: The Creek Trail connects Rivertrail and continues east through Broken Arrow to the NSU - Broken Arrow campus .
label: det compound nsubj root obj cc conj advmod case amod obl case det compound punct amod compound obl punct

text: Riders accustomed to flat terrain may find Tulsa 's rolling land to be a bit more challenging , particularly during the heat of summer .
label: nsubj amod case amod obl aux root nmod case amod obj mark cop det obl advmod xcomp punct advmod case det obl case nmod punct

text: If you are looking for a good workout , the Creek Turnpike Trail follows the land 's original contours .

text: Rivertrail is probably be best choice for the rider seeking an easy route .
label: nsubj cop advmod cop amod root case det nmod acl det amod obj punct

text: York
label: root

text: York is an ancient cathedral city with a history that dates back to before Roman times .
label: nsubj cop det amod compound root case det nmod nsubj acl advmod mark case amod advcl punct

text: It is situated in Yorkshire , North Yorkshire , England with some of the best preserved historical buildings and structures in Europe .
label: nsubj aux root case obl punct compound appos punct appos case obl case det advmod amod amod nmod cc conj case nmod punct

text: As of the 2001 census , the population of York was 181,000 .
label: advmod case det compound nmod punct det nsubj case nmod cop root punct

text: York is frequently ranked ( often vying with Manchester ) the second most visited city in England after London .
label: nsubj aux advmod root punct advmod advcl case obl punct det advmod advmod amod xcomp case nmod case obl punct

text: York Minster
label: root flat

text: Understand
label: root

text: York was known as Eboracum by the Romans , who founded the fortress city on the River Ouse in the year 71 .
label: nsubj aux root case obl case det obl punct nsubj acl det compound obj case det obl appos case det obl nummod punct

text: York was home first to the Ninth Legion and later the Sixth .
label: nsubj cop root advmod case det amod obl cc orphan det conj punct

text: York quickly became one of the most important cities in Roman Britain , and after 211 became the capital of the province Britannia Inferior .
label: nsubj advmod root xcomp case det advmod amod nmod case amod nmod punct cc case obl conj det xcomp case det nmod compound amod punct

text: Constantine the Great - later responsible for making Christianity the official religion of the Roman Empire - was first proclaimed Emperor in the city .
label: nsubj det amod punct advmod amod mark advcl obj det amod xcomp case det amod nmod punct aux advmod root xcomp case det obl punct

text: Captured by the Vikings 866 , the city quickly took on a new identity as Jorvik ( pronounced " Yor-vik " ) and experienced a major urban revival as a centre of Viking trade and settlement in northern England .
label: advcl case det obl obl punct det nsubj advmod root compound det amod obj case obl punct discourse punct obj punct punct cc conj det amod amod obj case det nmod case compound nmod cc conj case amod nmod punct

text: The Coppergate excavations of the 1970s revealed much of this Viking past .
label: det compound nsubj case det nmod root obj case det compound nmod punct

text: York is a fairly small city - four days is enough to see the major sights although York is a city that reveals its charms to explorers with curiosity and patience .
label: nsubj cop det advmod amod root punct nummod nsubj cop parataxis mark advcl det amod obj mark nsubj cop det advcl nsubj acl nmod obj case obl case nmod cc conj punct

text: York is known as England 's " City of Festivals " as there are regular cultural festivals every year .
label: nsubj aux root case nmod case punct obl case nmod punct mark expl advcl amod amod nsubj det obl punct

text: The official festivals are the Viking Festival , the Festival of Angels , Early Music , Late Music , Horse Racing ( the " Ebor Race Meeting " ) , Multicultural Food and Arts , Chinese New Year , Mystery Plays , Christmas St Nicholas ' Fair , and the Food and Drink Festival .
label: det amod nsubj cop det compound root punct det conj case nmod punct amod conj punct amod conj punct compound conj punct det punct compound compound appos punct punct punct amod conj cc conj punct amod compound conj punct compound conj punct compound compound nmod case conj punct cc det compound cc conj conj punct

text: It 's a romantic city for a weekend break .
label: nsubj cop det amod root case det compound nmod punct

text: York is full of magic and a wonderful place to bring children !
label: nsubj cop root case obl cc det amod conj mark acl obj punct

text: Get in
label: root advmod

text: Most travellers will arrive in York by road ( car or bus ) or rail from other parts of the UK or an airport .
label: amod nsubj aux root case obl case obl punct appos cc conj punct cc conj case amod obl case det nmod cc det conj punct

text: By car
label: case root

text: Although York is not directly on any of the main north - south motorways , the connections are reasonably good .
label: mark nsubj cop advmod advmod case advcl case det amod compound punct amod nmod punct det nsubj cop advmod root punct

text: From the south , the quickest route is probably to take the M1 northbound to junction 32 , then the M18 eastbound to junction 2 , the A1M northbound to junction 44 and finally the A64 eastbound to the York Outer Ring Road ( A1237 ) .
label: case det obl punct det amod nsubj cop advmod mark root det obj amod case obl dep punct advmod det conj amod case orphan dep punct det conj amod case orphan dep cc advmod det conj amod case det compound amod compound orphan punct appos punct punct

text: Alternatively , you can take the M1 all the way to the A64 , but the upper reaches of the M1 around Sheffield and Leeds can get very congested , especially in the rush hours .
label: advmod punct nsubj aux root det obj det det obl case det obl punct cc det amod nsubj case det nmod case nmod cc conj aux conj advmod xcomp punct advmod case det compound obl punct

text: From the west , the A59 and the M62 provide connections from Liverpool and Manchester , and from the north the A1 and the A19 link York with Tyneside , Northumberland and south - eastern Scotland .
label: case det obl punct det nsubj cc det conj root obj case nmod cc conj punct cc case det obl det nsubj cc det conj conj obj case obl punct conj cc compound punct amod conj punct

text: Driving into the city centre itself is something to avoid .
label: csubj case det compound obl nmod cop root mark acl punct

text: Traffic congestion on the main arterial roads serving the city ( especially the A19 on Bootham and the Inner Ring Road ) can get very bad , especially during the rush hours and on Saturday mornings .
label: compound nsubj case det amod amod nmod acl det obj punct advmod det parataxis case nmod cc det amod compound conj punct aux root advmod xcomp punct advmod case det compound obl cc case compound conj punct

text: The remodelling of some roads near bottleneck junctions to accommodate bicycle lanes has made traffic jams even worse still in recent years , and parking in the city centre is very expensive .
label: det nsubj case det nmod case compound nmod mark acl compound obj aux root compound obj advmod xcomp advmod case amod obl punct cc nsubj case det compound nmod cop advmod conj punct

text: If you are just visiting York for the day , using a Park and Ride [ 1 ] costs a lot less than trying to park in or near the city centre , and there are five sites dotted around the Outer Ring Road .
label: mark nsubj aux advmod advcl obj case det obl punct csubj det obj cc conj punct discourse punct root det obl obj mark advcl mark xcomp case cc conj det compound obl punct cc expl conj nummod nsubj acl case det amod compound obl punct

text: However , the last buses from the city centre leave at around 8 pm in the evenings and you are not allowed to leave your car in a Park and Ride overnight .
label: advmod punct det amod nsubj case det compound nmod root case advmod obl nmod case det obl cc nsubj aux advmod conj mark xcomp nmod obj case det obl cc conj advmod punct

text: Therefore , if you are staying overnight in York and arriving by car , make sure that your hotel offers parking before you book .
label: advmod punct mark nsubj aux advcl advmod case obl cc conj case obl punct root xcomp mark nmod nsubj ccomp obj mark nsubj advcl punct

text: If you are only visiting for the day but staying until late evening , you will need to use a city centre car park .
label: mark nsubj aux advmod advcl case det obl cc conj case amod obl punct nsubj aux root mark xcomp det compound compound compound obj punct

text: How to Detect Arrogant People
label: root mark acl amod obj

text: Do you always seem to cross paths with people who are stuck on themselves , intolerant of people different from them , rude or downright arrogant ?
label: aux nsubj advmod root mark xcomp obj case obl nsubj cop acl case obl punct conj case obl amod case obl punct conj cc advmod conj punct

text: These people can be a great source of potential pain , and this article is here to help you sort the arrogant from the not - so - arrogant .
label: det nsubj aux cop det amod root case amod nmod punct cc det nsubj cop conj mark advcl obj xcomp det obj case det advmod punct advmod punct obl punct

text: Steps
label: root

text: Pay attention to their conversations .
label: root obj case nmod obl punct

text: Do n't eavesdrop , but when they 're talking to you or to those around you , listen to them .
label: aux advmod root punct cc advmod nsubj aux advcl case obl cc case conj case nmod punct conj case obl punct

text: Is it always about them ?
label: cop nsubj advmod case root punct

text: Do they get mad or irritated if the centre of attention moves to someone else ?
label: aux nsubj root xcomp cc conj mark det nsubj case nmod advcl case obl advmod punct

text: These are good signs of arrogance .
label: nsubj cop amod root case nmod punct

text: Arrogance and smugness is often a reflection of limited life experience , and feeling concerned that those with greater life experience " have got something over them " .
label: nsubj cc conj cop advmod det root case amod compound nmod punct cc conj xcomp mark nsubj case amod compound nmod punct aux ccomp obj case obl punct punct

text: Rather than seeking to find out more through questions and learning ( actions viewed by them as showing vulnerability ) , arrogant people tend to generalize from their limited , narrow life experiences and try to impose their small worldview on others .
label: mark fixed advcl mark xcomp compound obj case obl cc conj punct appos acl case obl mark advcl obj punct punct amod nsubj root mark xcomp case nmod amod punct amod compound obl cc conj mark xcomp nmod amod obj case obl punct

text: Jealousy of your achievements or seeming lifestyle can cause another person to feel smug or arrogant about something they think they do better than you or own / have that you do n't .
label: nsubj case nmod nmod cc amod conj aux root det iobj mark xcomp xcomp cc conj case obl nsubj acl nsubj ccomp advmod case obl cc conj cc conj obj nsubj orphan advmod punct

text: Arrogant people have an extremely strong need to look good .
label: amod nsubj root det advmod amod obj mark acl xcomp punct

text: When you make them look bad - even if it is the slightest offense - they will usually be very mad at you .
label: advmod nsubj advcl obj xcomp xcomp punct advmod mark nsubj cop det amod ccomp punct nsubj aux advmod cop advmod root case obl punct

text: This happens when you question ( or at least seem to question ) their appearance , intelligence , athletic abilities , or anything else relating to their self - image .
label: nsubj root advmod nsubj advcl punct cc case obl conj mark xcomp punct nmod obj punct conj punct amod conj punct cc conj advmod acl case nmod compound punct obl punct

text: Challenge their worldview .
label: root nmod obj punct

text: Do n't be aggressive –– just skeptical and curious .
label: aux advmod cop root punct advmod parataxis cc conj punct

text: If they get upset , gauge their anger .
label: mark nsubj aux advcl punct root nmod obj punct

text: If it 's minimal , they may be simply having a bad day .
label: mark nsubj cop advcl punct nsubj aux aux advmod root det amod obj punct

text: But if they 're enraged , then they may see you as questioning their ' perfect little world . '
label: cc mark nsubj aux advcl punct advmod nsubj aux root obj mark advcl nmod punct amod amod obj punct punct

text: And having one of those is usually indicative of arrogance .
label: cc csubj obj case nmod cop advmod root case obl punct

text: At some point or another , most people realize that the world does n't revolve around them .
label: case det obl cc conj punct amod nsubj root mark det nsubj aux advmod ccomp case obl punct

text: Arrogant people counteract this by creating an atmosphere that revolves around them , and get angry if they 're reminded of the real world .
label: amod nsubj root obj mark advcl det obj nsubj acl case obl punct cc conj xcomp mark nsubj aux advcl case det amod obl punct

text: Ambiguity frightens arrogant people because it suggests imperfection , change and lack of certainty ( realities we all must contend with as best we can ) .
label: nsubj root amod obj mark nsubj advcl obj punct conj cc conj case nmod punct appos nsubj det aux acl obl advmod advmod nsubj advcl punct punct

text: As such , instead of accepting that the world behaves randomly and at times totally averse to one 's preferences , the arrogant person seeks to control everything and everyone , which of course , is an impossible mission .
label: case obl punct mark fixed advcl mark det nsubj ccomp advmod cc case obl advmod conj case nmod case obl punct det amod nsubj root mark xcomp obj cc conj punct nsubj advmod fixed punct cop det amod advcl punct

text: Reality hurts when it intrudes ; as such , an arrogant person is less likely than other people to self - reflect or analyse , thereby not seeing their own imperfections .
label: nsubj root advmod nsubj advcl punct case obl punct det amod nsubj cop advmod parataxis case amod obl mark compound punct xcomp cc conj punct advmod advmod advcl nmod amod obj punct

text: They may also give themselves undue credit for positive achievements instead of acknowledging the input of others or of circumstances .
label: nsubj aux advmod root iobj amod obj case amod obl mark fixed advcl det obj case nmod cc case conj punct

text: Learn the quality of their friendships .
label: root det obj case nmod nmod punct

text: Do n't be nosy or gossipy , but if they are happy with someone one day and hateful with them the next , that 's a sign of them having a lot of fair weather friends .
label: aux advmod cop root cc conj punct cc mark nsubj cop advcl case obl nummod obl cc conj case obl det obl punct nsubj cop det conj mark nsubj acl det obj case amod compound nmod punct

text: That 's a sign of arrogance , since it is very hard to be a truly good friend to someone who 's stuck on themselves .
label: nsubj cop det root case nmod punct mark expl cop advmod advcl mark cop det advmod amod csubj case nmod nsubj cop acl case obl punct

text: Prideful people have a strong need to look good , and being self - sufficient is an effective way to do that .
label: amod nsubj root det amod obj mark acl xcomp punct cc cop compound punct csubj cop det amod conj mark acl obj punct

text: Since being a good friend to someone usually means helping them , they often ca n't stand the thought of a good friendship .
label: mark cop det amod csubj case nmod advmod advcl ccomp obj punct nsubj advmod aux advmod root det obj case det amod nmod punct

text: Ironically , arrogant people often ca n't understand why they do n't have any reliable and supportive friends .
label: advmod punct amod nsubj advmod aux advmod root obj nsubj aux advmod advcl det amod cc conj obj punct

text: How do they treat those not like themselves ?
label: advmod aux nsubj root obj advmod case nmod punct

text: In other words , how do they treat those with different beliefs , cultural backgrounds and ways of seeing the world ?
label: case amod obl punct advmod aux nsubj root obj case amod nmod punct amod conj cc conj mark acl det obj punct

text: If it 's inherently negative , then they 're either over - zealous , ignorant of other people or what to avoid those that contradict their fantasy land that caters to them and them only .
label: mark nsubj cop advmod advcl punct advmod nsubj cop cc advmod punct root punct conj case amod obl cc conj mark acl obj nsubj acl nmod compound obj nsubj acl case obl cc conj advmod punct

text: Determine this based on their general personality and the people they 're interacting with .
label: root obj advcl case nmod amod obl cc det conj nsubj aux acl obl punct

text: Many times prideful people have a serious ' my - way 's - the - only - way ' attitude .
label: amod obl amod nsubj root det amod punct nmod punct nsubj cop punct det punct amod punct compound punct obj punct

text: This is simply a protective mechanism for their false image or their fantasy land .
label: nsubj cop advmod det amod root case nmod amod nmod cc nmod compound conj punct

text: What 's their personality like ?
label: root cop nmod nsubj case punct

text: Take note of how they act , talk , and use their social status .
label: root obj case obl nsubj advcl punct conj punct cc conj nmod amod obj punct

text: Do they have a general sense of ' coolness ? '
label: aux nsubj root det amod obj case punct nmod punct punct

text: Are they a chatterbox ?
label: cop nsubj det root punct

text: Do they act like they own the place , or act like the ' big dog ? '
label: aux nsubj root mark nsubj advcl det obj punct cc conj case det punct amod obl punct punct

text: Are they very keen on their self - image ?
label: cop nsubj advmod root case nmod compound punct obl punct

text: Many arrogant people have a false charm that no one seems to see through .
label: amod amod nsubj root det amod obj obl det nsubj acl mark xcomp case punct

text: But the arrogant person is usually more than happy to show their cruel side to those that they do n't like .
label: cc det amod nsubj cop advmod root case obl mark xcomp nmod amod obj case obl obj nsubj aux advmod acl punct

text: When they are cruel , their friends will usually ignore it or not do anything to stop it since they 're afraid that they 'll be treated badly by their ' friend . '
label: advmod nsubj cop advcl punct nmod nsubj aux advmod root obj cc advmod conj obj mark advcl obj mark nsubj cop advcl mark nsubj aux aux ccomp advmod case nmod punct obl punct punct

text: Mention people you know that they do n't like .
label: root obj nsubj acl mark nsubj aux advmod ccomp punct

text: This is n't meant to begin a conflict , but to gauge their rivalries , annoyances and enmities .
label: nsubj aux advmod root mark xcomp det obj punct cc mark conj nmod obj punct conj cc conj punct

text: If their condemnation seems to be reasonable , they probably are n't hubristic .
label: mark nmod nsubj advcl mark cop xcomp punct nsubj advmod cop advmod root punct

text: If it 's harsh , they are .
label: mark nsubj cop advcl punct nsubj root punct

text: For the most part , arrogant people see people that they do n't like as threats to their perfect little world .
label: case det amod obl punct amod nsubj root obj obj nsubj aux advmod acl case obl case nmod amod amod nmod punct

text: The more they hate someone , the more dangerous that person is to their fantasy land .
label: det advcl nsubj advcl obj punct det advmod root det nsubj advcl case nmod compound obl punct

text: And in turn , the bigger the threat , the harsher the criticism .
label: cc case obl punct det advcl det ccomp punct det root det ccomp punct

text: Ask around to see what they 've been saying about you .
label: root advmod mark advcl obj nsubj aux aux acl case obl punct

text: If they have been saying bad things about you , they may simply not like you .
label: mark nsubj aux aux advcl amod obj case obl punct nsubj aux advmod advmod root obj punct

text: If they 're nice to your face , but talk bad about you behind your back like it 's their favourite hobby , then they probably have a problem with pride .
label: mark nsubj cop advcl case nmod obl punct cc conj advmod case obl case nmod obl case nsubj cop nmod amod obl punct advmod nsubj advmod root det obj case nmod punct

text: Arrogant people often subconsciously know that they do n't have any good friends .
label: amod nsubj advmod advmod root mark nsubj aux advmod ccomp det amod obj punct

text: They compensate for this by creating the impression that they have a lot of friends - they have a ' quantity , not quality ' mentality .
label: nsubj root case obl mark advcl det obj mark nsubj acl det obj case nmod punct nsubj parataxis det punct compound punct advmod parataxis punct obj punct

text: Then they simply insult their trophy friends when they are n't looking .
label: advmod nsubj advmod root nmod compound obj advmod nsubj aux advmod advcl punct

text: How to Ballet Dance
label: root mark compound acl

text: Ballet began in royal courts in the early 1600's , and early forms of this elegant and sophisticated art involved long skirts and wooden clogs .
label: nsubj root case amod obl case det amod obl punct cc amod nsubj case det amod cc conj nmod conj amod obj cc amod conj punct

text: Dancing ballet is extremely popular throughout the world , and studying ballet can help develop strong bodies , spatial and temporal awareness , and improve coordination .
label: csubj obj cop advmod root case det obl punct cc csubj obj aux conj xcomp amod obj punct conj cc amod conj punct cc conj obj punct

text: People who study ballet also retain flexibility throughout their adult lives , making this technique the basis of training for all types of dance .
label: nsubj nsubj acl obj advmod root obj case nmod amod obl punct advcl det obj det xcomp case nmod case det nmod case nmod punct

text: While dancing ballet takes dedication and requires serious training , you can learn the basics to prepare yourself for further study .
label: mark csubj obj advcl obj cc conj amod obj punct nsubj aux root det obj mark advcl obj case amod obl punct

text: Learn to get ready for practicing , the basic positions , and some of the first techniques you 're likely to encounter in ballet .
label: root mark xcomp xcomp mark advcl punct det amod conj punct cc conj case det amod nmod nsubj cop acl mark xcomp case obl punct

text: Part 1 Getting Ready to Dance
label: root dep appos xcomp mark xcomp

text: Stretch your muscles thoroughly .
label: root nmod obj advmod punct

text: Stretching is important to loosen muscles , strengthen muscles and to elongate your posture .
label: csubj cop root mark advcl obj punct conj obj cc mark conj nmod obj punct

text: It is vital that it is done at the beginning of each ballet session , including before a performance .
label: expl cop root mark nsubj aux csubj case det obl case det compound nmod punct case case det obl punct

text: When taking on ballet , it is important to stretch daily for at least 15 - 30 minutes , to give the muscles ample opportunity to warm up , reducing the risk of injury .
label: advmod advcl compound obj punct expl cop root mark csubj advmod case case nmod nummod case nmod obl punct mark advcl det iobj amod obj mark acl compound punct advcl det obj case nmod punct

text: You should also stretch to " wind down " at the end of ballet dancing .
label: nsubj aux advmod root mark punct advcl compound punct case det obl case compound nmod punct

text: Always wear ballet slippers .
label: advmod root compound obj punct

text: Properly - fitted ballet shoes should be snug , but not so tight they cut off blood flow and create numbness in the feet .
label: advmod punct amod compound nsubj aux cop root punct cc advmod advmod conj nsubj advcl compound compound obj cc conj obj case det obl punct

text: There are different styles and types of shoes , so ask your ballet teacher or a salesman at the store for advice , given your intentions for dancing .
label: expl root amod nsubj cc conj case nmod punct advmod parataxis nmod compound iobj cc det conj case det obl case nmod punct advcl nmod obj case obl punct

text: Do n't buy shoes to grow into , because your feet will seem flexed when you pointe and will look flat .
label: aux advmod root obj mark acl obl punct mark nmod nsubj aux advcl xcomp advmod nsubj advcl cc aux conj xcomp punct

text: You should fit them to where the drawstring is tied slightly loose .
label: nsubj aux root obj case obl det nsubj aux advcl advmod amod punct

text: If your drawstring is longer than your pinkie then you should cut it off till it is roughly the size of your fingernail .
label: mark nmod nsubj cop advcl case nmod obl advmod nsubj aux root obj compound mark nsubj cop advmod det advcl case nmod nmod punct

text: The drawstring just completes the fit .
label: det nsubj advmod root det obj punct

text: It is n't made to tighten overly large shoes .
label: nsubj aux advmod root mark advcl advmod amod obj punct

text: If you ca n't buy ballet shoes , that it is okay .
label: mark nsubj aux advmod advcl compound obj punct reparandum nsubj cop root punct

text: Use socks without the stickies on the bottom , so you can turn !
label: root obj case det obl case det nmod punct mark nsubj aux advcl punct

text: Wear comfortable and snug - fitting athletic clothes .
label: root amod cc amod punct amod conj obj punct

text: The most important thing is that you are comfortable , and that you 're not wearing baggy or loose fitting clothing so you can make sure you 're forming and moving correctly in the mirror .
label: det advmod amod nsubj cop mark nsubj cop root punct cc mark nsubj aux advmod conj amod cc advmod conj obj mark nsubj aux advcl xcomp nsubj aux ccomp cc conj advmod case det obl punct

text: A plain black leotard and pink tights are usually a safe bet .
label: det amod amod nsubj cc amod conj cop advmod det amod root punct

text: Pink or black ballet slippers are also appropriate .
label: amod cc conj compound nsubj cop advmod root punct

text: If you 're signed up for a class , check with your instructor to find out if there is a dress code at the school .
label: mark nsubj aux advcl compound case det obl punct root case nmod obl mark advcl compound mark expl ccomp det compound nsubj case det obl punct

text: Some schools may have students wear the same thing and others may just require any type of leotard and tights and sometimes ballet skirts .
label: det nsubj aux root obj xcomp det amod obj cc nsubj aux advmod conj det obj case nmod cc conj cc advmod compound conj punct

text: Mostly they require tight fitting clothing so they can see that your muscles are working properly and so on .
label: advmod nsubj root amod amod obj mark nsubj aux advcl mark nmod nsubj aux ccomp advmod cc advmod conj punct

text: Find an appropriate space to practice .
label: root det amod obj mark acl punct

text: Ballet is less about learning the moves and more about perfecting them .
label: nsubj cop advmod mark root det obj cc advmod mark conj obj punct

text: The moves themselves are relatively straightforward , but the positing , the timing , and the elegance required takes a lifetime of practice .
label: det nsubj nmod cop advmod root punct cc det nsubj punct det conj punct cc det conj acl conj det obj case nmod punct

text: For this reason , it 's always better to practice ballet in a ballet studio under the guidance of a good instructor , who will be able to correct your positioning and make sure that you 're dancing properly .
label: case det obl punct expl cop advmod root mark csubj obj case det compound nmod case det obl case det amod nmod punct nsubj aux cop acl mark xcomp nmod obj cc conj xcomp mark nsubj aux ccomp advmod punct

text: A dancing studio is equipped with mirrors for correcting your positioning and seeing what you 're doing accurately , and a barre for practicing . [ 1 ]
label: det compound nsubj aux root case obl mark acl nmod obj cc conj obj nsubj aux acl advmod punct cc det conj mark acl punct punct dep punct

text: If you want to practice at home , make sure you 've got enough open space to move freely , preferably on a hard wood floor .
label: mark nsubj advcl mark xcomp case obl punct root xcomp nsubj aux ccomp amod amod obj mark acl advmod punct advmod case det amod compound obl punct

text: The back of a chair can replace the need for a bar .
label: det nsubj case det nmod aux root det obj case det nmod punct

text: Position a large mirror so you can check your positioning and see what you 're doing .
label: root det amod obj mark nsubj aux advcl nmod obj cc conj obj nsubj aux acl punct

text: How to Grow Basil
label: root mark acl obj

text: Three Methods : Starting Seeds Caring for Basil Harvesting and Using Basil
label: nummod root punct compound appos conj case obl conj cc conj obj

text: Basil is easy to grow , and transforms ordinary meals into culinary treasures !
label: nsubj cop root mark xcomp punct cc conj amod obj case amod obl punct

text: Fresh basil not only tastes better than dried , it actually tastes different , almost as if it were not the same herb .

text: This article outlines how to plant and harvest basil .

text: Method 1 of 3 : Starting Seeds
label: root dep case nmod punct compound appos

text: 1 Choose the kind of basil you wish to grow .
label: dep root det obj case nmod nsubj acl mark xcomp punct

text: Basil comes in many different varieties , each of which have a unique flavor and smell .
label: nsubj root case amod amod obl punct nsubj case nmod acl det amod obj cc conj punct

text: Read up on different types of basil and pick out one - or several - that appeal to you , then order the seeds or buy them at a garden store .
label: root compound case amod obl case nmod cc conj compound obj punct cc dep punct nsubj acl case obl punct advmod parataxis det obj cc conj obj case det compound obl punct

text: Here are a few ideas :
label: dep cop det amod root punct

text: Cinnamon basil really does smell like the sweet spice , and it also has unusually beautiful and fragrant flowers .
label: compound nsubj advmod aux root case det amod obl punct cc nsubj advmod conj advmod amod cc conj obj punct

text: Lemon basil actually contains citral , an aromatic compound found in citrus fruit , and smells very lemony .
label: compound nsubj advmod root obj punct det amod appos acl case amod obl punct cc conj advmod xcomp punct

text: Purple basil is often grown for decoration , as well as its scent and flowers .
label: amod nsubj aux advmod root case obl punct cc fixed fixed nmod conj cc conj punct

text: There are perennial basils which come back year after year , like African Blue Basil ( which has pretty blue veins on its leaves ) and Thai Basil , while most other varieties are annuals , which you 'll have to plant year after year .
label: expl root amod nsubj nsubj acl advmod obl case obl punct case compound compound nmod punct nsubj dep amod amod obj case nmod nmod punct cc compound conj punct mark advmod amod nsubj cop advcl punct obj nsubj aux acl mark xcomp obl case nmod punct

text: Globe and Greek basil are much more difficult to grow , but form pretty little bushes which stay well - contained .
label: nsubj cc amod conj cop advmod advmod root mark xcomp punct cc conj amod amod obj nsubj acl advmod punct xcomp punct

text: 2 Start seed indoors four to six weeks before last frost .
label: dep root obj advmod nummod case nmod obl case amod obl punct

text: Basil needs warm air and sun to do well , so it 's often easiest to start the seeds indoors instead of risking that they 'll get damaged by frost .
label: nsubj root amod obj cc conj mark advcl advmod punct advmod expl cop advmod parataxis mark csubj det obj advmod mark fixed advcl mark nsubj aux aux ccomp case obl punct

text: If you live in a hot climate , you can start the seeds outside instead .
label: mark nsubj advcl case det amod obl punct nsubj aux root det obj obl advmod punct

text: To figure out when the last frost will be , consult an almanac or talk with other gardeners in your area .
label: mark advcl compound ccomp det amod nsubj aux cop punct root det obj cc conj case amod obl case nmod nmod punct

text: 3 Prepare seed containers .
label: dep root compound obj punct

text: Fill flats or individual seed containers with a mixture of equal parts perlite , vermiculite , and peat .
label: root obj cc amod compound conj case det nmod case amod compound nmod punct conj punct cc conj punct

text: Press the mixture slightly to eliminate air pockets .
label: root det obj advmod mark advcl compound obj punct

text: Dampen the mixture with water so it 's ready to provide the right environment for the basil seeds to germinate .
label: root det obj case nmod mark nsubj cop advcl mark xcomp det amod obj case det compound nmod mark advcl punct

text: 4 Plant the seeds .
label: dep root det obj punct

text: Drop one to two seeds into each container .
label: root nummod case nmod obj case det obl punct

text: Cover them lightly with soil .
label: root obj advmod case obl punct

text: Cover containers with clear plastic kitchen wrap , so they stay moist .
label: root obj case amod amod compound obl punct mark nsubj advcl xcomp punct

text: Leave the containers in a sunny window .
label: root det obj case det amod obl punct

text: Twice daily , remove the plastic wrap and sprinkle the containers with more water .
label: advmod advmod punct root det compound obj cc conj det obj case amod obl punct

text: 5 Remove the plastic wrap when the sprouts emerge .
label: dep root det compound obj advmod det nsubj advcl punct

text: When you see the first green tendrils push up through the soil , it 's time to remove the plastic wrap .
label: advmod nsubj advcl det amod amod obj xcomp compound case det obl punct nsubj cop root mark acl det compound obj punct

text: Keep watering the sprouts twice daily , never letting the soil dry out .
label: root xcomp det obj advmod advmod punct advmod advcl det obj xcomp compound punct

text: When the plants become a few inches tall and their leaves mature , it 's time to transplant them to a larger container .
label: advmod det nsubj advcl det amod obl xcomp cc nmod nsubj conj punct nsubj cop root mark acl obj case det amod obl punct

text: Method 2 of 3 : Caring for Basil
label: root dep case nmod punct appos case obl

text: 1 Transplant the basil plants .
label: dep root det compound obj punct

text: Once two sets of leaves have formed , basil can be planted into the garden or permanent containers .
label: advmod nummod nsubj case nmod aux advcl punct nsubj aux aux root case det obl cc amod conj punct

text: Basil does not tolerate frost so do n't plant too early .
label: nsubj aux advmod root obj advmod aux advmod parataxis advmod xcomp punct

text: It 's best to put basil somewhere where it will get a good deal of sunshine and have well - drained soil .
label: expl cop root mark csubj obj advmod advmod nsubj aux advcl det amod obj case nmod cc conj advmod punct amod obj punct

text: To plant the basil in the garden , dig holes spaced at least 6 inches apart .
label: mark advcl det obj case det obl punct root obj acl case nmod nummod obl advmod punct

text: Place the roots in the holes and place soil around the stems .
label: root det obj case det nmod cc conj obj case det nmod punct

text: Pat down soil around the plants to eliminate air pockets .
label: root compound obj case det nmod mark advcl compound obj punct

text: If you want to plant the basil in a container , make sure it 's large enough to accommodate the number of plants you 're growing ;
label: mark nsubj advcl mark xcomp det obj case det nmod punct root xcomp nsubj cop ccomp advmod mark advcl det obj case nmod nsubj aux acl punct

text: they need to be planted 6 inches apart , since they grow quite large .
label: nsubj root mark aux xcomp nummod obl advmod punct mark nsubj advcl advmod xcomp punct

text: 2 Keep the soil damp , but not soaked .
label: dep root det obj xcomp punct cc advmod conj punct

text: Basil does best in well - drained soil , and should not be subjected to standing water .
label: nsubj root advmod case advmod punct amod obl punct cc aux advmod aux conj case amod obl punct

text: Water the mature basil plants once a day , in the morning , so the water has time to soak in and evaporate rather than sitting on the plants overnight .
label: root det amod compound obj advmod det obl punct case det obl punct mark det nsubj advcl obj mark acl compound cc conj cc fixed conj case det obl advmod punct

text: 3 Pinch off flower heads .
label: dep root compound compound obj punct

text: When you see flower buds , pinch them and two pairs of leaves under them off .
label: advmod nsubj advcl compound obj punct root obj cc nummod conj case nmod case nmod compound punct

text: Flowers blooming create a hormone change which dramatically reduces the flavor of the leaves , as well as reducing the amount of foliage which grows .
label: nsubj acl root det compound obj nsubj advmod acl det obj case det nmod punct cc fixed fixed conj det obj case nmod nsubj acl punct

text: This is called " bolting " and is more likely to happen when there 's extra sunshine .
label: nsubj aux root punct xcomp punct cc cop advmod conj mark xcomp advmod expl advcl amod nsubj punct

text: You 'll notice that if you leave the flowers , the plant will become lanky and the leaves wo n't be as full or tasty .
label: nsubj aux root mark mark nsubj advcl det obj punct det nsubj aux ccomp xcomp cc det nsubj aux advmod cop advmod conj cc conj punct

text: 4 Watch for pests and mold .
label: dep root case obl cc conj punct

text: Basil plants are attractive to Japanese beetles
label: compound nsubj cop root case amod obl

text: the best way to control these pests is to pick them off the plants by hand .
label: det amod nsubj mark acl det obj cop mark root obj case det obl case obl punct

text: If your plants show signs of mold growth , they may not be getting adequate sunlight , or they may be too close together .
label: mark nmod nsubj advcl obj case compound nmod punct nsubj aux advmod aux root amod obj punct cc nsubj aux cop advmod conj advmod punct

text: Weed out the smaller plants to give the larger ones more space .
label: root compound det amod obj mark advcl det amod iobj amod obj punct

text: Method 3 of 3 : Harvesting and Using Basil
label: root dep case nmod punct appos cc conj obj

text: 1 Harvest and prune .
label: dep root cc conj punct

text: As the plant matures , pinch off the top two pairs of leaves once a stalk reaches a reasonable height .
label: mark det nsubj advcl punct root compound det amod nummod obj case nmod mark det nsubj advcl det amod obj punct

text: If you look closely , at the base of every leaf are two tiny little leaves that will grow outwards if the stem growing between them is cut off .
label: mark nsubj advcl advmod punct case det obl case det nmod root nummod amod amod nsubj nsubj aux acl advmod mark det nsubj acl case obl aux advcl compound punct

text: Cut close to those tiny leaves , but be sure not to damage them .
label: root advmod case det amod obl punct cc cop conj advmod mark xcomp obj punct

text: Pinching encourages the plant 's energy to be directed into its stronger stems and leaves .
label: csubj root det nmod case obj mark aux xcomp case nmod amod obl cc conj punct

text: This helps the plants grow bushy .
label: nsubj root det obj xcomp xcomp punct

text: Do n't pinch on the lower part of the stem , or the basil plants will grow tall and reedy .
label: aux advmod root case det amod obl case det nmod punct cc det compound nsubj aux conj xcomp cc conj punct

text: You want them to get bushy , so pinch from the top .
label: nsubj root obj mark dep xcomp punct advmod parataxis case det obl punct

text: 2 Enjoy the basil fresh .
label: dep root det obj xcomp punct

text: Rinse off the leaves and use the basil to make pesto or a Caprese salad with tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese .
label: root compound det obj cc conj det obj mark advcl obj cc det compound conj case nmod cc amod compound conj punct

text: 3 Store the basil in the refrigerator .
label: dep root det obj case det obl punct

text: You 'll probably have more basil than you could possibly eat fresh , so plan on storing some in the fridge .

text: Wash the leaves , dry them well , and wrap them in paper towels .
label: root det obj punct conj obj advmod punct cc conj obj case compound obl punct

text: Place them in a food storage container with an airtight lid .
label: root obj case det compound compound obl case det amod nmod punct

text: 4 Freeze the basil .
label: dep root det obj punct

text: Freezing the leaves whole does n't work very well , but if you puree it first you can freeze it for months .
label: csubj det obj advmod aux advmod root advmod advmod punct cc mark nsubj advcl obj advmod nsubj aux conj obj case obl punct

text: Place the basil in a blender with a little water .
label: root det obj case det obl case det amod obl punct

text: Puree it until smooth , then put it in a food storage bag and freeze until you need it .
label: root obj mark advcl punct advmod parataxis obj case det compound compound obl cc conj mark nsubj advcl obj punct

text: How to Hypnotize a Chicken
label: root mark acl det obj

text: Anyone who 's spent a lot of time on a farm with chickens is probably familiar with this trick .
label: nsubj nsubj aux acl det obj case nmod case det obl case obl cop advmod root case det obl punct

text: Those who 've never heard of this will be amazed to see a chicken lie perfectly still after these instructions are followed .
label: nsubj nsubj aux advmod acl case obl aux aux root mark xcomp det nsubj ccomp advmod advmod mark det nsubj aux advcl punct

text: Biologists think that fear causes this " hypnosis , " which may be an attempt to " play dead " to fool predators .
label: nsubj root mark nsubj ccomp det punct obj punct punct nsubj aux cop det acl mark punct acl xcomp punct mark advcl obj punct

text: Method One of Two : Hypnotizing a Chicken
label: root dislocated case nmod punct appos det obj

text: Hold the chicken down on a flat surface .
label: root det obj compound case det amod obl punct

text: Hold the chicken with one hand supporting the breast .
label: root det obj mark nummod nsubj advcl det obj punct

text: Place it down so that its breast is carrying its weight and rests on the ground .
label: root obj compound mark fixed nmod nsubj aux advcl nmod obj cc conj case det obl punct

text: Continue to hold its feet so the grand experiment can continue .
label: root mark xcomp nmod obj mark det amod nsubj aux advcl punct

text: You can place the chicken on its breast instead .
label: nsubj aux root det obj case nmod obl advmod punct

text: Press gently down on its back , and gently move its legs back if it tries to stand up .
label: root advmod advmod case nmod obl punct cc advmod conj nmod obj advmod mark nsubj advcl mark xcomp compound punct

text: Wiggle your finger .
label: root nmod obj punct

text: Hold the bird down gently with one hand .
label: root det obj advmod advmod case nummod obl punct

text: Put one finger on your other hand just in front of its beak tip , without touching it .
label: root nummod obj case nmod amod obl advmod case obl case nmod compound nmod punct mark advcl obj punct

text: Move the finger backward to about 4 inches ( 10 cm ) away , then back again .
label: root det obj advmod case advmod nummod obl punct nummod appos punct advmod punct parataxis orphan orphan punct

text: Repeat until the chicken stops moving or squawking .
label: root mark det nsubj advcl xcomp cc conj punct

text: Let go of its legs .
label: root xcomp case nmod obl punct

text: The chicken should be " hypnotized " and cease to struggle .
label: det nsubj aux aux punct root punct cc conj mark xcomp punct

text: It will lie there for anywhere from 30 seconds to several minutes .
label: nsubj aux root advmod case obl case nummod obl case amod nmod punct

text: Draw a line in front of its beak instead .
label: root det obj case obl case nmod nmod advmod punct

text: If the chicken was n't hypnotized , try this alternative .
label: mark det nsubj aux advmod advcl punct root det obj punct

text: Using chalk , a stick , or your finger , draw a line on the ground 12 " ( 30 cm ) long .
label: advcl obj punct det conj punct cc nmod conj punct root det obj case det obl nummod obl punct nummod appos punct amod punct

text: Start near the chicken 's beak and draw the line slowly outward , in front of its head .
label: root case det nmod case obl cc conj det obj advmod advmod punct case obl case nmod nmod punct

text: Wake it up by clapping .
label: root obj compound mark advcl punct

text: Be nice to your feathered friend and let it get back to its business .
label: cop root case nmod amod obl cc conj obj xcomp advmod case nmod obl punct

text: Clap your hands or give it a gentle shove until it jumps up and walks away .
label: root nmod obj cc conj iobj det amod obj mark nsubj advcl advmod cc conj advmod punct

text: Method Two of Two : Reducing Stress in the Chicken
label: root dep case nmod punct appos obj case det obl

text: Understand the hypnotic effect .
label: root det amod obj punct

text: Researchers call this effect " tonic immobility " .
label: nsubj root det obj punct amod appos punct punct

text: " When a chicken or another animal with this tendency becomes frightened , its heart rate lowers and it stops moving .
label: punct advmod det nsubj cc det conj case det nmod advcl xcomp punct nmod compound nsubj root cc nsubj conj xcomp punct

text: This may be an attempt to play dead , discouraging predators that prefer live prey .
label: nsubj aux cop det root mark acl xcomp punct acl obj nsubj acl amod obj punct

text: Unlike an opossum , the chicken gives an unconvincing act , as it continues to blink and breathe in an obvious way . "
label: case det nmod punct det nsubj root det amod obj punct mark nsubj advcl mark xcomp cc conj case det amod obl punct punct

text: Keep the chicken upright or on its side .
label: root det obj xcomp cc case nmod conj punct

text: While it 's not uncommon to transport a chicken by its feet , this upside - down hold risks breaking the chicken 's hip .
label: mark expl cop advmod advcl mark csubj det obj case nmod obl punct det compound punct amod nsubj root conj det nmod case obj punct

text: Hypnosis techniques that involve laying a chicken on its back may " succeed " by cutting off its air supply .
label: compound nsubj nsubj acl ccomp det obj case nmod obl aux punct root punct mark advcl compound nmod compound obj punct

text: This can cause the chicken significant discomfort , leading to fainting or even , rarely , death .
label: nsubj aux root det iobj amod obj punct advcl case obl cc advmod punct advmod punct conj punct

text: Keep hypnosis short and infrequent .
label: root obj xcomp cc conj punct

text: It 's not completely clear how much stress this hypnosis causes .
label: expl cop advmod advmod root advmod amod obj det nsubj csubj punct

text: Even if it does , the chicken should n't suffer as long as you let it go soon afterward .
label: advmod mark nsubj advcl punct det nsubj aux advmod root advmod advmod mark nsubj advcl obj xcomp advmod advmod punct

text: Hours of stress , or regular exposure to stressful situations , can cause serious health problems .
label: nsubj case nmod punct cc amod conj case amod nmod punct aux root amod compound obj punct

text: Get your chickens used to humans and novelty .
label: root nmod obj xcomp case obl cc conj punct

text: Even prolonged eye contact seems to have an effect .
label: advmod amod compound nsubj root mark xcomp det obj punct

text: Living in stimulating environments with new objects may also help .
label: csubj case amod obl case amod nmod aux advmod root punct

text: Hens raise in battery cages stay " hypnotized " longer , possibly because of greater fear .
label: nsubj acl case compound obl root punct xcomp punct advmod punct advmod case fixed amod obl punct

text: Watch for signs of stress .
label: root case obl case nmod punct

text: Abnormal feathering , constant preening , or delays in egg - laying are all signs of a stressed chicken .
label: amod nsubj punct amod conj punct cc conj mark compound punct obl cop advmod root case det amod nmod punct

text: While hypnotizing is unlikely to cause serious harm , any type of stress is more damaging to a chicken in this state .
label: mark csubj cop advcl mark xcomp amod obj punct det nsubj case nmod cop advmod root case det obl case det obl punct

text: How to Annoy People in Elevators

text: An elevator is almost the perfect environment to be a prankster .

text: It ’s easy to annoy people when you are cramped in such a small , tight space .

text: Method 1 Using the Elevator to Annoy People
label: root dep appos det obj mark advcl obj

text: Push all the buttons .

text: When you get into the elevator , push the button for every floor .

text: This makes everyone ’s ride on the elevator longer , if only for a few seconds .
label: nsubj root nmod case obj case det nmod xcomp punct mark advmod case det amod nmod punct

text: If you want to take it a step further , look around questioningly at everyone in the elevator when no one gets off at the floors you pushed . [ 1 ]

text: Make a dinging noise at each floor .

text: You can even sing the word “ ding ” on each floor like notes in a scale , getting higher as you reach each new floor . [ 2 ]

text: Talk to your reflection in the mirror .

text: Many elevators have mirrors on the walls .

text: A great way to be mischievous in an elevator is to carry on a running commentary while you look at yourself in the mirror .

text: You could look at yourself , turning to catch different angles and say “ All right , all right , now we ’re talking , ” very loudly .

text: Dance to the elevator music .

text: How to Flirt Through Instant Messaging
label: root mark acl case amod obl

text: So you want to flirt with a guy or gal on MSN , AIM , Facebook Chat , or any other instant messaging service and you do n't want to look like a creep ?
label: discourse nsubj root mark xcomp case det obl cc conj case obl punct conj punct compound conj punct cc det amod amod compound conj cc nsubj aux advmod conj mark xcomp case det obl punct

text: Congratulations — by seeking help , you 've already demonstrated more self - awareness than the vast majority of online flirts .

text: See Step 1 below to start flirting smartly and respectfully .

text: Part 1 of 2 : Flirting Dos
label: root dep case nmod punct compound appos

text: Start the conversation casually .
label: root det obj advmod punct

text: As in the real world , the first step to flirting is to get over your cold feet and jump right in !
label: dep case det amod obl punct det amod nsubj mark acl cop mark root case nmod amod obl cc conj advmod compound punct

text: Text the other person a brief message asking them about their day , asking them a specific question about work or school , or simply saying " Hi ! " .
label: root det amod iobj det amod obj acl iobj case nmod obl punct conj iobj det amod obj case nmod cc conj punct cc advmod conj punct obj punct punct punct

text: The hardest part of flirting is to break through your initial reluctance , so if you 're having a hard time taking the plunge , just remind yourself that no matter how badly it goes , it 'll be less stressful than an equivalent real - world encounter .
label: det amod nsubj mark acl cop mark root case nmod amod obl punct advmod mark nsubj aux advcl det amod obj advcl det obj punct advmod parataxis iobj mark det obl advmod advmod nsubj acl punct nsubj aux cop advmod ccomp case det amod amod punct compound obl punct

text: There 's no reason to be nervous when it comes to IM flirting —
label: expl root det nsubj mark cop acl advmod nsubj advcl case compound obl punct

text: if the person you want to talk to does n't want to talk to you , s/he always has the option of simply not responding to your message , as , from your point of view , this is indistinguishable from him or her simply being away from the computer .
label: mark det nsubj nsubj acl mark xcomp obl aux advmod advcl mark xcomp case obl punct nsubj advmod root det obj mark advmod advmod acl case nmod obl punct mark punct case nmod obl case nmod punct nsubj cop advcl mark nsubj cc conj advmod advcl advmod case det obl punct

text: This being said , if you barely know someone , it can be a good idea to have an excuse for starting a conversation to avoid awkwardness .
label: nsubj aux advcl punct mark nsubj advmod advcl obj punct expl aux cop det amod root mark csubj det obj mark acl det obj mark advcl obj punct

text: Asking for help with a work or school - related problem is almost always a good bet , as is asking a question about something striking about the person .
