text: For instance , if the person has a band - related username , you might say : " Hey , cool name . Did you see those guys when they last came to town ? "
label: case obl punct mark det nsubj advcl det compound punct amod obj punct nsubj aux root punct punct discourse punct amod ccomp punct aux nsubj parataxis det obj advmod nsubj advmod advcl case obl punct punct

text: Start small talk .
label: root amod obj punct

text: After your initial greeting and exchange of pleasantries , you 'll probably want to ask how the person 's doing ( just like you might in the real world ) .
label: case nmod amod obl cc conj case nmod punct nsubj aux advmod root mark xcomp advmod det nsubj aux ccomp punct advmod mark nsubj advcl case det amod obl punct punct

text: Ask him or her about work or school , his / her interests , or any recent trips , for instance .
label: root iobj cc conj case nmod cc conj punct nmod cc conj conj punct cc det amod conj punct case obl punct

text: Rather than asking a question , you can also simply offer your comments on these things .
label: mark fixed advcl det obj punct nsubj aux advmod advmod root nmod obj case det obl punct

text: When s/he responds , add your own comments or ask follow - up questions and proceed from there !
label: advmod nsubj advcl punct root nmod amod obj cc conj compound punct compound obj cc conj case obl punct

text: Do n't pry into his or her personal life — keep things light , fun , and focused on worry - free subjects .
label: aux advmod root case nmod cc conj amod obl punct parataxis obj xcomp punct conj punct cc conj case compound punct amod obl punct

text: Do n't dwell too long on small talk .
label: aux advmod root advmod advmod case amod obl punct

text: A minute or two is great for breaking the ice , but much more can get boring fast .
label: det nsubj cc conj cop root mark advcl det obj punct cc advmod nsubj aux conj xcomp advmod punct

text: For example , after we 've opened up by asking about this person 's interest in the band in his / her username , it 's logical and reasonable to ask about this person 's musical likes and dislikes .
label: case obl punct mark nsubj aux advcl compound mark advcl case det nmod case obl case det nmod case nmod cc conj nmod punct expl cop root cc conj mark csubj case det nmod case amod obl cc conj punct

text: You can even offer your own opinions and suggestions .
label: nsubj aux advmod root nmod amod obj cc conj punct

text: For instance , you might say something like : " If you like those guys , you might want to check out this band called Manic Albatross - they 're like the Beatles , only darker . What sorts of other bands do you like ? "
label: case obl punct nsubj aux root obj mark punct punct mark nsubj advcl det obj punct nsubj aux acl mark xcomp compound det obj acl compound obj punct nsubj cop case det parataxis punct advmod conj punct det obj case amod nmod aux nsubj parataxis punct punct

text: Joke .
label: root punct

text: Everyone likes a good sense of humor .
label: nsubj root det amod obj case nmod punct

text: In the immortal words of Marilyn Monroe , " If you can make a woman laugh , you can make her do anything " ( do n't worry , ladies — the same is true for men ! )
label: case det amod obl case nmod flat punct punct mark nsubj aux advcl det obj xcomp punct nsubj aux root obj xcomp obj punct punct aux advmod parataxis punct dep punct det nsubj cop parataxis case obl punct punct

text: For instance , if you 're asked what you 're up to , rather than saying , " looking for people to hit on on Facebook " you might find that it 's a better idea to give a sarcastic answer like " writing the great American novel " or " drowning my sorrows " .
label: case obl punct mark nsubj aux advcl obl nsubj cop ccomp case punct mark fixed advcl punct punct ccomp case obl mark acl obl case obl punct nsubj aux root mark expl cop det amod ccomp mark csubj det amod obj mark punct acl det amod amod obj punct cc punct conj nmod obj punct punct

text: These responses have the added benefit of being natural launching points for conversations about your hobbies , like the writing you 're doing on the side and the great bourbon you tasted the other day .

text: Part 2 of 2 : Flirting Don'ts
label: root dep case nmod punct compound appos

text: Do n't be too self - deprecating .
label: aux advmod cop advmod compound punct root punct

text: Simply put , confidence is sexy .
label: advmod advcl punct nsubj cop root punct

text: This is more true for real - life situations than it is online , but this mantra has some truth in the world of IM flirting as well .
label: nsubj cop advmod root case amod punct compound obl mark nsubj advcl orphan punct cc det nsubj conj det obj case det nmod case compound nmod advmod fixed punct

text: For instance , you 'll want to avoid making lots of jokes at your own expense .

text: Just one is plenty — it should n't be a recurring theme throughout your conversation .
label: advmod nsubj cop parataxis punct nsubj aux advmod cop det amod root case nmod nmod punct

text: Doing this too often can quickly turn an otherwise flirtatious conversation into one in which you appear needy and self - loathing .
label: csubj obj advmod advmod aux advmod root det advmod amod obj case obl case obl nsubj acl xcomp cc compound punct conj punct

text: On the other hand , this is n't to say that you should necessarily make jokes at other people 's expense , as this can make you seem mean and petty .

text: Any sort of pointed or caustic remarks about yourself or someone else do n't have a place in flirtatious conversations .

text: Do n't be too sappy .

text: It can also make him or her question your motives , leading the person to believe that you may be trying to get something out of him or her .
label: nsubj aux advmod root obj cc conj xcomp nmod obj punct advcl det obj mark xcomp mark nsubj aux aux ccomp mark xcomp obj case fixed obl cc conj punct

text: Besides , the wooing power of flowery , gushing compliments is diminished ( to say the least ) when the compliments are displayed in a tiny box at the bottom of the screen alongside cartoon smiley faces .

text: Instead of relying too heavily on compliments , instead , focus on having an engaging , genuine conversation .

text: Follow the mantra " show , do n't tell . "

text: How to Make a Glowstick
label: root mark acl det obj

text: Those glowing Mountain Dew videos with peroxide and baking soda are all hoaxes .
label: det amod compound compound nsubj case nmod cc compound conj cop advmod root punct

text: To truly make a glowstick without breaking an already - made glowstick and shoving its contents into a tube ( also known as cheating ) , you 've got ta let your inner scientist out ( along with a few dollars ) .

text: Method One of Two : Using Luminol
label: root dislocated case nmod punct appos obj

text: Put on protective glasses .
label: root compound amod obj punct

text: In addition , wear gloves to protect your skin .
label: case obl punct root obj mark advcl nmod obj punct

text: It 's also a good idea to not wear your Sunday best .

text: Throw on some old clothes or put a smock over clothes you want protected .
label: root compound det amod obj cc conj det obj case obl nsubj acl xcomp punct

text: Some of this stuff is dangerous -- this experiment is not meant for children !

text: Listen up , kids : You 'll be working with a solution that 's near a 12 on the pH scale .

text: That basically means do n't swallow it , do n't put it in your eyes , do n't bathe in it , and do n't really expose yourself to it directly at all .

text: Moving on .
label: root compound punct

text: Combine 50 milliliters of hydrogen peroxide and a liter of distilled water in a mixing bowl .
label: root nummod obj case compound nmod cc det conj case amod nmod case det compound nmod punct

text: A ceramic bowl will work best , but plastic works too .
label: det amod nsubj aux root advmod punct cc nsubj conj advmod punct

text: Use funnels , measuring tubes , and basters to keep everything well - measured and well away from you .

text: Hydrogen peroxide is used to replace the luminol 's nitrogen atoms with oxygen .

text: When that happens , all the substances create a rave and start partying and electrons fly everywhere and what results ?

text: The glow .
label: det root punct

text: Mix .2 grams of luminol , 4 grams of sodium carbonate , .4 grams of copper sulfate , .5 grams of ammonium carbonate and 1 liter ( 0.3 US gal ) of distilled water in a second bowl .
label: root nummod obj case nmod punct nummod conj case compound nmod punct nummod conj case compound nmod punct nummod conj case compound nmod cc nummod conj punct nummod compound appos punct case amod nmod case det amod nmod punct

text: It is important not to touch the luminol .

text: Use a funnel to make everything safe and easy .

text: Unfortunately , these hazardous chemicals will not float freely in mid-air like this graphic suggests .

text: Yep , unless you 're a coroner or some sort of crazy spy / criminologist you probably do n't have this stuff lying around the house ( hopefully not ... ) .

text: Do n't use your hands -- use a metal or plastic utensil of some sort .

text: Clean the containers and dry them thoroughly .

text: It 's important to use sanitary , clean tubes for your glowsticks .

text: Tips

text: How to Pack Your Possessions When Moving
label: root mark acl nmod obj advmod advcl

text: Even if you ca n't wait to live in your new house , curb your enthusiasm and resist the urge to cram all your possessions any which way into boxes .
label: advmod mark nsubj aux advmod advcl mark xcomp case nmod amod obl punct root nmod obj cc conj det obj mark acl det nmod obj det det obl case obl punct

text: Steps
label: root

text: Pack one room at a time if possible , and start with items that are least often used .
label: root nummod obj case det obl mark advcl punct cc conj case obl nsubj aux advmod advmod acl punct

text: Write down a list of everything you are packing , in particular if it 's valuable .
label: root compound det obj case nmod nsubj aux acl punct case obl mark nsubj cop advcl punct

text: Books , CDs , expensive clothes .
label: root punct conj punct amod conj punct

text: Also , take note of which item is in which box .
label: advmod punct root obj mark det nsubj cop case det acl punct

text: Use sturdy boxes .
label: root amod obj punct

text: Fill the box to the brim and seal the lid .
label: root det obj case det obl cc conj det obj punct

text: That way , you can easily stack boxes on top of one another .
label: det obl punct nsubj aux advmod root obj case obl case nmod fixed punct

text: Tape the bottom of the box securely so that it does n't give way .
label: root det obj case det nmod advmod mark fixed nsubj aux advmod advcl obj punct

text: Never fill a box until it is so heavy that you ca n't lift it safely .
label: advmod root det obj mark nsubj cop advmod advcl mark nsubj aux advmod advcl obj advmod punct

text: Spread the heavy items over a few boxes .
label: root det amod obj case det amod nmod punct

text: Balance boxes with lighter items like towels or soft toys .
label: root obj case amod obl case nmod cc amod conj punct

text: Pack the lighter items on top .
label: root det amod obj case nmod punct

text: Use bubble wrap or newspapers when packing fragile items .
label: root compound obj cc conj advmod advcl amod obj punct

text: However , newsprint may smudge so use newspaper selectively .
label: advmod punct nsubj aux root advmod parataxis obj advmod punct

text: Clean paper can be purchased cheaply from moving supply stores .
label: amod nsubj aux aux root advmod case amod compound obl punct

text: Mark boxes .
label: root obj punct

text: Boxes should be marked " Fragile " and " This side up " to prevent mishandling .
label: nsubj aux aux root punct xcomp punct cc punct det conj advmod punct mark advcl obj punct

text: Label each box clearly and which room it belongs to .
label: root det obj advmod cc det obl nsubj conj case punct

text: Write on the sides of the box as well .
label: root case det obl case det nmod advmod fixed punct

text: Pack a separate box of essentials you may need for the first night at your new house .
label: root det amod obj case nmod nsubj aux acl case det amod obl case nmod amod nmod punct

text: Include items like toiletries , toilet paper , bottled water , snacks and a change of clothes in case you can not unpack everything in time .
label: root obj case obl punct compound conj punct amod conj punct conj cc det conj case nmod mark dep nsubj aux advmod advcl obj case obl punct

text: Tips
label: root

text: Do n't label boxes with contents if the contents are valuable .
label: aux advmod root obj case obl mark det nsubj cop advcl punct

text: Instead of writing " Silver Service - Fragile " you should write something that makes it sound less theft inviting while showing the fragile nature of the contents .
label: mark fixed advcl punct amod obj punct dep punct nsubj aux root obj nsubj acl obj xcomp amod obj acl mark advcl det amod obj case det nmod punct

text: Example : " Mom 's old dishes " instead of " Fine China "
label: root punct punct nmod case amod parataxis punct case fixed punct amod nmod punct

text: Tape is cheap .
label: nsubj cop root punct

text: Use lots of it .
label: root obj case nmod punct

text: Close box bottoms well .
label: root compound obj advmod punct

text: Get masking tape or packing tape and tape screws and other little things that came out of something back against it .
label: root compound obj cc compound conj cc conj obj cc amod amod conj nsubj acl case fixed obl advmod case obl punct

text: You 'll want to find the right screw reassemble something without having to pick it out of 100 others when you get there .
label: nsubj aux root mark xcomp det amod obj advcl obj mark advcl mark xcomp obj case fixed nummod obl advmod nsubj advcl advmod punct

text: Do n't pack one box full of books or paperwork - you might not be able to carry it at all .
label: aux advmod root nummod obj amod case obl cc conj punct nsubj aux advmod cop parataxis mark xcomp obj case obl punct

text: Fill it halfway with books , and fill it up with lighter stuff .
label: root obj advmod case obl punct cc conj obj compound case amod obl punct

text: National superstores ( Walmart ) will let you walk the store for boxes when they are stocking the stores between 11 pm and 1 am .
label: amod nsubj punct appos punct aux root obj xcomp det obj case obl advmod nsubj aux advcl det obj case obl nmod cc conj nmod punct

text: You can find boxes of all sizes .
label: nsubj aux root obj case det nmod punct

text: Cereal , diaper and houseware boxes are a good size and durable .
label: compound punct conj cc conj nsubj cop det amod root cc conj punct

text: Just take a cart and roam the store .
label: advmod root det obj cc conj det obj punct

text: They do check the cart as you leave so do n't try to sneak anything past them .
label: nsubj aux root det obj mark nsubj advcl advmod aux advmod parataxis mark xcomp obj case obl punct

text: U-haul and other nation companies offer box buy back services .
label: nsubj cc amod compound conj root compound compound compound obj punct

text: If you buy too many boxes you can return the unused for a full refund .
label: mark nsubj advcl advmod amod obj nsubj aux root det obj case det amod obl punct

text: These boxes are also quite sturdy so you can re-use them or stash in your attic until you move again .
label: det nsubj cop advmod advmod root advmod nsubj aux parataxis obj cc conj case nmod obl mark nsubj advcl advmod punct

text: Some national companies even offer free shipping and handling so you can have some delivered or go to the local location .
label: det amod nsubj advmod root amod obj cc conj mark nsubj aux advcl obj acl cc conj case det amod obl punct

text: Fill empty spaces with additional paper .
label: root amod obj case amod obl punct

text: Throw away or donate junk you do n't want to take to your new place .
label: root advmod cc conj obj nsubj aux advmod acl mark xcomp case nmod amod obl punct

text: Do n't pack it again ! ! !
label: aux advmod root obj advmod punct punct punct

text: Set aside an area of the house where you can put all the packed boxes .
label: root compound det obj case det nmod advmod nsubj aux acl det det amod obj punct

text: Use a room that is n't used every day such as the formal dining or living room .
label: root det obj nsubj aux advmod acl det obl case fixed det amod nmod cc compound conj punct

text: You wo n't be tripping over boxes and you can have a better idea of what you have and where things are .
label: nsubj aux advmod aux root case obl cc nsubj aux conj det amod obj case nmod nsubj acl cc advmod nsubj conj punct

text: Pack books and heavy items into smaller boxes .
label: root obj cc amod conj case amod obl punct

text: Digital Photos - use your camera to document the contents of boxes .
label: amod parataxis punct root nmod obj mark advcl det obj case nmod punct

text: How to Cope With a Double Parachute Failure
label: root mark acl case det amod compound obl

text: While skydiving , it is possible ( yet extremely unlikely ) that both your primary and reserve parachutes will malfunction , leaving you with no method of reducing your velocity .
label: mark advcl punct expl cop root punct cc advmod conj punct mark cc nmod nsubj cc compound conj aux csubj punct advcl obj case det obl mark acl nmod obj punct

text: In the vast majority of cases , this will not occur ; nevertheless , in this event these coping strategies may assist .
label: case det amod obl case nmod punct nsubj aux advmod root punct advmod punct case det obl det compound nsubj aux parataxis punct

text: Steps
label: root

text: Remain calm .
label: root xcomp punct

text: This may seem obvious , but deep , even breathing ( despite the rushing slipstream ) and controlling your heart - rate are essential to your continued survival .
label: nsubj aux root xcomp punct cc amod punct amod nsubj punct case det amod obl punct cc conj nmod compound punct obj cop conj case nmod amod obl punct

text: Entreat assistance .
label: root obj punct

text: If both your primary and reserve chutes have malfunctioned , signal immediately to a fellow jumper who has not yet deployed their chute , waving your arms and signalling that your own is not functional .
label: mark cc nmod amod cc conj nsubj aux advcl punct root advmod case det amod obl nsubj aux advmod advmod acl nmod obj punct advcl nmod obj cc conj mark nmod nsubj cop advmod ccomp punct

text: If this is a solo jump , then skip to step 6 .
label: mark nsubj cop det amod advcl punct advmod root case obl nummod punct

text: Prepare for deployment .
label: root case obl punct

text: After linking arms with your fellow jumper , you will need to hook your arms through their chest strap , or through both sides of the front of their harness , as far as you can , then grab onto your own strap .
label: mark advcl obj case nmod amod obl punct nsubj aux root mark xcomp nmod obj case nmod compound obl punct cc case det conj case det nmod case nmod nmod punct advmod advmod mark nsubj advcl punct advmod parataxis case nmod amod obl punct

text: Deploy .
label: root punct

text: The shock of the chute deployment will be intense .
label: det nsubj case det compound nmod aux cop root punct

text: The G - forces will multiply your body weight , making it impossible to hold on ; this is why hooking your arms through the harness is essential .
label: det compound punct nsubj aux root nmod compound obj punct advcl obj amod mark xcomp obl punct nsubj cop advmod csubj nmod obj case det obl cop parataxis punct

text: It is likely that the shock will dislocate or break both your arms ; nevertheless this is a small price to pay for your life .
label: expl cop root mark det nsubj aux csubj cc conj det nmod obj punct advmod nsubj cop det amod parataxis mark acl case nmod obl punct

text: Prepare for impact .
label: root case obl punct

text: If your companion 's canopy has successfully opened , then both your chances of survival have dramatically increased .
label: mark nmod nmod case nsubj aux advmod advcl punct advmod det nmod nsubj case nmod aux advmod root punct

text: With a large and slow canopy , your chances are even better .
label: case det amod cc conj obl punct nmod nsubj cop advmod root punct

text: The canopy must be steered away from power lines and similar obstructions ; try for a large body of water if you are confident your companion can save you from drowning .
label: det nsubj aux aux root advmod case compound obl cc amod conj punct parataxis case det amod obl case nmod mark nsubj cop advcl nmod nsubj aux ccomp obj mark advcl punct

text: Alternative : Lack of companions
label: root punct appos case nmod

text: If this is a solo jump , which constitutes the minority of skydivers , your only recourse is to ensure that at least one of your own chutes opens .
label: mark nsubj cop det amod advcl punct nsubj acl det obj case nmod punct nmod amod nsubj cop mark root mark case nmod nsubj case nmod amod nmod ccomp punct

text: In this case , the excellent advice offered by your instructors on assisting chute opening may be of assistance to you .
label: case det nmod punct det amod nsubj acl case nmod obl mark advcl compound obj aux cop case root case nmod punct

text: If it becomes apparent that you can not open either of your two parachutes , or that for some other reason they are fatally non-functional , then the following steps may be of some minor assistance .
label: mark expl advcl xcomp mark nsubj aux advmod csubj obj case nmod nummod nmod punct cc mark case det amod nmod nsubj cop advmod conj punct advmod det amod nsubj aux cop case det amod root punct

text: Appeal .
label: root punct

text: If you are of a religious turn of mind , you may wish at this point to offer a prayer to a god , goddess , protective spirit or guardian angel .
label: mark nsubj cop case det amod advcl case nmod punct nsubj aux root case det obl mark xcomp det obj case det obl punct conj punct amod conj cc compound conj punct

text: St Jude , the patron saint of Lost Causes , comes to mind .
label: nsubj flat punct det compound appos case amod nmod punct root case obl punct

text: Objectively , this is not likely to help very much ; but it may improve your emotional state .
label: advmod punct nsubj cop advmod root mark xcomp advmod advmod punct cc nsubj aux conj nmod amod obj punct

text: If you do not have any religious beliefs , or are for another reason unwilling to appeal to your patron deity , skip this step .
label: mark nsubj aux advmod advcl det amod obj punct cc cop case det obl conj mark xcomp case nmod compound obl punct root det obj punct

text: Contemplate .
label: root punct

text: As you approach the Earth at , or close to , terminal velocity , you may wish to contemplate your past existence , and the possibility of a future afterlife .
label: mark nsubj advcl det obj case punct cc conj obl punct amod obl punct nsubj aux root mark xcomp nmod amod obj punct cc det conj case det amod nmod punct

text: A strategy that might prove helpful is to consider how fortunate you are that life has been good to you so far .
label: det nsubj nsubj aux acl xcomp cop mark root advmod obj nsubj advcl mark nsubj aux cop ccomp case obl advmod advmod punct

text: Alternatively , if life has not been good to you so far , ( and considering your current situation this seems more likely ) consider how lucky you are that it will not be troubling you much longer .
label: advmod punct mark nsubj aux advmod cop advcl case obl advmod advmod punct punct cc advcl nmod amod obj nsubj conj advmod xcomp punct root advmod obj nsubj advcl mark nsubj aux advmod aux ccomp obj advmod advmod punct

text: Expect impact .
label: root obj punct

text: You are unlikely to have the time or ability to aim for a soft landing - spot , body of water , or other impact site that might improve your chances of survival .
label: nsubj cop root mark xcomp det obj cc conj mark acl case det amod compound punct obl punct conj case nmod punct cc amod compound conj nsubj aux acl nmod obj case nmod punct

text: There is a minuscule chance that your impact will result in non-life-threatening injuries ; if this seems incredibly far - fetched , comfort yourself that double chute failure in modern times is also extremely unlikely , and that you have already beaten worse odds .
label: expl root det amod nsubj mark nmod nsubj aux acl case amod obl punct mark nsubj advcl advmod advmod punct xcomp punct parataxis obj mark amod compound nsubj case amod nmod cop advmod advmod acl punct cc mark nsubj aux advmod conj amod obj punct

text: Tips
label: root

text: Your reserve chute should have been packed by a certified rigger and is moderately less likely to fail ; therefore , it may be helpful to focus your efforts on opening your reserve parachute .
label: nmod compound nsubj aux aux aux root case det amod obl cc cop advmod advmod conj mark xcomp punct advmod punct expl aux cop parataxis mark csubj nmod obj mark advcl nmod compound obj punct

text: Some humans who have , for various reasons , become aware of their impending death , develop psychological coping strategies to deal with this ; for instance , the Kubler - Ross phases of grief .
label: det nsubj nsubj aux punct case amod obl punct acl amod case nmod amod obl punct root amod compound obj mark acl case obl punct case nmod punct det compound punct flat parataxis case nmod punct

text: Since your own death approaches far more quickly , this is unlikely to be of any use to you .
label: mark nmod amod nsubj advcl advmod advmod advmod punct nsubj cop root mark cop case det xcomp case nmod punct

text: Warnings
label: root

text: Water landings : if you have successfully attached to a companion whose chute opens , keep in mind that both your arms may be broken or dislocated , and you may be unable to swim or tread water before your chute fills and drags you under .
label: compound root punct mark nsubj aux advmod advcl case det obl nmod nsubj acl punct parataxis case obl mark det nmod nsubj aux aux ccomp cc conj punct cc nsubj aux cop conj mark xcomp cc conj obj mark nmod nsubj advcl cc conj obj compound punct

text: If , after total chute failure , you land on something soft , it is possible that instead of being killed outright , you may be permanently paralyzed due to spinal injury .
label: mark punct case amod compound obl punct nsubj advcl case obl amod punct expl cop root mark mark fixed aux advcl advmod punct nsubj aux aux advmod csubj case fixed amod obl punct

text: If you have a strong aversion to this outcome , aiming head - downward before impact in the manner of an Olympic diver may ensure the destruction of your cranium and your immediate demise .
label: mark nsubj advcl det amod obj case det nmod punct csubj nsubj punct advcl case obl case det obl case det amod nmod aux root det obj case nmod nmod cc nmod amod conj punct

text: How to Stop Procrastinating
label: root mark acl xcomp

text: If you 're a chronic procrastinator , you know the pain and stress that comes with putting things off .
label: mark nsubj cop det amod advcl punct nsubj root det obj cc conj nsubj acl mark advcl obj compound punct

text: Although you may have the desire to accomplish something , getting the motivation to do it is a different matter .
label: mark nsubj aux advcl det obj mark acl obj punct csubj det obj mark acl obj cop det amod root punct

text: Fortunately , overcoming your procrastination is easy to do when you put your mind to it .
label: advmod punct root nmod obj cop csubj mark xcomp advmod nsubj advcl nmod obj case obl punct

text: Side note : If you have anything due right now , and you have n't finished it , leave this article and complete that work .
label: compound root punct mark nsubj advcl obj xcomp advmod advmod punct cc nsubj aux advmod conj obj punct dep det obj cc conj det obj punct

text: Steps
label: root

text: Create a to - do list .
label: root det case punct compound obj punct

text: Yes , make yourself an old fashioned to - do list with check boxes and everything .
label: discourse punct root iobj det compound amod case punct compound obj case compound nmod cc conj punct

text: List everything , big and small , that you have to do for your entire day ; break big activities into smaller bits if necessary .
label: root obj punct amod cc conj punct obj nsubj acl mark xcomp case nmod amod obl punct parataxis amod obj case amod obl mark advcl punct

text: Then , as you work through your day , check off each of the items on your list .
label: advmod punct mark nsubj advcl case nmod obl punct root compound obj case det nmod case nmod nmod punct

text: You will feel a growing sense of pride as you visually monitor your ever - diminishing list of projects .
label: nsubj aux root det amod obj case nmod mark nsubj advmod advcl nmod advmod punct amod obj case nmod punct

text: Focus your list on including the things you typically put off , not the things you are sure to do on a regular basis .
label: root nmod obj mark advcl det obj nsubj advmod acl compound punct advmod det appos nsubj cop acl mark xcomp case det amod obl punct

text: If necessary , set time - frames for your items to be done by .
label: mark advcl punct root compound punct obj case nmod nmod mark aux acl obl punct

text: For example , list “ take the dog for a walk by 12:30 ” rather than simply “ walk the dog . ”
label: case obl punct root punct ccomp det obj case det obl case obl punct cc fixed advmod punct conj det obj punct punct

text: Re-evaluate your list halfway through your day to rank your items based on highest priority .
label: root nmod obj advmod case nmod obl mark advcl nmod obj advcl case amod obl punct

text: Then , tackle the most important ones before looking back at the smaller things to do .
label: advmod punct root det advmod amod obj mark advcl advmod case det amod obl mark acl punct

text: Keep a notebook by hand before you start your workday .
label: root det obj case obl mark nsubj advcl nmod obj punct

text: Write every thought down that comes up during work .
label: root det obj compound nsubj acl compound case obl punct

text: Every single to do or things you want to do at that specific moment .
label: det root mark acl cc conj nsubj acl mark xcomp case det amod obl punct

text: Do n't do it , put it on a list and do it later .
label: aux advmod root obj punct parataxis obj case det obl cc conj obj advmod punct

text: This prevents you from getting into the " procrastination zone . "
label: nsubj root obj mark advcl case det punct compound obl punct punct

text: Finish the hard stuff .
label: root det amod obj punct

text: When you have a looming project that 's bogging you down and making you unproductive in other areas , tackle it first .
label: advmod nsubj advcl det amod obj nsubj aux acl obj compound cc conj obj xcomp case amod obl punct root obj advmod punct

text: Finishing the largest item on your list of things to do will make you feel extra productive and give you the boost to do other things you ’ve been pushing to the side .
label: csubj det amod obj case nmod nmod case nmod mark acl aux root obj xcomp advmod xcomp cc conj iobj det obj mark acl amod obj nsubj aux aux acl case det obl punct

text: If your “ big project ” is something that ca n’t be done in one sitting , make a list of small parts of it that you can accomplish today .
label: mark nmod punct amod nsubj punct cop advcl nsubj aux advmod aux acl case nummod obl punct root det obj case amod nmod case nmod obj nsubj aux acl obl punct

text: Do n’t worry about completing the entire thing , but take steps now so that doing so in the future is a breeze .
label: aux advmod root mark advcl det amod obj punct cc conj obj advmod mark fixed csubj advmod case det obl cop det advcl punct

text: Make an ultimate to - do list for this single project , and have it placed somewhere you will see it on a regular basis .
label: root det amod case punct compound obj case det amod obl punct cc conj obj xcomp obj nsubj aux advcl obj case det amod obl punct

text: As you mark things off , you will be motivated to continue doing so , and seeing it on a regular basis will remind you that your project needs to be done .
label: mark nsubj advcl obj compound punct nsubj aux aux root mark xcomp xcomp advmod punct cc csubj obj case det amod obl aux conj iobj mark nmod nsubj ccomp mark aux xcomp punct

text: Do two - minute tasks .
label: root nummod punct compound obj punct

text: Whenever you are presented with something that you do n’t want to do or would consider putting off , ask yourself , “ will this take me less than two minutes to finish ? ”
label: advmod nsubj aux advcl case obl obj nsubj aux advmod acl mark xcomp cc aux conj xcomp compound punct root iobj punct punct aux nsubj ccomp obj advmod fixed nummod obl mark advcl punct punct

text: For many of us , this includes small chores , like taking out the trash or pulling a few weeds , but can include simple tasks in all areas of life .
label: case obl case obl punct nsubj root amod obj punct mark acl compound det obj cc conj det amod obj punct cc aux conj amod obj case det obl case nmod punct

text: Anything that you want to put off but takes two minutes to do - do it .
label: dislocated obj nsubj acl mark xcomp compound cc conj nummod obj mark advcl punct root obj punct

text: Simply force yourself to use the next 120 seconds to be productive and do the duty you normally would push off for hours or days . [ 1 ] .
label: advmod root obj mark xcomp det amod nummod obj mark cop advcl cc conj det obj nsubj advmod aux dep compound case obl cc conj punct punct dep punct punct

text: Create a timed work frenzy .
label: root det amod compound obj punct

text: If you find yourself being pulled off into the depths of daydreams , set a period of time to do nothing but work .
label: mark nsubj advcl obj aux xcomp compound case det obl case nmod punct root det obj case nmod mark acl obj case nmod punct

text: Take ten minutes and remove all distractions - your phone , magazines , or thoughts of your attractive love - and go into a working frenzy .
label: root nummod obj cc conj det obj punct nmod conj punct conj punct cc conj case nmod amod nmod punct cc conj case det amod obl punct

text: Force yourself to work productively for ten minutes , and then go back to whatever it was you were doing .
label: root obj mark xcomp advmod case nummod obl punct cc advmod conj advmod case obl nsubj acl nsubj aux acl punct

text: Chances are , you ’ll get into a groove and keep working at a high pace even when your frenzy time is out .
label: nsubj cop punct nsubj aux root case det obl cc conj xcomp case det amod obl advmod advmod nmod compound nsubj cop advcl punct

text: Working with a timer is generally regarded by most experts as being one of the best ways to develop self - discipline and stop procrastination .
label: csubj case det obl aux advmod root case amod obl mark cop advcl case det amod nmod mark acl compound punct obj cc conj obj punct

text: The most famous method of working to strict time controls ( known as time - boxing ) involves creating a list of tasks .
label: det advmod amod nsubj mark acl case amod compound obl punct dep case compound punct obl punct root xcomp det obj case nmod punct

text: Each task is then assigned an exact amount of time to complete .
label: det nsubj aux advmod root det amod obj case nmod mark advcl punct

text: If you do n't finish the task in the allotted time , then you move on to the next one .
label: mark nsubj aux advmod advcl det obj case obl acl obl punct advmod nsubj root compound case det amod obl punct

text: Using this work arrangement , it forces you to take action , as you ca n't afford to waste any time . [ 2 ] .
label: advcl det compound obj punct nsubj root obj mark xcomp obj punct mark nsubj aux advmod advcl mark xcomp det obj punct punct dep punct punct

text: Give yourself a break .
label: root iobj det obj punct

text: If you ca n’t seem to focus and are working half - heartedly at your tasks , give yourself a brief break .
label: mark nsubj aux advmod advcl mark xcomp cc aux conj obl punct parataxis case nmod obl punct root iobj det amod obj punct

text: Set a timer for ten minutes , and take a nap , read a book , or call your friend .
label: root det obj case nummod nmod punct cc conj det obj punct conj det obj punct cc conj nmod obj punct

text: Do whatever it is you ’ve been daydreaming about so that the temptation is removed once you get back to work .
label: root obj nsubj acl nsubj aux aux acl obl mark fixed det nsubj aux advcl mark nsubj advcl advmod case obl punct

text: Just be sure to follow through with your deadline rather than ignoring it when your alarm finally goes off .
label: advmod cop root mark xcomp compound case nmod obl cc fixed conj obj advmod nmod nsubj advmod advcl compound punct

text: How to Play Muggle Quidditch
label: root mark acl compound obj

text: In the Harry Potter series written by JK Rowling the main wizarding sport is Quidditch .
label: case det compound flat nmod acl case obl flat det amod amod nsubj cop root punct

text: However you do n't have to have magical powers to play .
label: advmod nsubj aux advmod root mark xcomp amod obj mark advcl punct

text: There are many different ways of playing Quidditch , but the most commonly used set of rules are those given by the International Quidditch Association ( which can be found here ) .
label: expl root amod amod nsubj mark acl obj punct cc det advmod advmod amod nsubj case nmod cop conj acl case det amod compound obl punct nsubj aux aux acl advmod punct punct

text: In the past Muggle Quidditch has mainly been played at colleges in the US , but over the last few years there has been a dramatic rise in the number of community teams .
label: case det obl compound nsubj aux advmod aux root case obl case det nmod punct cc case det amod amod obl expl aux conj det amod nsubj case det nmod case compound nmod punct

text: Quidditch has also spread outside of America and is now played on 5 continents .
label: nsubj aux advmod root advmod case obl cc aux advmod conj case nummod obl punct

text: Steps
label: root

text: Gather all needed materials and players ( see Things You 'll Need section below ) .
label: root det amod obj cc conj punct parataxis compound nsubj aux acl obj advmod punct punct

text: Know that all players can play while riding a broom .
label: root mark det nsubj aux ccomp mark advcl det obj punct

text: Brooms can be a hindrance however , so feel free to not use brooms .
label: nsubj aux cop det root advmod punct advmod parataxis xcomp mark advmod xcomp obj punct

text: Place the quaffle and three bludgers in the middle of the field .
label: root det obj cc nummod conj case det nmod case det nmod punct

text: Ideally the quaffle and bludgers should be slightly deflated so that they are easier to throw and catch .
label: advmod det nsubj cc conj aux aux advmod root mark fixed nsubj cop advcl mark xcomp cc conj punct

text: Start the game .
label: root det obj punct

text: Both teams start from the edges and attempt to obtain the quaffle and bludgers .
label: det nsubj root case det obl cc conj mark xcomp det obj cc conj punct

text: Follow your duty depending what type of player you are :
label: root nmod obj case det obl case nmod nsubj acl punct

text: Chasers try to score by throwing the quaffle into one of the three goal hoops .
label: nsubj root mark xcomp mark advcl det obj case obl case det nummod compound nmod punct

text: Each score is worth 10 points .
label: det nsubj cop root nummod obj punct

text: Beaters try to peg players with their bludger .
label: nsubj root mark xcomp obj case nmod obl punct

text: If a player is pegged they have to stop what they 're doing and pay a penalty ; i.e. ( drop the quaffle in the case of a chaser ) and run back to and touch their goal post or alternatively sit down for 10 seconds .
label: mark det nsubj aux advcl nsubj root mark xcomp obj nsubj aux acl cc conj det obj punct advmod punct parataxis det obj case det obl case det nmod punct cc conj advmod obl cc conj nmod compound obj cc advmod conj compound case nummod obl punct

text: Keepers guard the goal posts at each end and attempt to block chasers ' attempts at scoring .
label: nsubj root det compound obj case det nmod cc conj mark xcomp nmod case obj mark acl punct

text: If Keeper is close to their hoops they are safe from being hit by bludgers .
label: mark nsubj cop advcl case nmod obl nsubj cop root mark aux advcl case obl punct

text: Seekers try to tackle the snitch ( a person ) or obtain an object attached to the snitch such as a sock or flag .
label: nsubj root mark xcomp det obj punct det appos punct cc conj det obj acl case det obl case fixed det nmod cc conj punct

text: You can establish you own rules as to how a player catches the snitch .
label: nsubj aux root nmod amod obj case fixed nmod det nsubj advcl det obj punct

text: A common way to play is to make the snitch a person , and give the snitch a head start to run and hide in defined boundaries .
label: det amod nsubj mark acl cop mark root det obj det xcomp punct cc conj det iobj det compound obj mark acl cc conj case amod obl punct

text: Then the seekers search for the snitch , and attempt to tag the player .
label: advmod det nsubj root case det obl punct cc conj mark xcomp det obj punct

text: Other methods , such as the method adopted in 2005 , makes the snitch a tennis ball in a sock , hanging out of the running shorts of the snitch runner .
label: amod nsubj punct case fixed det nmod acl case obl punct root det obj det compound xcomp case det nmod punct acl case fixed det compound obl case det compound nmod punct

text: Regardless of method , the winning seeker wins 30 points for his or her team , unlike the books , in which the snitch is worth 150 points .
label: advmod case obl punct det amod nsubj root nummod obj case nmod cc conj obl punct case det obl punct case obl det nsubj cop acl nummod obj punct

text: The creators of Muggle Quidditch thought that it was worth too many points so changed the value of the snitch for muggle Quidditch .
label: det nsubj case compound nmod root mark nsubj cop ccomp advmod amod obj advmod parataxis det obj case det nmod case compound obl punct

text: The snitch , generally a track runner , runs around ( usually the boundaries ) trying to evade the seekers .
label: det nsubj punct advmod det compound appos punct root case punct advmod det obl punct advcl mark xcomp det obj punct

text: The referee should ensure that rules are being followed .
label: det nsubj aux root mark nsubj aux aux ccomp punct

text: They also keep track of the score .
label: nsubj advmod root obj case det nmod punct

text: Play the game !
label: root det obj punct

text: The object of the game is to score the most points and the game ends when the seeker snatches the snitch .
label: det nsubj case det nmod cop mark root det amod obj cc det nsubj conj advmod det nsubj advcl det obj punct

text: Feel free to alter the game rules .
label: root xcomp mark xcomp det compound obj punct

text: See the Tips section for suggestions .
label: root det compound obj case obl punct

text: Video
label: root

text: How to Play a Real - Life Game of Quidditch
label: root mark acl det amod punct compound obj case nmod

text: You do n't need flying broomsticks or magic balls to play this version of the game - it 's tailor - made for muggles like us .
label: nsubj aux advmod root amod obj cc amod conj mark advcl det obj case det nmod punct nsubj cop compound punct parataxis case obl case nmod punct

text: This video shows a more realistic approach to playing Quidditch .
label: det nsubj root det advmod amod obj mark acl obj punct

text: Tips
label: root

text: Alternatively the snitch can be a small yellow ball ( tennis balls work great ) that is hidden before the game starts by a bystander or referee .
label: advmod det nsubj aux cop det amod amod root punct compound nsubj parataxis advmod punct nsubj aux acl mark det nsubj advcl case det obl cc conj punct

text: Establish boundaries and have the seekers look for the snitch .
label: root obj cc conj det obj xcomp case det obl punct

text: Beaters can try hitting the bludgers around in the air with a shortened hockey sticks or a short bat .
label: nsubj aux root xcomp det obj advmod case det obl case det amod compound obl cc det amod conj punct

text: They could also use regular - length hockey sticks to hit bludgers ( perhaps wiffle balls ) on the ground .
label: nsubj aux advmod root amod punct compound compound obj mark advcl obj punct advmod compound appos punct case det nmod punct

text: The simplest way is to just peg players by throwing dodge balls .
label: det amod nsubj cop mark advmod root obj mark advcl obj goeswith punct

text: It may be easier to play without brooms ( but also less fun ! ) .
label: expl aux cop root mark csubj case obl punct cc advmod advmod conj punct punct punct

text: Remember that the snitch runner , if you choose to use one , is not an actual player in the game , therefore , not bound by any of the rules .
label: root mark det compound nsubj punct mark nsubj advcl mark xcomp obj punct cop advmod det amod ccomp case det nmod punct advmod punct advmod acl case obl case det nmod punct

text: If desired , the snitch is able to do whatever he or she wants to avoid capture .
label: mark advcl punct det nsubj cop root mark xcomp obj nsubj cc conj acl mark advcl obj punct

text: See How to Be a Snitch in Quidditch for more information .
label: root obj mark cop det acl case nmod case amod obl punct

text: You can play water quidditch in a pool .
label: nsubj aux root compound obj case det obl punct

text: Almost all the same rules apply .
label: advmod det det amod nsubj root punct

text: Have someone throw something ( the snitch ) on a line into the pool at regular intervals .
label: root obj xcomp obj punct det appos punct case det obl case det obl case amod nmod punct

text: They can even use fake snitches .
label: nsubj aux advmod root amod obj punct

text: You can buy authentic looking brooms to make the game more realistic .
label: nsubj aux root xcomp amod obj mark advcl det obj advmod xcomp punct

text: There is a very large Quidditch community , have a look at the IQA website to find teams near you .
label: expl root det advmod amod compound nsubj punct parataxis det obj case det compound nmod mark advcl obj case nmod punct

text: One variation is Quarter Snitch Quidditch .
label: nummod nsubj cop compound compound root punct

text: Find a quarter or another small coin .
label: root det obj cc det amod conj punct

text: Have both of the teams turn around and have the referee throw it into the grass or pitch while the teams are n't looking .
label: root obj case det nmod xcomp advmod cc conj det obj xcomp obj case det obl cc conj mark det nsubj aux advmod advcl punct

text: Play while the seekers look for the snitch .
label: root mark det nsubj advcl case det obl punct

text: Another variation is where the referee places the snitch somewhere in the field ( in this case it 's a small ball ) .
label: det nsubj cop advmod det nsubj root det obj advmod case det obl punct case det nmod nsubj cop det amod appos punct punct

text: The seeker has to find the snitch blindfolded , relying only on the coach 's instructions , while the game is still on .
label: det nsubj root mark xcomp det obj advcl punct advcl advmod case det nmod case obl punct mark det nsubj cop advmod advcl punct

text: Warnings
label: root

text: Stay hydrated and exercise wisely .
label: root xcomp cc conj advmod punct

text: A ball flying in the air can hurt .

text: If you 're playing quidditch you 're probably just having fun so play nicely .

text: How to Prepare Quinoa
label: root mark acl obj

text: Quinoa is known as the little rice of Peru .
label: nsubj aux root case det amod obl case nmod punct

text: The Incas treated the crop as sacred and referred to quinoa as " chisaya mama " or " mother of all grains . " [ 1 ]
label: det nsubj root det obj case obl cc conj case obl case punct obl flat punct cc punct conj case det nmod punct punct punct dep punct

text: By tradition , the Inca emperor would sow the first seeds of the season using " golden implements . "
label: case obl punct det compound nsubj aux root det amod obj case det nmod advcl punct amod obj punct punct

text: Quinoa is rich in protein and much lighter than other grains .
label: nsubj cop root case obl cc advmod conj case amod obl punct

text: It is much easier to prepare than rice and is rapidly gaining in popularity , especially among vegetarians who value its high protein levels .
label: nsubj cop advmod root mark xcomp case obl cc aux advmod conj case obl punct advmod case obl nsubj acl nmod amod compound obj punct

text: Ingredients
label: root

text: 1 cup quinoa
label: nummod nmod root

text: 2 cups water ( or broth )
label: nummod nmod root punct cc conj punct

text: Olive oil to taste ( Optional )
label: compound root case obl punct parataxis punct

text: 1/2 teaspoon salt ( Optional )
label: nummod nmod root punct parataxis punct

text: Method 1 Cooking On A Stove Top
label: root dep appos case det compound obl

text: Rinse the grains of quinoa in water .
label: root det obj case nmod case obl punct

text: You can skip this step if you have purchased pre-rinsed quinoa in a box .
label: nsubj aux root det obj mark nsubj aux advcl amod obj case det nmod punct

text: To rinse , place the measured grain in a strainer under running water for a few minutes .
label: mark advcl punct root det amod obj case det obl case amod obl case det amod obl punct

text: This is necessary to remove the excess saponins on the outside of the grains which impart a bitter flavor to quinoa if not removed .
label: nsubj cop root mark advcl det amod obj case det nmod case det nmod nsubj acl det amod obj case obl mark advmod advcl punct

text: Toast quinoa in a saucepan ( optional ) .
label: root obj case det obl punct parataxis punct punct

text: Drizzle a bit of olive oil in a pan over medium - high heat .
label: root det obj case compound nmod case det obl case amod punct amod nmod punct

text: Add the quinoa and cook for about 1 minute .
label: root det obj cc conj case advmod nummod obl punct

text: This brings out quinoa 's nutty flavor .
label: nsubj root compound nmod case amod obj punct

text: Cook the quinoa .
label: root det obj punct

text: Place two parts water or stock to one part of quinoa in a saucepan over medium - high heat and bring to a boil .
label: root nummod obj nmod cc conj case nummod obl case nmod case det obl case amod punct amod nmod cc conj case det obl punct

text: Cover and reduce heat to low .
label: root cc conj obj case obl punct

text: Simmer the quinoa for about 15 minutes or until the grain becomes translucent and the white germ forms a visible spiral on the exterior of the quinoa grain .
label: root det obj case advmod nummod obl cc mark det nsubj conj xcomp cc det amod nsubj conj det amod obj case det obl case det compound nmod punct

text: Try to ensure there is an al dente bite to the germ , in the same way as pasta .
label: root mark xcomp expl ccomp det amod flat nsubj case det obl punct case det amod obl case nmod punct

text: Quinoa will continue cooking for a bit even after you take it off the heat .
label: nsubj aux root xcomp case det obl advmod mark nsubj advcl obj case det obl punct

text: Take the quinoa off the heat and let stand , covered , for 5 minutes .
label: root det obj case det obl cc conj xcomp punct advcl punct case nummod obl punct

text: This will give it time to absorb any moisture that might still be in the pan .
label: nsubj aux root iobj obj mark acl det obj nsubj aux advmod acl case det obl punct

text: Uncover and fluff with a fork .
label: root cc conj case det obl punct

text: The quinoa should look light and fluffy , and you should be able to see the germ separating from the seed .
label: det nsubj aux root xcomp cc conj punct cc nsubj aux cop conj mark xcomp det obj acl case det obl punct

text: Serve .
label: root punct

text: Freshly cooked quinoa should be served immediately to retain nutritional value and a good flavor .
label: advmod amod nsubj aux aux root advmod mark advcl amod obj cc det amod conj punct

text: Serve with :
label: root obl punct

text: Stir - fry , using the quinoa as a substitute for rice .
label: compound punct root punct advcl det obj case det obl case nmod punct

text: Curry .
label: root punct

text: Braised meat .
label: amod root punct

text: In a salad .
label: case det root punct

text: Virtually any other combination you can think of !
label: advmod det amod root nsubj aux acl obl punct

text: Method 2 Cooking In a Rice Cooker
label: root dep appos case det compound obl

text: Rinse 1 cup of quinoa in a fine mesh sieve under cold water .
label: root nummod obj case nmod case det amod compound obl case amod obl punct

text: If you bought packaged quinoa , this step is n't always necessary , but it 's better to be safe than sorry .
label: mark nsubj advcl amod obj punct det nsubj cop advmod advmod root punct cc expl cop conj mark cop csubj case obl punct

text: Pour quinoa into rice cooker .
label: root obj case compound obl punct

text: One option is to toast the quinoa before placing in the rice cooker .
label: nummod nsubj cop mark root det obj mark advcl case det compound obl punct

text: See Step # 2 in Method One above for directions .
label: root obj compound dep case nmod dislocated advmod case obl punct

text: Add 2 cups of liquid and 1/2 teaspoon of salt into the rice cooker .
label: root nummod obj case nmod cc nummod conj case nmod case det compound obl punct

text: Water , chicken stock or broth , or vegetable stock all work .
label: nsubj punct compound conj cc conj punct cc compound conj advmod root punct

text: Cook for approximately 15 minutes .
label: root case advmod nummod obl punct

text: Some rice cooker will have different settings instead of a simple " cook " option .
label: det compound nsubj aux root amod obj case fixed det amod punct compound punct nmod punct

text: Try the " white rice " option if your rice cooker gives you several options .
label: root det punct amod compound punct obj mark nmod compound nsubj advcl iobj amod obj punct

text: Let stand for about 5 minutes .
label: root xcomp case advmod nummod obl punct

text: Fluff with a fork and serve .
label: root case det obl cc conj punct

text: Method 3 Cooking In the Oven
label: root dep appos case det obl

text: Preheat oven to 350 ° F ( 177 ° C ) .
label: root obj case nummod obl compound punct nummod appos compound punct punct
